review_body: Clean, Modern, extremely lavish. Strong smell of body odor in the hallway though , elevator sounded a lil shabby, but overall great for an amazing price! Bed linens were extra fluffy, parking is a Lil’ expensive, but it’s NYC!

My sister was due to graduate in May. We had family from France flying to NY for the event. I had booked two hotels rooms for family to come and celebrate. The graduation was cancelled along with the rest of our travel plans. All of our flights were refunded except for the hotel. I originally booked a non-refundable rate which I understand the terms of that, however, these are extenuating circumstances, some that no one could predict. All I was allowed was a voucher for this specific hotel to be used within a year. My family from France certainly does not plan on flying here anytime soon and I am a healthcare worker still working many overtime hours taking care of those in need. I most likely will not be able to book these rooms again and will lose out on over a thousand dollars. Many businesses have been flexible during these times, I most certainly will be bringing my business elsewhere than the Gallivant Times Square.

I enjoyed my stay at the Gallivant. Nice & friendly staff. The room was cozy & comfortable. Upgraded my room from a Full to a King bed, with no problem. Close to Radio City Music Hall & other Times Square attractions. I didn't have to venture far at all. I will definitely stay at the Gallivant again.
user_name:
FunkiDred66_NYC
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel has a fantastic location so close to times square. The pictures on their website are not representative of the actual decor. It is not the cleanest and the staff leave a lot to be desired. Also be careful if you book through British Airways as they sell upgraded rooms that the hotel categorically state they don't have. I would look for another hotel for my next visit.

Rooms are clean but tiny Coffee maker in room l'm English we drink tea!!!!no fridge for fresh milk no shelf to put make-up on or anything else for the price charged rooms could be alot better!! I spemd alot of time in N/Y would l return to the Gallivant NO

Hotel has construction on 2 sides, you won't be informed but the balconys are out of use. I booked the PH has no balcony access, a shower that dripped all day and night, Tiny bathroom considering its a 2 B/R and the bathroom is through the bedrooms so not great if two couples booked it. I had a number of issues with the hotel and emailed the manager to discuss before doing any reviews however this has been ignored so now here's my review. I booked the PH for $2000 (just over - for my 40th Birthday treat) and my friends booked a family for $600. Her room was larger, had a huge balcony she could access and also had an extremely last master bathroom, the type you would expect in a Penthouse! I had no access to my balcony through construction (was not informed at any point, until I walked into the room to find out for myself) The door wasn't even secure and blew open twice during the night from the wind. The shower dripped all day and night and cleaners left towels in the shower tray to try and reduce noise, it didn't work and was very annoying when trying to sleep! The manager on site was polite but seems had no power to offer any compensation or alternatives which is ridiculous. I would definitely say if you're going to stay here, get the cheaper room. Youll be crazy if you pay what I did when you see what the other rooms get in comparison.The positive for the hotel is the location - 2 mins to Times Sq without the constant noise.

stayed here 4 nights from feb 24th and it was perfectly fine for the price we paid. Rooms are clean and tidy, reception staff are great and helpful. We had a room facing 48th street and street noise wasn't anything excessive, you soon get used to the police and fire engine sirens. You are a 2 minute walk from times square so location could not be better. Would stay here again next time we visit

I recently stayed at this hotel, it was nothing like The brochure!!! When I arrived I opened a press and a glass fell out cutting my foot. I was offered an ambulance by the hotel.. not antiseptic cream and plasters!!! Never asked for the remainder of my stY was my foot ok, despite me having to get painkillers!Then had to pay for them to mind my luggage whilst I waited to go to airport!! Disgraceful customer service and a very rude manager!!!!

Plus points:-Friendly, helpful staff-Clean rooms - cleaned every day and towels changed.....Also toiletries and hair dryer supplied......-Good location - near Broadway and the theatres/restaurants and not far from empire state building, tour buses also available on 47th which is next street. A 24 hour pass on the tour bus is @$50.00 includes the night tour bus and ferry on the river.....Minus points:- Some noise - hotel room at front of building on the 4th floor, some exterior noise overnight as near broadway and traffic, also a fire station is around the corner so some occasional sirens, got round this by leaving the television on low overnight when sleeping....-No breakfast or restaurant/bar at hotel, there is a Chinese restaurant adjoining the hotel, got a good 3 course dinner for $35.00..... there are plenty of cafe's for breakfast and lunch nearby.....- Showers tended to run cold in the evenings, but ok in the mornings.....Overall would recommend for the location, comfort of the rooms and the friendly staff...... my 1st visit to New York and thoroughly enjoyed!!!
user_name:
Darryl T
Ipswich, England, United Kingdom

review_body: This hotel is well situated but the hotel needs some new house keeping staff our bathroom door was covered in human faeces spoke to reception and asked to speak to manager but that old chestnut IN A MEETING got given a card with housekeepers contact details but didn't bother because someone should of contacted us with some kind of apology just to add it did cleaned but it looked like room had just a quick clean because my friends room had pubic hair on toilet

We recently stayed here and found out stay very enjoyable, very convenient location as it is in Times Square but just far away from broadway etc to not have all the noise. The staff were very helpful and we had complimentary bottles of water daily. Also free WiFi. A member of the team Sunny also helped us with late check out for no extra cost. Although the rooms were pretty standard they were cleaned with fresh towels daily. Can highly recommend this hotel.

I had not been to this hotel in a few years. It seems like they have made some renovations since my last visit. The location is good, quality tv & safe in the room. The daily fee is the part I don't like, not enough perks to justify the extra cost per day!
user_name:
x J
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed 6th march for 4 days had a good stay small but clean room my probem is why has the urban tax been taken out of my account as sterling and not us dollers paid £137 68 sterling when should have been $137 68 dollars explanation please

Room was bigger than expected, cleaned perfectly everyday. Central to everything. The only thing I can pick on is at peak times you can be waiting for an elevator for a while so get your walking legs on but that is just me being impatient. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Hotel was great. All of the staff I encountered in the trip were very helpful and super friendly, it is an awesome location! My first stay here, but I’ll for sure be back.. I’m already looking forward to my next trip! Thank you for a great couple days, much appreciated.

Location is good. The room was small. It was clean. There was a coffee maker but no fridge. Not much for extras at this hotel, however you will pay a high extras fee called "urban fee". I would've considered this hotel a great value without that fee.

Hotel is really central, stone throw away from time square. ideal place to stay if you need to get around all of manhattan. Hotel was clean and tidy, reasonable price. 100% would stay here again if I were to return to Newyork

Location central to Times Square but hotel itself very dark in Reception and spotlights in room not very well positioned resulting in terrible lighting. No mirror near plugs, room windows and blinds filthy. Bed smaller than a double and very high. Shower had lukewarm water two out of the 3 days of our stay. Hotel tax extortionate and definitely not worth it at The Gallivant. Will not be returning.

This hotel was recommended to me by a friend who had stayed previously. And I have to say it was a lovely stay. The rooms are fairly quiet. I was able to hear people in the corridor outside but nothing from my neighbours. The bed was really comfortable with a choice of pillow. The most comfortable I had had in four weeks of travelling! My only discomfort was the room temperature. I do like it to be fairly cool to sleep but I couldn't reduce the temp as the fan was too noisy to leave on for too great a time. I had a small double which was great for one, it might be a bit cosy for a couple.The hotel is 2 minutes from Times Square and 2 blocks - about 5 minutes from Hells Kitchen so location is brilliant. There is a theatre right next door so time to pop back to your room in the interval.Staff are friendly and helpful and full of useful information. I would definitely stay again

Pros:This is right on Times Square! Been to NYC 3 times now and this is by far the best location.Quick service - the hairdryer broke, rang down and new one at my door within minutes. Batteries died in the remote - same thing, less than 5 mins. Really great service in that way.Lovely smell in the reception area. Fancy fish tank.Cons:This hotel has jumped on the “resort fee” bandwagon. They’ve named theirs “urban tax” seen as referring to themselves as a resort is stretching it. For your urban tax, of a massive $35 per day, you get WiFi and a small bottle of water. Before this crazy charge such things were included or complimentary - to claim water and WiFi is an added extra in 2020 is a bit silly. So you might get a great nightly rate on your hotel site - but remember to add $35 to that! It’s a shame this hotel have jumped on this bandwagon, I hope this resort fee craze is the next thing to be regulated.Cleanliness - not great. I thought it could do with a good scrub when I arrived but it wasn’t terrible. Then on the last day a huge cockroach came strolling out from under my bed!! Gross! It looked like something out of men in black. I let reception know and went to breakfast so they could go in and get it, but they mustn’t have been able to find it because when I came back there it was right behind the door. My husband had to stand on it and it crawled up his leg. Absolutely disgusting. Now this maybe isn’t a huge deal to New Yorkers (?) but you don’t get these where I’m from and it totally grossed me out.Room is small but that’s to be expected in NY.So all in all points lost for the resort fee and the attacked of the giant man eating cockroach (ok maybe it wouldn’t have eaten me but it was huge)

Trip was brilliant everyone was so helpful can't wait to come back .Seeing the sights was dream come true never thought I was be here truly one of the best holidays l ever had .would definitely recommend it to my friends

Although the foyer is bright and clean the hotel itself is shabby, tardy, in need of an overhaul and filthy. Night managers are rude and inconsiderate. Spent the last of our honeymoon there from Thursday 27th Feb to Sunday 1st March. Got no sleep at all due to road noise, even though we were originally on 10th floor. Heating made a continuous clunking throughout the night. Paint peeling from ceilings, carpets in corridors threadbare and stained. Holes in bedroom walls badly filled in, paintwork atrocious, very dark colours and poor lighting. Nothing like as shown on website. There website is misleading and misrepresents what you get. Claim that wi-fi is free but was covered in their urban fees. Had to be moved to third floor on second night after arguing with manager from midnight to 2 am as their was a rave in a warehouse next door. Noise was unbelievable. Second room on third floor was smaller and dirtier and had no heating. It was minus 1 degree celsius outside! In both rooms the shower was hanging off the wall. Water stains on bedroom ceiling. They also hit you with additional charges called an "urban fee". Charge you $50 per night, then deduct $36.42 per night, but you may not get deposit back because of "incidentals". DO NOT USE THIS HOTEL. IT IS DISGUSTING< MORE LIKE A DOSS HOUSE. Hotel was also covered with scaffolding and plastic sheets over the outside of the windows. The inside of the windows had holes and flaking plster/cement work.

There were 4 of us put in one family room. There were 2 double beds and a bunk bed. The bunkbed looked completely unsafe with a warning at the side of it saying that it was an unsafe bed. We complained about the bunks, stating we felt that it would be unsafe for us to sleep in on the top (which only had a small barrier to stop anyone falling out) and the bottom - which was falling apart. The staff didn’t take our complaint well, making us feel as if we were the problem. After the complaint a roller bed was finally put in our room - however it wasn’t worth the money we paid. Our room itself was clean and the bathroom was pleasant. However, the heating / AC didn’t work and our windows weren’t safe either - we were boiling all night. The location was great, and right in the middle of the buzz of Central Park - which did make it noisy at night - however that was expected.

We stayed at The Gallivant Hotel 23rd-28th Feb 2020 in room 305.We were greeted by a friendly welcome on reception and check-in was smooth.Soon after arriving in the room we had an issue with the hot water and shower, which after reporting to reception, the maintenance man came promptly and fixed it.Our room was of a comfortable size and was fine for our needs. A modern and fresh feel. We had 3 issues we encountered, 1 was the hot water took a good 2 or 3mins to get hot. 2, The bathroom was very small, opening the door and it missing the toilet about an inch or so. The shower area was fine however the glass screen in our opinion should of been bigger coming out further as the floor got soaked each time puddling in places and also the spot lights in the room on ceiling were VERY bright (in our opinion too bright) which is why I've scored down a mark only for these.(4/5)The location of this hotel is FANTASTIC, on W48th Street inbetween 8th Avenue and Times Square, literally a 20second walk on to Times Square. All the theatres on Broadway close by, diners and shops. The location is what sells this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to people however next time I would try another hotel close by, that's not saying in the future I wouldnt stay here again.

Just had the unfortunate encounter of meeting ‘Alfonso’ on the front desk, we simply asked for a bottle of water which is available ‘on request’ to be told abruptly ‘see the manager’ at 8am, very, very rude unhelpful person, we think ‘Alfonso’ should learn more people skills before he deals with paying customers, he found the whole situation amusing while talking to a colleague and even refused to acknowledge us, would do anything to avoid this arrogant, rude person again
user_name:
jason187067
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the Gallivant hotel for our 1st ever visit to NYC. On arriving at the hotel we were checked in & told we had to put a $200 bond down which we would get back at the end of our stay.Our room was basic which didn’t bother us as we didn’t plan on spending much time in it anyway.One thing I will make a point of is that the reception team all seemed to have a chip on their shoulders. Anything you asked them about, help wise seemed to be a big deal. They were quite rude & short. When it came to customer service they deffo need training. In the end from talking to other people they were like it to everyone.At the end of our stay I was asked if I would like the room tax taken of the card I used for bond which I didn’t as I had a Revolut card with $ on that I wanted to use instead.I gave the card to the receptionist who swiped it, then had a smirk on her face as she informed me it had declined. I asked her how they processed payments as my card wasn’t setup for contactless or online payments & her answer was that she didn’t have a clue. I asked her to try my card again & again it declined. I asked if she could wait one moment while I logged on to the card app & she huffed & puffed even though I was the only person stood at reception. My app told me they were trying to make a online payment which is why card was declined. I changed the settings in the app for the card to except online payments & asked her to try again & hey presto payment excepted.The receptionist then handed me the receipt without even a thank you or a good bye.It doesn’t take much to be nice.So before anyone thinks about staying at this hotel 1st make sure you check out trip advisor to see what it says about staff like we should have........

This boutique hotel is right near Times Square, and for the price, location, and look of it, you're getting a deal. I would not recommend for families or people who want to sleep at night. We were on the 15th floor and apparently there was a club or party doing on downstairs on a Friday night. It was SUPER loud even though we were so high up. If you're a light sleeper, you'll hate it. The rooms are small but cozy, bed is moderately firm, and the cable TV was pretty good. The fixtures and decor is modern. The water pressure and hot water were great. The outlets are not positioned in convenient places, so be mindful of that. Hope your appliances or chargers have long cords! Also, the shower has no door so water gets everywhere. The bathroom is super-small, so it's good for solo travelers or maybe one extra person. There's nowhere to store your toiletries. Also, the room temperature is tricky to adjust and the method to do it is archaic. One minute it was super hot in the room, the next drafty.They offer convenience of free check-in of your bags if you get in earlier than the 3 p.m. check-in, which is awesome. (I tried to call ahead to see if I could pay for early check in and find availability. They put me on hold two times and then third time just hung up on me. When I arrived, they claimed they had no availability for the early check in.) Also, the only other amenities they offer in the rooms is a mini-coffee maker (with pods and powder creamer/sugar).I've lived in NYC for years and now travel there on business so if you're not from the city and you're traveling with family or want space/better amenities, try either staying outside the city (in Queens or New Jersey) or tough it out in smaller spaces, less amenities and maybe not-so-friendly customer service. Again, I'm a NYer so it didn't bother me.
user_name:
missjanep21
New York City, New York

review_body: Everyone fantasizes to live on Time Square but the hotel options are either out of budget or are not exactly close to Time Square . Gallivant is a perfect solution, located at a prime location the room tariff is pocket friendly. Room is clean with all basic amenities, unlimited supply of water. The double bed is a bit small so maybe two queen beds will work better. All in all a great place to crash when in NYC.

We had a Fitness room which was so big. The best was kingsize and so comfortable. We were allocated 15th floor and had a prime view of M and M world but the blackout blinds worked a treat. It is the city that never sleeps so noise was heard but pre packed earplugs worked a treat. Water at the reception desk and friendly staff were fab. Would I stay again ...definitely as the location was superb so close to everything.

New York is an amazing and very friendly city... a great positive vibe. The hotel is in a prime position for exploring the city and using it as a base in conjunction with the subway is the way to go !

we just recently returned from here and all i can say is what a amazing time we had from start too finish this hotel is excellent . the staff , the room , the locaction, it is just around corner from times square and broadway . we stayed for 4 nights here . our room was on 7th floor it was so quiet and bed was so comfortable . room got a little warm but had aircon .we would like too say a special thankyou too SUNY whom made our stay extra special by being such a beautifull warm kind hearted lady . she was so kind and made our stay even more special by chatting too us , not being pushy , she was genuine and chatted away with compfort and told us a lot about the city . she made us feel so special , this LADY is very lovely and would be on hand too answer any questions and also take time too answer your questions , talk about your family too . also we ordered a taxi from the hotel as we felt we could.nt drag cases on the subways , when it turned up we were greeted by a stretch limo , this was so over whelming as we have never been in one so this was a wonderfull surprise and end too a perfect stay . we will deffinatly without a doubt go back too this hotel .

What a lovely hotel in a perfect location! Looking at previous reviews we were slightly worried but from a great welcome by the reception staff (male name unknown) we were allocated room 903 which was at the end of a corridor and found to be very tidy, small in size but perfect for a 3 day base. We did have roof top air con units and street noise outside but this is to be expected in the Middle of New York City. I class this as white noise as no sleep was interrupted. You are only 2 mins walk from Time Square, 5 mins from the Rockafella Centre and Hells Kitchen. Would advise if you want milk in tea, buy a small carton as powdered creamer is not the same. On that note there is no fridge in the room. Not a problem for us. Glad I chose this hotel for our NYC visit and will gladly return againPlease don't let the bad reviews put you off!

We stayed here and loved it ! Great location great room and the staff were excellent nothing was too much for them . Room was very clean also . Free bottles of water in reception which you are encouraged to help yourself to .

great location on times Sq. Clean hotel and good size rooms. the staff was very helpful with all our needs from booking taxis to shows.the hotel has a gym and swimming pool.room service. just a short distance walk to times Sq and good for hop on and hop off tour bus

Firstly.....dont let the bad reviews put you off. The location of this hotel is excellent! Just off Times Square. You couldn't ask for a better location. The room was small but contained a queen sized bed, drawers, large flat screen TV, cupboard for hanging clothes and safety deposit box. The room was modern and clean. The bed was extremely comfy. The bathroom was small and the shower took a while to heat up but once it got warm it was a great hot powerful shower. The lifts were slow and small but we were on the second floor so walked down the stairs. We got fresh towels and the room cleaned during our stay. Yes you have to pay a deposit up front on a card but you get this back 3 - 5 days after check out so long as you dont use anything (room service, movies etc) The lobby area is very modern and has plenty of seating and smelt lovely!!! There is a desk in the corner next to check in where you can phone for transfers or book tours etc. There is free Wifi in the hotel which is fast and works. You just have to reconnect every time you come back into the hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. And I would recommend the chinese nextdoor. Set menu for $22.95pp! Massive portions and excellent quality.

Just came back after visiting for 3 nights with my boyfriend, stayed from 21st Feb - 24th Feb in room 901. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, it's very modern and clean, staff friendly and helpful. Everything we needed in a hotel, right in Times Square close to the M&M shop, so easy for getting around, and a comfortable bed to come back to each night, with fresh sheets and towels each day. Close to tourist attractions, which as a first timer in New York was a must for us. Me and my boyfriend had the absolute best time in NYC and hope to visit again, and if we do I would 100% recommend this hotel and stay here again!

Beautiful little hotel, friendly staff and nice and clean. Travelled here from iceland and due to a storm over there got into New York a day early. The hotel couldn't do enough for us, amazing. Only criticism are the showers, shower screens dont cover enough so the water goes everywhere. The hotel and the staff were amazing and when I come back I'll book here again.....

Checked out yesterday and just wanted to reassure anyone concerned with the bad reviews. We booked a deluxe 2 doubles room through travel republic. With all the bad reviews I was concerned, however I needn’t have been. The location is great - 48th between broadway and 8th Avenue. On arrival check in was quick and we were allocated room 1029. However upon entering it was clear this wasn’t the room we booked. This room was a box with 2 single beds. I went back to reception and the man showed me the confirmation they received from travco who travel republic use stating 2 single beds. A call to TR out of hours and 20 mins on hold to be told they couldn’t get hold of their hotel supplier that evening. Luckily the hotel advised they could move us and would temporarily hold the upgrade charge on my card until the supplier contacted them. They allocated us room 1228 and this looked exactly like the picture on the website. We had to leave a card for the security deposit of $50 per night, this showed as pending on my account. Several calls to TR and the room issue was finally sorted - confirmed by the hotel when we returned. The room had a large TV, coffee maker, safe, plenty of storage, hairdryer. The beds were comfy. The room was cleaned daily. There was bottled water available on reception. We didn’t use any of the facilities, on check out they charged our card for the resort fees - it showed immediately what I was being charged and the deposit released. I would definitely stay again price dependant. No complaints.

Stayed here over Christmas and New Year’s Eve. Best location right in time’s square, room always clean and is modern, the lobby was also nice to sit in. It’s the best location for the ball drop, you walk to the end of the street and are a part of it all. Nice staff. Only problem is shower filled up fast so had to have shorter ones and the gym was very warm, rooms are small but that didn’t bother us. Would 100% stay again

The USP about this one was the location. Prime location, just in the middle of the Time Square and everything was within reach. The staff were very welcoming. A little renovation to the rooms could really jazz up. Nevertheless, the overall experience was really good.

Myself and 3 family members visited The Gallivant for 3 nights, leaving just now on 23rd feb. We were really concerned about arriving following reading the awful reviews the night before we got here. Do not listen to the bad reviews. We arrived to a modern reception area, and a friendly staff member helping us check in. We used the lift to get to our room initially, these were never busy during our stay but there are also stairs if there ever was a que. The rooms were clean, modern with slight wear and tear on the radiator. The bathroom was clean, slightly small but we were only in there to sleep and get ready. The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels. One rooms shower took a little longer to get warm which was not an issue at all. Over all we all felt this hotel was perfect for location, it was clean and very chic, friendly helpful staff and would definitely recommend!!On a side note, the Chinese attached to it behind the fish tank is very nice and the set menu is so worth your money!

You won't get your security deposit back!Myself and my friend stayed here from the 10th of February and checked out on the 14th of February 2020.First things first if you were grabbed by the title of my review - you are risking a high chance of not getting your refund back on time - if not AT ALL! Myself and my friend were told we would receive the refund in 7 days by the reception staff, it is now the 23rd of February and we have not received our refund.Positives of staying here:- Prime location.Negatives of staying here:- Be prepared for poor customer service, on arrival we were told to wait with no explanation other than the "system has gone down" (thanks to the guy on reception however who was very helpful in giving us advice and directions with a warm approach and friendly smile)- False advertisement/photography on website if you stay in a standard room, it is TINY, OUTDATED and GRUBBY; looks NOTHING like it does on the website - (I HAVE VIDEO EVIDENCE, FEEL FREE TO CONTACT ME ON INSTAGRAM AND I WILL SEND YOU THEM OVER @elliesole)- Ask if you are next to an elevator, we were disturbed nightly with the clinking and clanking of the elevator next to our room (700) - (I HAVE VIDEO EVIDENCE, FEEL FREE TO CONTACT ME ON INSTAGRAM AND I WILL SEND YOU THEM OVER @elliesole)- Be aware that there are no duvet covers, the duvet is placed between two bed sheets.- Housekeeping will not make your bed if you sort of, half make it (we were trying to be polite)- Check for all damaged items (and take pictures) as we had seen on reviews prior to arrival that the hotel has tried to take security deposits from travellers who have not damaged anything in the room.- No fridge.Overall, it was a pretty crappy stay; we put up with it however as we were out most of the day to explore.So, if you are looking for a cheap pit stop, for a night or two two explore the city then take my advice and I'm sure you'll have an adequate stay.If you are looking for a spacious, comfortable, quiet, attentive and reliable stay - I highly recommend you do not stay here.

Absolutely fantastic hotel. Staff couldn’t be friendlier or more helpful. Beds were incredibly comfortable and rooms cleaned daily. Good choice of television to watch after a hard days walking round the city.Would definitely visit again as we couldn’t fault it in any way.

Great location and that’s it. I waited for the elevator for 20 minutes and it never showed up. Later the same day again the elevator never showed. I take the stairs and in the lobby are 4 large bins of garbage blocking the lobby stairs. So not only do I have to take the stairs I have to move garage just to get into the lobby. It is also a fire/safety hazard to have stairs blocked by anything let alone garage. I have mentioned both times to the front desk and I get nothing in response. When I mentioned waiting 20 minutes and no elevator the first time the clerk at the desk mentioned the stairs. Are they going to carry my luggage down for me when I leave? Since the store there garbage in the lobby stairwell I highly doubt it. When I mentioned the garbage all I get is “I will tell the house manager “ that does nothing for me because I have already had to move the garbage to get out of the lobby. Not even addressing the fact I have to keep taking the stairs because the elevator does not seem to stop at the third floor.

Great location and excellent value for money. Would recommend. We came as a 40th birthday present to my partner and we have had an amazing time!! Would suggest everyone comes to New York for the experience. It’s been fantastic!!!

Avoid at all costs. Tired, scruffy etc etc. Reception is ok but that’s about it. They charge 2 dollars to store a suitcase when checking out. Stayed for 4 nights and water only available once. Lifts are very slow AVOID room 211 at all costs. Seriously how do they think this room is acceptable to paying customers. Very noisy buzzer going all night outside the window. Only moved us after 2 nights as hotel was supposedly full. No point complaining as nobody is listening or cares. Standard reply on here for most of complaints says it all. See photos taken of the view from the room 211!!!!! Please note hotel management this is NOT acceptable by anyone’s standards to charge normal rates for this room. I will be contacting hotel manager on my return home.

The foyer was nice as u enter, and always free bottled water on offer. Staff were very nice and helpful. Rooms very small but clean enough. We had a problem with tiny flies in our bathroom, they offered us another room but was to the front of the hotel and was very noisy, so they just sorted our fly issue out.

The only reason I didn't asked to be moved is it was for 3 nights only, I could just about cope as I knew we wouldn't be in it much. I didn't even unpack as the wardrobe space only just fit our coats in!

The hotel location is brilliant and a short 2 minute walk to time square and 15 mins to Rockerfeller etc. In terms of the hotel itself there isn't much to say, no great welcome or care from staff about your stay, check in seemed like an inconvenience and didn't speak to anyone until we checked out really. The rooms are OK but need some care, bathrooms are tiny and we had an issue with hot water (or lack of) which was reported but never heard anything back. It is clean and considering how close you are to time square it was quiet (apart from some guests using the corridor to party but this was dealt with by reception after one call which was good). ****The real issue is the extra charge or Urban fee as they have called it. It is mentioned in small print but It makes it out like it is some sort of tax you have to pay but it is just the hotel charging more for your stay. The price looks good when booking or on comparison sites but then for a week you have another $200 + to pay ($34 a night i think).****

The location and the hotel are beautiful do not get me wrong. The front desk reception were very polite and the hotel bar was fun and crowded with people. On the downside, as i was leaving the hotel i got a notice from my bank that an extra $150 and an extra $50 were charged to my account when I ALREADY paid for the room and the deposit fee when i checked in. In a panic, because now i am negatives in my bank, I kept calling the manager and she said she would get back to me within a few hours, and it has now been 2 days. I keep calling the hotel and Ive left a message with my phone number to the manager and i have yet to hear from anybody. This has caused major stress considering an extra $200 was taken from my account and the lack of communication.

If your looking for a nice clean friendly hotel I would 100% recommend this hotel great location only 1 min walk from Times Square and 2 mins from subway. Before we we went we read some of the reviews and felt very sceptical about the hotel but I can truly say they are way off, it was so welcoming and warm lovely clean rooms. On our last day checking out we left our bags while we explored more cost us $6 dollars for 3 bags they even arranged a car back to the airport for us, but made our engagement more special by getting us a limo. If your wanting a great place easy travel friendly staff this is the place! We shall be returning

I am writing this review from the hotel lobby after checking out after 9 nights. the hotel is in a great location, perfect for walking to attractions, getting the subway or the bus. we absolutely loved the hotel and were so well looked after. Suny checked us in and out and she was so lovely, she made us feel so welcome from the moment we stepped into the hotel. Thanks Suny <3 Our room (1118) was a good size and so clean. we arrived at around 12pm and our room was ready for us which was fantastic to be able to unpack and head straight out to explore the wonderful city. This was our 2nd time visiting NYC (first time in this hotel) and we will 100% come back to stay in the Gallivant.

This hotel is in the perfect location! We arrived early at about 9am and our check in agent Suny tried her best to get us into a room that was ready. She asked us if we would want 2 doubles when we ordered a king and we said we didn’t mind as long as it was ready. She was a star and managed to get is in a room with two beds. Make sure you check in with her if you can because she the best!!! Other than that; great location about 1 minute walk to Times Square, as well as the Vietnamese restaurant on property was cheap and had some fantastic food! Thank you for making our trip memorable!!!

Stayed here for 5 nights end of January beginning of February, having read previous reviews I wasn't expecting the Ritz but somewhere to be a base for exploring New York. The hotel is right in the middle of Time Square and in walking distance to all the main sights. Although the room was a bit tired and dated it was comfortable and clean. Suny on reception is an absolute star and a credit to the hotel. We knew in advance about the tourist tax so weren't surprised by this it seems a lot of countries are doing this now. All in all a great trip.

The hotel is ok for a short stay, our room and bathroom was small but very clean. For 4 nights it was fine as obviously we were out all day. The staff were helpful and friendly. The shower was ok but the water took a while to warm up and it ran over the floor no matter what we tried to stop it. The bed was ok but we kept rolling in to the middle during the night.All in all it was good value for money however for a little bit more per night I might look elsewhere.

Cracking little hotel literally a stones throw from Times Square.If all you want from your hotel is a bed for the night,somewhere as a base,and central for all the tourist attractions of NY City then you can’t go wrong with this place.It is clean,friendly staff,ideally situated.We spent 5 nights here and will use it again,and recommend to our friends and family.

Arrived at the Gallivant and the reception staff were friendly and helpful, we asked if all four of us could share a room and rob the manager went out of his way to show us some rooms there were available, we picked a room that suited us all and although rooms are small they were cleaned everyday, lovely shower, coffee/tea maker, usb sockets, safe, ironing board and iron. I asked the manager if the hotel had fruit or peppermint tea, he said he would have a look. 30 mins later there was a knock on the door and rob was there with some peppermint tea he had bought from the shop, now that’s service for you! The rest of the week flew by with no problems and check out was simple. Our bags were looked after for the cost of 2 dollars each.

We stayed fo 4 nights, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were all very friendly, and helpful, the rooms, though small, were comfortable, and clean.Very good locations, with Times Square a 2 minute walk away, and several subway stations with a couple of blocks.Some very good restaurants with a block or two as well.The downside is that it is in central Manhattan, so some traffic noise is to be expected. As stated, the rooms are small, but then you don't go there to spend a lot of time in your room. The ability to leave your luggage safely secured after checkout is a much appreciated bonus.

Great location and good value. Friendly, helpful staff. A great location to explore the Times Square. We would definitely use this hotel again for future trips to New York. New York as a whole is quite expensive but account for this and you'll have a great time.

The galivant is in a very good location for times square, theatre and attractions, rooms very clean and staff friendly and helpful. The downside to this hotel is it's very close to a fire station and you will hear the sirens throughout the night

Came back to the hotel on 2 separate occasions to find someone (presumably housekeeping) had been through my belongings in the drawers and wardrobe. Complained to the manager and housekeeping manager twice, they said they would get back to me before I left. This never happened. The staff couldn't have looked less interested if they tried. One staff member in particular basically called me a liar. The hotel cleaning standards are basically non existent. The bedding never got changed in the whole 5 nights we were there. On arrival they were pubic hairs on the door and on the ceiling. The only member of staff that was helpful was the guy that looked after your luggage and helped you get a taxi. The other staff was incredibly rude. The only positive thing I can say about the hotel was the location. Perfect If you want to be close to times square. Sleep was basically non existent due to the banging of doors at all hours. When booking I knew it wasnt a high end hotel but you at least expect the place to be clean and safe.

After reading mixed reviews online I was a tad apprehensive about coming here but I can assure you it's been a pleasant stay, staff been great and helpful, cleaners do s good job, my only issues here have been that there is no mini fridge in my room and no sockets nxt to my bed so that's nothing really location is ideal as it's close to everything we wanted during our stay. The gallivant is well worth staying at if coming to nyc.

I don't expect much, this isn't my first time in New York so I expect a smaller room, I expect the noise of the street, I expect the crowds. However what I dont expect is to pay an 'urban fee' which you tells me covers wifi and for my time here for this not to be working! I called reception 5 times to be told it is working downstairs. It wasnt and I know for a fact I was not the only one complaining yet nothing was done.$35 a day! How is that fair?I also had another complaint about being overcharged for my urban fee. I could see a pending charge was more than it should be. I spoke to Ade on reception about this and he was dismissive and rude. Refused to help or cancel and re key even though he could see the error too. Took none of my details then told me I would need to email my complaint when I get home! I emailed and have had no acknowledgement from anyone. But 3 days later this was corrected. Not even a courtesy email to let me know. I strongly recommend this man take a course on customer service and how to speak to people who are spending their hard earned money to stay here. I will never stay here again and I would recommend you don't either. Ruined the end of my vacation.

The hotel is a block from Times Square. There was a restaurant next door but we opted for pizza. The room was clean. The staff were friendly. My only issue was the small elevators and at check out they were busy and hard to get in.

After reading reviews we were a bit apprensive about staying at this hotel but we couldn't fault it. Especially the staff, couldn't be anymore helpful. The manager went out of his way to get us some fruit tea. Our room was nice & clean, not huge but more than big enough for us 4. Great location to all attractions. Noise at night was expected as in times Square but blocked out easily with ear plugs at night. Will definetly come back again :)

Rooms are damaged would rate this hotel 3* it is ok if you just want a base. Sleep disturbed from fire station sirens going off all night very basic and very small rooms. First time in NYC and was disappointed by hotel I was expecting door man, luggage taken to room, mini bar and room service as seen in the movies. None of this at this hotel in the 5 days I've been here. Good location but hotel more like a premier in.

Stayed in the Gallivant, Times Square and it was very convenient for subways, sights, etc. Only critic was the window did not close properly and therefore was not at all sound proof. Was a bit disappointed to be charged 32.50 per night as a city tax as this is the most i have ever been charged I anywhere i have travelled to.

The hotel was an unexpected surprise and provided all the amenities for a pleasant stay in the heart of Manhattan. The best thing about it was its location - very conveniently located next to the Times Square and close to many tourist sites, as well as the subway network.

Great Staff and Front Desk Personnel, but the value was majorly lacking and deficient due to lack of amenities and up to date room furnishings. Also of note, there was major construction repairs going right outside my window. The city building codes require mesh netting to protect people from debris and toxic materials.There was no such netting.

This was our first time to New York, the Gallivant is located right in the middle of Times Square so perfect location. Room was nice and clean (just a standard double room) nice big tv on the wall and nice sized bathroom. There was a coffee machine I unfortunately don’t drink coffee but like tea but no teabags (didn’t ask!) room tax was a standard $103.50, hairdryer was powerful, and comfy pillows, quite loud outside but didn’t care as this was a trip of a lifetime for us both! The heater wasn’t very good just blew out cold air, Shame about the scaffolding outside the front but most places had the same! The safe was easy to use as well. Staff were friendly, we were unaware that upon arrival you have to pay a refundable amount of $150 payable card only, then this money goes back on your card when you leave, and takes up to 3-5 working days to go back on. (*UPDATE* The money has gone back onto the card)Could do with some more coat hangers in the wardrobe, and tea and coffee in the room for people who like both! To secure your luggage for the day if you are leaving that day but want to go out one last time was $8 for our bags (4 bags) We would certainly book here again.

Location is decent but wouldn't stay in this area again as restaurants/bars are so overpriced. Room was just big enough given that you don't spend a lot of time in them, however was asked if we wanted to upgrade to a king bed on check-in for $10 a night as the queen bed would like be too short for us given we are tall (?!). It was too small but we were on a budget so had no choice but to keep it. Walls are thin, lifts are slow, our extractor fan was literally hanging off the ceiling. We informed the front desk of this as they took a $200 deposit from my credit card on arrival 'in case of damages'. On check out I was promptly told they were debiting over $130 from that deposit for their nightly 'urban fee' which seemingly covers basic hotel amenities like wifi, none of which we used anyway. Was quickly shut down by the rude receptionist when I questioned it as 'I will have been advised of it by my travel agent' - I wasn't, and I have taken this up with them. Oh, and after this I was informed it's a $2 per bag charge for them to look after your bags until you go to the airport - funny how this isn't included in their 'urban fee', must be a luxury service. If you do choose to stay here, prepare to be fully ripped off.
user_name:
kitkatkate88
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Location was great very central, rooms very clean overall good value, only down fall was you had to pay another 30 dollars per night on top off what you paid for holiday. Loved every minute of our stay....

Stayed at the hotel recently. It was part of a winter deal and When you pay little don’t expect too much. Firstly though good points, really handy for central Times Square, literally a few minutes and you are on it. Secondly only 7 blocks from the port authority bus depot. Take the bus from the airport for only 18 dollars each, far cheaper than a taxi (70 - 80 dollars). Close to Central Park etc. Handy for the subway only two blocks away. All the theatres are within a few blocks. Staff very good and friendly. The downsides would be the rooms, I paid an extra ten dollars a night to upgrade to a bigger room, would have hated to see what I was originally getting. Our room was basic and tired looking, the bathroom was tiny, a real reverse in and walk out to use the toilet. Our original room had no view due to plastic on the windows, also they were single glazed meaning we heard everything. We were on the 12th floor but could hear ones talking on the street below. Thankfully they agreed to move us. Can’t comment on the gym or pool as I did not use or see them. However, I had the privilege of having to pay a surcharge for them. If you do stay there allow another 40 dollars a day for the local taxes and facilities surcharge. The hotel is now just dated and is left behind by so many others in the area. Would I stay again, Probably not.

We got here on Wednesday last week and at check in were told the room type we had booked was only going to be given if we paid $15 a night - frustrating massively but grudgingly paid it.We headed up to our room which was absolutely horrific, the door never opened and closed properly and we needed other staff members to help us with it, clearly other people had issues as there was a huge hole in the door from the handle made by other people and the drawers etc were all in horrific condition.We went downstairs and told the guy on the desk who apologised and was genuinely such a nice guy (Aziz) and offered us the room directly above the one we had originally, we walked away to go look at it but he called us back and offered us a room on the top floor

Stay at The Gallivant Times Square for 4 nights. Upgraded to a queen room for $10 per night extra but to be honest could not compare it to a normal room as didn't get to see what a normal one looked like. Two adults and room was just ok. It serves a purpose as for any traveler to NYC its only a base as you're out all day!! Lifts/elevators are woefully slow in this 15 storey building so be prepared to take the stairs

Cannot say we had a problem with this hotel because it was a place to put our heads for the night, yes the rooms are small, the furniture is old and dated but I slept really well, the room was warm and clean, yes the room was tiny but perfectly formed ..I have to say the lifts are a bit crazy , I always felt lucky to make it to my floor with the noises coming from them and they are not the quickest lifts in the world.The staff we met were always friendly and helpful To sum up this hotel, it’s a budget hotel right in the middle of everything. I’m 100% sure there are better hotels but I’m also 100% sure they will cost you a lot more as well ! Clean, tidy and warm place to put your head for the night, just don’t get hung up on the things that don’t really matter

On arriving at the hotel we were shown to our room 1301 after paying 15$ for an upgrade per night to two double beds, once in the room to say we were disappointed was an absolute understatement there was a huge massive hole in the wardrobe door and the room wasn’t exactly what we expected going by the photos on the website and trip adviser , we headed back down to the front desk where Aziz then found us another room 1401 and he said this was a better room and the first one should not be in use until it was repaired as we headed to explore our next room he called us back and said he had a change of mind and said he was putting us in the junior suite on the 16th floor , this room was a bit better than the one we were originally in more it less what you would expect in a budget hotel apart from the noise of the lifts it was mediocre This morning as we were checking out i found out from other clients that they had only paid 10$ to upgrade to a double bed room when i questioned my bill i was directed to the managerRobert Napolitano or something difficult to say as he rudely refused to hand over his business card who verbally abused me in front of other guests shouting and making gestures to say they had given us a free upgrade to start with which was untrue and he was not entering in to any discussion what other guest had paid, i felt threatened by his manner and intimidated by his whole demeanour, he rudely walked away and hovered the whole time i stood in the foyer adding to my discomfort On arrival back to pick up our bags he was present again and blatantly spoke about us to another member of staff who then stared over at us with a smirk on his face, so much so we left again to be away from these horrible people again on arrival back this manager was present again and making me feel intimated again even standing outside as we got in our taxi to the airport PLEASE AVOID THIS HOTEL IF YOU CAN THIS MANAGER DOES NOT KNOW HOW TO TREAT HIS PAYING GUESTS WHICH KEEP HIM IN A JOB BY THE WAY I DEAL WITH CLIENTS ON A DAILY BASIS AND IF I EVER EVER SPOKE OR TREATED CLIENTS THE WAY I WAS TREATED THIS MORNING I WOULD BE FIRED WHAT HAS BEEN A LOVELY 5 DAYS 60TH BIRTHDAY TREAT HAS BEEN TOTALLY RUINED BY THE ACTIONS OF THIS HORRIBLE IGNORANT EXCUSE OF A MAN

Fab hotel really clean and in the best location we have stayed in. Read so many bad reviews and just shows how picky some people are as we couldn’t fault it room cleaned every day fresh bedding and towels daily slept great think this was because we were at the back of the hotel only thing we looked into a brink wall but we’re glad of the peaceful sleep would definitely stay here again thanks gallivant we had a blast!!!
user_name:
janey212020
New York City, New York

review_body: First time in New York and this hotel is in an ideal location to explore the city , another plus the room was a good size , comfortable beds and pillows , shower was good and a nice coffee machine in the room , which you can also make tea with if that's your choice , flat screen T.V , if you get time to watch it . lovely lobby area . On the downside , our room was quite cold not too bad once you were in bed , the air con had a cool and heat setting , but unfortunately the heat setting blew cold air , we arrived Friday evening and I didn't report the problem until 7am on Saturday morning , I got a rather frosty receptionist that asked why I hadn't reported it the night before , I explained we only got in late so we switched the air con off and went to bed , I was told they would try to get someone to look at it , they didn't !!! , good job the weather was pretty mild . only there for 3 nights so we didn't get too upset . Would I stay here again ? , maybe in the summer :) .

The website photographs are not a true reflection of what this hotel and certainly what the rooms look like. It could do with a massive upgrade. We experienced the following issues (which I didn’t bother reporting to hotel staff as you can’t polish a turd);- Rooms are tiny (nearing on claustrophobic).- The extractor fan in the bathroom is extremely noisy and motion sensored meaning you can’t help but wake in the night if you or someone else uses the bathroom.- Air con/heating unit is ancient and therefore also extremely noisy and unreliable. - The bathroom itself was tiny (given I am 7 months pregnant but even my husband who is slim struggled to move in there).- You will wait aaaaaages for a lift (only x2 small lifts that fit a maximum of 7 people [not including suitcases] for all guests and staff).- They charge €6 following check out to mind your luggage (which seems unreasonable given you pay €35 per night urban tax and they are not even kept in a secure room).- The “free water” is warm and in bottles smaller than a kids fruit shoot bottle.- The bath towels are tiny (again I am 7 months pregnant but even my husband who is slim could barely distinguish them from the flannels).In general this hotel just doesn’t have a nice vibe. I know you don’t spend an awful lot of time there but all of the above issues don’t make for a great nights sleep. My advice is pay a bit extra and stay somewhere nicer. On the plus side, the housekeepers are really pleasant and the location is great.

Positioned ideally for a visit to NYC. Don’t expect luxury, but everything functional for someone that wants to explore then get their head down.We never ate at the restaurant as there are plenty of other places to go.

First trip to New York with my wife (booked through TUI), New York the city was amazing and the location of this hotel is good, however, thats really the only positive I can think of for the hotel. We were immediately told at check in that there is a $206 tax to pay. When we booked with TUI, we were told there is no tax to pay. It appears that after checking our booking docs, there was no mention of a tax in our original booking T&Cs, however, this was later added via a booking ammendment email and we were not informed of this addition so be careful of that!Our room was underwhelming to say the least, we looked at photos of the standard rooms at the hotel online and the room we got was nothing like what the online images show. Please see the photos below.The radiator in the room (which was hanging off the wall) kept us both up all night, even when it was turned off weirdly! We had to complain to the front desk, to which we were told that we had one of the nicer rooms and that it was just the building and you get used to it. We eventually changed rooms, and it was better, but our radiator was broken and was constantly pumping out heat and could not be turned off. So we had to complain again to get this fixed. If I was coming back to NY, I would definitely just pay a little more and stay somewhere much nicer, the location is great but with the transport connections available, this hotel is not worth it.Having looked on the TUI website again, it appears that TUI are listing this hotel anymore as I can no longer find it. I could be wrong, but I wouldnt be surprised.

My daughter and I stayed here and absolutely loved it. Comfortable bed, friendly staff, and very clean. The location was superb too. I couldn't fault this hotel at all. I look forward to returning sometime soon.

A few things could be better. The rooms are quite small but we did know that before we left. They could also be updated, the furniture is quite shabby now, chunks taken out and also the draws not closing properly on the dresser. Paint is chipped on the walls and skirting boards. The heater/air conditioning is very shabby, not really attached to the wall and is ridiculously noisy! We also noticed the fan in the bathroom is motion censored so if you get up in the night you set it off. If you have a long shower the fan stops as it can’t tell, would be better if it just comes on when senses steam or when you turn the light on. The towels are tiny!! We couldn’t even get them round us, more like hand towels than bath sheets. The bed was comfy, a great sleep. Also, coffee sachets are in the room but no tea bags. We would much prefer a tea in the morning but it’s not even an option. The room is fine, it does the job of somewhere to sleep but still a few upgrades to do. You can hear everyone in the hallway, you hear everything outside and also the noisy heater. As long as you don’t mind the noise it will be fine for you.

Booked online without really reading any reviews because the room was such a great value. After booking I started to read the reviews that weren't so complimentary. I don't know what those other reviews were talking about, I can honestly tell you my stay was amazing. Upon arrival the check in was fast and easy and staff was super pleasant. I stayed in room 1316 and it was quiet and cozy (this is NYC small hotel rooms are common). It was well appointed and man oh man was the bed super comfortable. I found out upon check out that the bed was brand new, only a week old. The location of the hotel was fantastic, right in the center of it all and I would for sure stay here again.

The hotel looks nothing like the webpage pictures , the rooms on the webpage must be in a different hotel , the reception staff are very quick to take your bank card and scan it for what I know is to remove money from your account without your say so . The rooms are grim , dark dingy and filthy , the whole hotel smells like cooking oil , the corridors are disgusting the rooms are too .The first room was tiny and dirty , the second which I had to pay to upgrade and was called a premium room was dirty , no lights worked and it had bunk beds ?! And also was dingy stinky and dirty , none of the rooms have fire doors and windows are all covered in plastic so if there was a fire you wouldn’t stand a chance , the door on our second room only met at the lock , it didn’t fit the frame , the doors are hollow and could easily be broken .We left within been there 20 minutes , and stayed elsewhere which was beautiful and made our holiday ( crown plaza ) I asked the gallivant to remove my card details , in total over 3 days £300 was taken from my account , after asking for a refund twice , I was told quite rudely I would get my cash back when i checked out ?!! I wasn’t staying there ! So basically I was been kept on the computer as staying there so they got paid by Hayes ! It’s disgusting and I’m sure illegal which I’m investigating ! I did get a refund on my last day , and Hayes are refusing to pay back my hotel stay that I had already paid for at the gallivant as I didn’t let them fix the problem ?! The hotel is unsafe so how could they fix that ? Fit a fire door , decorate the rooms and not charge me extras ?! The place wants investigating

We stayed at the Gallivant for 5 nights, we had a high floor and the rooms were clean and spacious. It was a great base for exploring. We didn't spend much time in the hotel but the staff were helpful and accommodating, no issues with holding our luggage so we could enjoy the last day with a late flight. Only issue we had was other guests smoking weed, it was an extremely strong smell and the staff promptly resolved although the smell did linger for a while, I appreciate this is no reflection to the hotel in relation to other guests antics. Lifts at busy times could also be slow as they are small. We would return based on the location and price.

This hotel is perfect for couples on a short break away. It took us about an hour to get to from JFK. When we arrived the reception team was very helpful in explaining the safety deposit and the tax. The deposit is $50 dollars a night and tax is $35 dollars a night. The tax is taken out of your deposit and the rest of your deposit is refunded to you if there is no damage to your room. The rooms are beautifully presented and clean. Housekeeping came to our room everyday to make our bed, empty bins and give us clean towels. The hotel also offers a 24 hour gym which is very clean and quite throughout our stay. The reception area had communal computers and printers to print off your boarding passes if need be. We was very lucky to be given a balcony from our room which gave us a beautiful view of some of the nearby buildings. Our room was heated all day and night, sometimes it would get too warm but we was able to put on the air-con so didn’t mind. The hotel is 3 minute walk from time square which is perfect for fitting everything in on a tight schedule. We would be very happy to stay here again and would like to thank all the staff for a wonderful stay.

Got to the gallivant the reception area was lovelly however when we got to our room no 204 all day and all night there was a big extractor ffan outisde that was on 24 hours a day and was verry loud, found it difficult to sleep and rest, apart from that brilliant hotel.

We was pleasantly surprised on check in as how nice the hotel was after reading the reviews. The rooms were spacious (twin room) and everything was perfect!That was until 9:30pm that night workmen started refurbishing every hotel room on our floor, we made complaints but these fell on deaf ears, the receptionist simply did not care and suggested we invested in ear plugs! I am not exaggerating when I say we had around 20 workmen outside our room shouting and working from 9pm-4am EVERY SINGLE NIGHT! Every morning we was promised that the works had finished on our floor, every night we had them back shouting. Turns out it was a check in mistake and we was never supposed to of been given the 9th floor but they refused to move us. When a room did become available I was offered to be moved to the 8th floor...where they has just started working, it was a complete joke! Our trip was completely ruined as we did not sleep at all. The reception staff did not care and were extremely rude with one stating she had bigger problems then me complaining about lack of sleep, when you have paid out for a trip of a lifetime I think anyone is well within their right to complain about blokes being outside there door all night with a master key! We was the only guests on the floor the first night and felt completely unsafe. We tried to speak to the manager everyday but she was either not in yet or unavailable, it go to the point that I had to email her for a response as we couldn't see her face to face. She has promised a refund via our booking agent but not heard anything as yet. The Hotel is nicely decorated and in the perfect location, if it wasn't for the works and the rude and disrespectful staff I would highly recommend. If you are booked to stay here over the next couple of weeks I really do urge you to call ahead and request a room away from the refurbishments. Although not sure how much help that would be as none of the staff knew what floors the workmen would be on from one night to the next. I am not one to complain at all and often read reviews on here and think get over it but my god it was a bloody awful experience.

Brilliant location.. friendly staff.. very clean. Was delighted we got a free upgrade on our lastnite to the penthouse suite it was a brilliant ending to a fab holiday.. Aziz who works on reception is a lovely man and it was thanks to him.. greatly appreciated!!

Upon arrival had no information was given goodie card told the room number. Next day asked questions at desk got told to go see another staff. When seeing that person had no interest what so ever with an attitude. Every night there were constant doors banging, couldn’t open the window as it was taped up which the room was very hot. Housekeeping wasn’t that good, knocked on door and asked if we needed anything and then got told to wait until she got it and passed it through the door. When on check out day the cleaner knocked several times and was told we were checking out at 12. Knocked 8am 9.30am , and many times after that. The staff didn’t seem interested in any of there residents just more interested in taking your money and that is it. You will be left with a tax bill when u leave the hotel. I wouldn’t stay there again.

We didn't get told that we would have to pay taxes at the end we were told we would get the whole deposit back but were not and only getting half back. People should be told upon arrival that this would happen. Good hotel overall

We chose this hotel via a package with a local travel agent. We looked through the website and on Google and thought the rooms looked good and it was what we were looking for as an overall hotel.Service at front desk was good and made welcome however our room was anything but. It was nothing like the photos and we even wondered if we were put in the right room.The radiator cabinet was hanging off on 2 sides, the decor was different to the images we saw and the bathroom door had water damage. Bedroom walls are paper thin and the doors are not soft close so we could hear conversations and the slamming of doors. I think we only got one good night's sleep when we were there. One evening I saw there was a delivery of new mattresses for rooms and having woken up at 3am, it sounded like the noise of people unwrapping the mattress out of its plastic and the jostling of getting it in the bedrooms. Any good points? The location is perfect. Situated by times square, far enough away from traffic but not enough you are out of the hustle and bustle. Plenty of restaurants, bars, tube stations and landmarks to visit are all in walking distance. The cleaner did do a good job of our room each day. New linen and towels, extra cups and coffee for the machine.

Myself and my sister spent 4 nights at the gallivant. It is a lovely hotel, in a prime location (100 metres to M&M world). Staff were very friendly and helpful, beds the comfiest I have ever slept in!!! Apart from being a little noisy (but we were staying on Times Square) it was perfect.

Do not stay here. My room had some large machine belching out noxious fumes all night while having tubs corrosive acid bouncing around on top of it. They charge a totally unjustified $35 a night mandatory extra fee. The manager is impossible to track down; I tried four times to see the manager, only finally tracking her down before I checked out.Stay here at your own risk.

Myself and my wife stayed here in Jan.The location is absolutely second to none, opposite the crown plaza. Room was small and maybe a little dated but spotlessly clean with safe, iron, hairdryer provided.The staff here have an excellent “can do” attitude which obviously is a reflection of their management also. While we were there they were replacing 100s of mattresses by the look, they did this mammoth task with the minimum disruption to customers ..thru nights. The contractors and staff always gave precedent to guests re. elevator s etc.. will be coming bk here, thanx

Stayed in the Gallivant over New Years for a family holiday. We booked two rooms a twin and a double. They were both on the 8th floor, the twin was bigger than the double and the twin to the front of the building was a quieter room then the double. The twin room: The sinks were not cleaned properly, there was hair on the sink when we arrived that was obviously from a mans shaver which had not been cleaned up. The shower where the dial pointed to 'Red' for hot was actually cold and vice versa. The water didn't flow down the drain so after a minute you were standing ankle deep in waste water. This then took about minutes to drain before the next person could get in. The beds were fine but they only provided one pillow per bed and then one spare. Our TV channels weren't lined up correctly for example the information page would say CNN but if you clicked that it would be a sports game etc. Our remote broke and they sent someone up very quickly to help. In double room: The heating system broke on new years eve and the room was like a furnace. While they sent someone up to 'fix it' straight away it wasn't properly fixed and remained very warm for the duration of the stay. The also suggested that we would get money back on check out however the receptionist never brought this up and we didn't want to cause a fuss as we needed to catch a flight. On new years eve we wanted to go to Brooklyn Bridge and I asked the receptionist the best way to get there, she didn't know and then gave me wrong information so be careful and double check everything on google maps. We booked a taxi with the concierge who was very helpful however, the taxi company he booked with sent a very old limo and suggested that we would travel with another family, this was fine with us and the other couple however, 50 meters up the road the car broke down and we had to wait for 20 minutes for another car which was a suv and was also not very new. I would suggest being mindful of the company that they book their airport transfers with as the new driver told us that things like that happen all the time.

On arrival we was seen by reception I was charged $150 dollars but it wasn’t explained I was given a form listing resort fee and WiFi passwords etc. No problem we was given our room keys and told our number , we made our way up the lifts , arrived at our room and it was bigger than I expected , it was clean and tidy with a nice walk in shower , the room was cleaned each day and bed made with clean towels put back daily , it was a bit loud at night time out the Windows’s but you’re right near Times Square so got to expect that , location is very good just at the end of the street your in the centre of Times Square . Overall very good hotel , when checking out the receptionist was a bit more helpful and booked me a great taxi travelling back to jfk was a luxury car only 70 dollars , I asked about the money I was still owed and she said it would be sent back to my account which I’m still waiting on so hopefully it will arrive in my account soon, if my money does arrive then it’s a hotel I would stay at again , clean , tidy , great location,

Lobby looks amazing, reception staff were friendly, room was comfortable and the bed was great for resting after a full day’s sightseeing. Very noisy hotel as there was building work going on inside through the night and the outside noises could be heard clearly from the room.Location was in the heart of Times Square... great for getting out and about.

We arrived late Sunday evening booked in very pleasant welcome from the person on the front desk. We had room 1225 it was clean and just what we wanted for our 3night stay. The shower was cold one morning it woke us up ha ha after that lovely and hot. Room was cleaned everyday we had no problems with the lifts. The hotel is in a great spot right by Times Square. Hurleys bar next door is worth a visit $15 bucks for two Buds around a tenner for two pints all in all a very nice stay

really enjoyed stay here it’s located so close to times square , brilliant for theatre area , close to bus routes , hotel clean , our first room very small , upgraded to larger room much better on sixth floor staff all very friendly and help full

We were sadly disappointed by our stay at The Gallivant our room was tiny consisting of a bed, a TV and a bathroom with a shower with no space to move around. We visited in January so obviously as expected it’s cold outside. To heat the room there’s a big electric air conditioning unit next to the bed which regardless of the setting we instructed it to do just blew cold air until we gave up and turned it off. Hoping to warm up the following morning I headed to the shower to find that didn’t allow for any hot water either but did soak the bathroom as it was all so small and narrow. On a positive note the bed was comfy and allowed for a full nights sleep. Check-In & Check-Out was very easy and the staff were very polite and attentive.

It has been a pretty frustrating experience and I will definitely publish this "review" in all relevant hotel sites I can find. I am really willing to spend some time focused on helping other people not to jeopardize their NY experience by staying at the Gallivant. My first room was on the 2nd floor and the scaffolding on the outside made terrible noises due to the wind and was really a hassle when it came to sleeping time. The windows were tremendously dirty and it was just sad looking through them - my fiancee and I tried to clean them but after our 4th attempt, the cloth was still coming out completely black. I can’t imagine how long it has been since it was properly washed. There wasn’t a desk with a chair on the room, and when I had to do something for work (about 30min/day), I had do utilize my notebook lying on the bed. The heating unit was overheating and not responding to the commands on the wall, the technician came in, couldn’t fix and his recommendation was we adjusted the temperature by opening the window - this is not a joke. I was moved to a 2nd room on the 10th floor. We don’t have any of the previous problems, but we were welcomed to a set of new ones: the safe was not working so I checked the batteries and realized they were being held by duct tape and cardboard (again, this is not a joke). I reattached the duct tape and it was functional again, but there is a great chance that it will come loose with all my stuff in there and I am not sure if the hotel staff will be able to retrieve my belongings in due time. The TV system is simply outrageous: if I connect my notebook through an HDMI cable (which I bought in NY just for this means) I can watch 30 min maximum before the TV blacks out and stops responding to any command. The only solution is to disconnect and reconnect the power plug, wait for the system to initialize, and watch another 20/30 min before it happens again. The exhaustion fan on the bathroom is not working and since it doesn’t have windows or any kind of ventilation, we have to spray perfume and wait sometime after we utilize it in order for the other one to come in - really romantic having to do this in the trip we became engaged. The night technician couldn’t fix it and said he had no spare parts to fix it. The front desk person said we should give it a try with the morning technician - who may have spare parts. All of those problems were noticed right away on our first night ant the new room. Morning came and I solicited a technician for the TV and fan. 30 min and no one showed up. I did it again, the front desk person said the technician was on its way but again, 30 minutes and no one showed up, so I left my room since I am on this trip to enjoy the city. After reporting these problems, front desk suggested we moved again, to A THIRD ROOM within our stay. Not only it is really frustrating having to pack everything and check-in at the reception, as it is a great waste of our scarce vacation time. On top of that, I am at a point in which I can already imagine what kind of problems our next room will bring us. I am not naive to think, after all of this experience, that the third room won’t have major issues. On top of all that, my fiancee tried to warn the reception that the beverage vending machine isn’t working (coins just go directly through to the change container and bills are taken in but the machine doesn’t recognize it - you just lose the money) and the response was “YOU should call the phone displayed on the machine and ask for maintenance” - again, I’m not joking and this was the actual response she got. I have traveled quite a bit in my life and had some bad experiences at hotels, but the Gallivant Times Square outperforms all of those and I can’t recommend it to anyone. The location is perfect and a part (maybe half) of the staff I talked to is really polite, but having in mind the price I was charged, the Gallivant gest a 0 out of 10.

Love this hotel, location, and staff always friendly and helpful. The location is perfect to all the action, and still away from madness of noise and traffic. I have stayed here many times, and have seen a variety of rooms they offer, and small to large, all nice

We travelled to New York as a family 3adults and 2 children. The room was large and very modern overlooking the fire station on the 15th floor. Location was fab right off Times Square Check in was quick and reception staff was helpful. The room was cleaned daily although it could do with a proper clean under the beds was sweet and crisp packets from previous guests and lots of dust. Was disappointed that there was a £2 per bag charge to leave luggage after we had checked out for a few hours whilst we went for food next door.

The 2nd most appalling hotel l have ever stayed in. I’m giving them a 1/10 for proximity to Times Square only. We stayed from the 21-24th October. The room we had was smaller than our cabin on a ship but what l didn’t expect was that the cleaning staff didn’t even bother moving back the cupboards and desk that had obviously been moved around from last guest. We couldn’t access the cupboard drawers without having to reposition. Bedside lights weren’t working. Aircon inadequate. The drainage pipe was blocked so when showering water was filling up over the side onto the bathroom floor. We asked to move rooms which was approved. No offer of assistance by staff.
