On first impressions the foyer looks ok but what a disaster the rooms are !Room 1: large noisy extraction fan outside window and a view of scaffolding and building materials .Room 2: rubbish on floor and toenail cuttings on bedside table.Room 3 : cannot even begin to explain the damp musty smell in room and noisy bed springs .Room 4:: fed up now so put up with adequate room , shower took 10 minutes to heat up , shower didn’t drain shelve in bathroom was hanging off, the antiquated air conditioning was old and noisy , damp patches on the wall and generally filthy and an uncomfortable mattress. We have stayed at hotels all over the world and this is by far the filthiest, run down hotel we’ve ever stayed in , paint work was damaged and furniture falling to bits . The only positive thing is the location .Staff were rude and ignored me when I asked to see the manager . The photos online are nothing like the rooms available so book at your peril !!!

Just back from a week long trip at this hotel. Super location and really nice room. (605). Lovely foyer and reception area. Very nice oriental restaurant flanking the hotel. The stand out quality of the hotel was its staff. They couldn't do enough for us. So friendly and helpful especially SUNY. I'd definitely stay here again for that reason. DannyDublin

Very good in generalExcellent location.Good checking and out processConcierge very helpful and knowledgableRoom small and expensive but that’s probably due to the great locationWould visit again definitely

Good location, only a minutes walk to Broadway and times Square. The room we had was small and basic but acceptable for a 3 night stay. Staff were helpful and there are plenty of good eating places close at hand.

This hotel is too loud. The outside noise is unbearable (never knew that hearing cheering from the nearby theaters could be that annoying), along with the street noise makes for no sleep. Asked every day of three night visit for a refrigerator and was not accommodated. Front desk indifferent. Maids will slam doors all morning hoping to get people out of rooms. I stayed on 10th floor facing 8th Ave. Get as high a floor as possible! I have stayed in many NYC hotels. This was decently cleaned and I have experienced worse noise once before, but not for the rate I was charged.

This Hotel charged me with US$50 per night WITH NO REASON. The front desk told me that they will return my money, but it as a LIE.Don't trust in this Hotel. The room was tiny, unconfortable, noisy. GALLIVANT: give me my money back.

Everything is old, rooms are so noisy and dirty. There is no relationship between photos of the hotel and reality. Staff is friendly but even this cannot save our stay. Definitely not worth for the price.

The place itself is centrally locates and a two minute walk to Times Square. We have just returned from a four night stay and like anywhere has its ups and downs. Good- central location and clean roomsStaff all approachable. Plenty of local places to eat (avoid paying tourist rates for breakfast etc) and a really nice roof top bar opposite the fire house.Bad - lifts (as per everyone’s comments) Taxes/fees- on arrival told of the £50 per night fee for damages (which I struggle with in light of contents of the rooms) then on departure they keep an amount in line with NYC taxes so you don’t get the full refund. Rooms are small and please be prepared for door slamming /drunken groups. We mentioned a group of professional fireman (who clearly stated where they work and who they represent) who would come in at 4am banging doors in the corridors/shouting. These was raised with the reception staff who did notTake much notice. So if your a light sleeper - avoid.Location from JFK- make sure you get a flat rate fee as they can vary as we found out and takes about an hour each way.Overall a mixed review due to other guests and noise but all in all, central and clean

The hotel was very clean and the staff very polite and helpful. The kids loved the bunk beds which was ideal for our family. Location was great and central to Times Square and short walk to Central Park.

I stayed at the Hotel Gallivant from 6th Sept and checking out 10th Sept 2019. On check in I was asked to pay $50 dollars per night for any damages incurred during our stay. I was assured this money would be refunded to my account on return home. I am still waiting!!! I had a great time in NYC and was happy with this hotel. I am hoping to come back next year but this has kinda put me off booking the Gallivant for that trip and that's a real shame.Morag OConnor, Grangemouth, Scotland

Hotel well located in the heart of Manhattan.Very nice home.Spacious and comfortable room. Good interior insulation but poor external insulation (Windows).Staff present and available to dolce small malfunction.

For the price and location it’s ok for a few nights if you just want a bed. Small rooms, very basic and could be cleaner. Bed wasn’t the comfiest and our room smelt damp with little black flies in the bathroom.

Very happy with location and room. Hallways are narrow and elevators are small but everything was well maintained and clean. Had a small issue with the bottom sheet on the bed coming undone as they were too small. Pillows could be improved as well but overall we have a very pleasant stay.

The location was perfect, and people very friendly. They give you bottles of water whenever you arrive or leave and there was a huge container of cold water but the matress was terrible, we didn’t sleep very well.

the room was not cleaned all the time of our stay the sheets and pillow the same I had to do it myself trash not taken and initially we were charged to keep our luggage 2 hours at the home wifi do not run no fridge in the room toiletries once during 6 nights finally first and last time

The hotel room had phenomenally adequate air conditioning! Food delivery to the hotel room is an incredibly excellent service. The air conditioning was absolutely beautiful! The hotel location was in the middle of EVERYTHING. The cost for guesting at the hotel was most reasonable!

To be honest, it was not a good experience. We´re expecting something way better for ouy honeymoon. We had serious problems on the first day regarding crazy guests on the family room next to ours, with kids trying to open our doors, parents fighting and yelling all the time. We had to complain several times. The room was Ok and very clean (the housekeeping was the sweetest person ever, it was the best part of the hotel). The elevators were constantly delayed as well. Anyway, I don´t know if I´d recommend it to anyone else. It´s not a cheap hotel and we were expecting a better experience.

The only think that I liked about this hotel is it's location. Other than that it's not worth the money you pay. Some parts of the room were never cleaned. There was no fridge in the room and no drinking water. They charge you for everything.

I stayed here in January 2018 and it was brilliant the staff were so friendly and helpful. I suffer from COPD and the staff couldn`t do enough for me i.e changing my room as the air con was working in the first room. I would reccomend this to anyone as it is central and on Broardway.

Fantastic location just a small stroll you Times Square, staff very friendly and extremely helpful with information about the city. Our room was a suite which was quite large and spacious. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel for a visit to NYC.

Fantastic location very near to Times square great service and very friendly staff, very clean and comfortable rooms. Also perfect location for most of the iconic places to visit in New York. Would definitely stay here again

Very disappointed. Rooms were equivalent to 2.5 star, noisy, uncomfortable beds, elevator did not work, towels not replaced, amenities very frugal. some staff were very kind, others did not give a hoot.

We were afraid to stay hear reading all the bad reviews,,, but it was fine for us friendly staff,, twin room with very comfortable beds ,, we were never in our room only to shower and sleep ,, great location,, lovely cafe across the road .

Fornitures were brooken and noise was terrible at night because windows aren't soundproof. Our bathroom door was broken too and the chargers diden't walk. Poor value for money. In adiction, they charge for keeping the bagagge.

Rooms are very noisy, works carried out overnight on the street did not let us sleep well during our stay, not even one day!The standards of the room not as expected from pictures on the website. Also first hotel we stayed in which has shampoo but not shower gel...Only postive for us was the location, right on Times Square.Overall not a great experience for us.

Rooms are rather small, but who needs 40square/m in NY? Bathroom a bit tiny, no shelves, but one can manage that. Price is reasonable, due to location. Times Square is just around the corner, subway as well - the hotel is perfectly located. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

We stayed here last month for three days. The hotel is very central for Times Square but is on the small side. There is nowhere to sit and relax, no bar. The Chinese next door doubles as a buffet breakfast we had it once never again. Poor quality and overpriced. There are two small lifts which at times you had to wait ages for. The room was ok but the bathroom was tiny. If you do stay here and need any help see Antonio he is brilliant.

The Gallivant has an excellent location just off Times Square but it is very run down, shabby decor and not very clean. Also very noisy so light sleepers do not even consider booking this hotel. The rooms are in urgent need of an overhaul and this hotel is at best a 2 star hotel. We stayed for 3 nights either side of a Royal Caribbean Cruise, one night before the cruise departed and 2 nights after the Cruise. As it was booked as part of a Cruise package we did not choose the hotel and I can honestly say I would not choose it. There are only two small lifts and usually only 1 in working order and the hotel has 16 floors so getting your luggage down in a morning to check out is a nightmare. We waited 25 mins stuck on our floor and after hassling reception many many times as we were at risk of missing our taxi to the ship, they finally sent the service elevator for us. The air con is so noisy and in our room it could not be switched off or controlled. Dirty furniture, broken or missing window blinds. Expensive daily taxes. This hotel needs a complete refurb and is relying on its location to tempt you to book. Having said that they do provide little bottles of water free and the toiletries in the rooms are ok, plus they provide clean white towels and plenty of them and the bedding is changed daily but that is not enough to warrant you staying there.

We loved the location of this hotel. It was clean and our room was nice. We were in the junior penthouse which had a balcony looking towards Broadway. The Italian restaurant across the street was very good and we saw a show at the Longacre theater just a few doors down. Night recommend staying at the Gallivant Times Square.

The location is great in 2min you are at the times square and in the middle of NYC but the hotel rooms are way too small for 2 person and all the luggage bathrooms are also too small for a double room

The location is a short distance from Time Square,The hotel is insanely noisy next to it has a fire station, insanely small rooms, very slow lifts, the safe in the room was messed up and I left money in the trunk of the suitcase, stole $ 1000, the place unsafe at all, don't leave any money outside the safe.And although we called police, the hotel evades answers and tries to exhaust us.Keeping things from the generation took us $ 6 for keeping us in our suitcases for an hour and a half.Shame of a hotel. Although the prices there are relatively reasonable for the other hotels around, but how do we say "the cheapest is always the most expensive".

Location wise, this hotel is sold as prime real estate. literally on Times Square, which sounds perfect. the reality of this is not so fabulousStaff are friendly, hotel is clean and tried to be a contemporary boutique hotel. Can't fault it really as a hotel. We were looked after and the room was perfect for our 3 day stayPoints off for the elevator being out of order one of the mornings, there being no hot water in our room 2 of the 3 evenings (there was plenty of hot water every morning and afternoon) and the noise coming from the nearby fire station. Seemingly this is the busiest fire station in NY. Every night the sirens and bells were going off. Not really the hotels fault, but this is something to be aware of before bookingDidn't have breakfast so can't comment on foodFitness room is basic, but about what you can expect from a hotel these days

Great location, but noisy. Building work going on outside which we were not aware of. Staff can do with some customer care training. Overbooked our room even though we booked 4 months in advance. Gave us a different room, couldn't unpack as had to move the following morning and couldn't get in the room until the afternoon!

I decided to stay in NYC for a night and picked The Gallivant Hotel to try out. I could not have picked a better choice. It was near Time Square, near the restaurants and areas I wanted to visit, great rooms and most important of all, outstanding customer service. I was greeted at the front desk by Jose and he definitely took his time to take care of my spouse and I. Grade A customer service and will be my standard each time I decide to visit the city. Thank you Jose and thank you Gallivant hotel for such a pleasurable time!

Heart of Times Square. Rooms cruise ship size. Our king sized bedroom had no dresser. Remodeled, but kept some really old tacky furniture. Walls & ceilings painted mocha--so dark. No amenities. Housekeeping staff accommodating. 2 working Elevators elf size. Bathroom new but vanity can barely accommodate toothbrush. Go for location AND if you get low price.

Very disappointed - we only stayed one night, but our room was very small, with a huge air conditioning unit right next to the bed. When switched on it was very noisy. The shower room was modern and clean. The hotel was noisy as all the floors were laminate and the lifts were small and took ages to come to the floor. The daily charge was a shock didn't expect it, but good location for Times Square.We didn't sleep very well but it was only for one night and the workmen were outside our bedroom window from 8.30am!

Hi, I arrived for my brothers wedding, having paid a significant amount of money, over €350 per night, a rate that would get me a hugely impressive hotel room anywhere I have ever been. I appreciate that the Gallivant is in a prime location close to Times Square. The lack of any dining or beverage facilities were not ideal although not an issue given the close proximity of eating and drinking facilities close by. The location was indeed excellent and served as a fantastic base for our holiday. The location is the only positive I can find with the hotel experience however. Firstly, the room should absolutely not be described as deluxe (which i paid extra for). The room is very small and cramped with minimal space available. Consequently, there was nowhere to properly store luggage other than on the floor which served to further reduce the space available. The air conditioning unit in the room worked fine, but made a loud clicking sound everytime it swithched on - very frustrating during the night when the loud click wakes you up and then kicks in every few minutes. Turning it off wasnt an option as the temperatures were high during the week. Adjusting the temperature up helped to reduce the number of times the unit kicked in. I have stayed in many hotels across the US and never encountered that. From the second night onwards the unit began rattling constantly. The reception staff told us that the noise was from the outside unit, not inside and would not even send service staff to check it. We asked to change rooms and were told the hotel was fully occupied. The only way we could get it to stop was to kick or hit the wall beside the unit, which worked for a while until it would start again. We stayed on the 2nd floor so routinely used the stairs to get to our room (there are very few elevators and hence long waiting times), but the stairs were convenient. The stairs are filthy however, dirt on the floors everywhere and be careful of the doors slamming shut. Never again would I stay here.

STAFF FANTASTIC.Hotel: room was adequate, bed comfortable pillows (great) rest of it tired certainly could do with refurb.To be honest this was booked with online travel agent, it wouldn’t have been a personal choice.Your staff were great I we can’t thank them enough

Plus points.....helpful staff on front desk. Easy access to Times Square, which is only a few minutes walk away.The rooms are decent enough too.....when you eventually get the type you actually booked that is !!! We didn't initially, having been given entry cards for one where the bathroom was really small and obviously not a Queen De Luxe as we had anticipated. Having finally used Tripadvisor pictures on a tablet to show the difference, we were moved after spending our first night in the first room.Our room from then on was bigger but for some unknown reason had an exercise cycle machine in one corner at the expense of a chest of drawers (ironically the first room had one of these!). The only other problem was that the room was directly opposite the lifts, so people could be heard in conversations whenever they were passing / waiting.Ah yes....the lifts. They only hold 7 people at a time......WITHOUT LUGGAGE and there's only 2 of them. There's a Goods Lift but is used by staff for obvious reasons. You'll be lucky if you don't find yourself waiting a long time at some point to get a lift to your floor directly. When you get in, be prepared to go past and then come down again!!Didn't get a view of anything from either room but knowing now where the hotel is located, you won't be missing one either. There's not a lot of small buildings in NYC !!! We booked room only but you don't need to travel far to eat or drink at any time of day or night.

By paying a relative good price you expect not to see cockroaches in your room and bathroom. It was disgusting. I was afraid of stepping out of my bed and certainly checked all my belongings very carefully when I was leaving from there. Also the note from the streets was New York style, lots of police cars and ambulances with their horns all night along.

Despite of the several things in the hotel that I well qualified, I was disappointed with what happened to me during my stay. I hope this case doesn´t happen with other guests as it may compromise the reputation of the hotel.

A really enjoyable family holiday in New York City. This was the first time that me and my family had been to New York. The location of the hotel really made our trip as the entire City was accessible on foot, or on the subway or on a bus tour.

Elevator was extremely warm and small usually packed and had to wait. Very small rooms and very small bathroom. A large person would have difficulty in this space. Location was the best item concerning this hotel.

Great location!!! Near the best attractions of New York and the all kind of transportation. The rooms are very clean and the service is very good. We had a great experience and would go back for sure.

Perfect location but very small and huge noise coming from other rooms. The windows cannot be opened and the AC not properly working.The rooftop pictures are deceiving, it was closed and it’s not accessible for guests anyway. Too overpriced.

This is my second stay at this hotel. I love the location. The rooms are perfect for a person going solo. The service was great. I was checked in immediatly and was taken care of. I look forward to another stay at this hotel really soon

Decent hotel for the location and the price and has rooms for solo travellers. Location pretty good especially if you need to travel around New York for sightseeing.Housekeeping did forget bathmats for shower for first two days of stay but there were plenty of towels. Otherwise room was alright and management does email beforehand if there are any changes which is transparent on their part at least.Lifts can be a bit slow and crowded in the morning so if you need to get somewhere, get up early to avoid crowds. Its not a huge hotel and so lifts are probably limited by the architecture of building itself.Overall a good stay.

Location is the best thing about this hotel. The room was clean but very small. No food. For the price, there should be at least a free breakfast. We were misinformed regarding the airport shuttle. We were told we would have to leave at 7:30am although our flight wasn't until 3:40pm.

Needs improvement. Elevators don't always work. People have to take stairs. Gym needs proper ventilation, it smells all the time. Rooms have damaged doors which needs to be repaired and fixed. Location is good but property condition and service needs to be improved.

DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. Was booked via Royal Carribean as a cruise and stay before our cruise, so expected a good quality hotel. Reception area gives impression of a top star hotel, but once you get into the lifts and beyond, more like a 1* or less. This was the worse hotel we have ever stayed in. Reception staff very rude, no eye contact and not friendly. Lifts: only 1 working and only room for around 3 people. Room we were given on 3rd floor was right opposite and industrial air con system to the building next door.. noise so loud had to shout to be heard in the room. Rang down for another room to be told "ok come down will give you another room" get down to reception and before I could finish talking had the new room key thrown at me across the counter. Second room no better, noisy air con system, paint peeling off the walls and windows. Windows had no double glazing so spent the next two nights with no sleep due to loud levels of noise from outside. 1 lift working meant husband had to manually lift and carry our luggage down the stairs. Stay clear at all costs

We stayed at Gallivant for 4 nights.Although the hotel is located within a 2 minute walk of Times Square, that convenience comes at a price. Due to the windows in our room being paper thin and in desperate need of changing, you can hear all of the street noise, including sirens and the constant bibbing of car horns throughout the night. Coupled with the noisy air conditioning unit, don't expect to get any sleep.Our room was very small, and only one of us could be in the shower room at any one time. The shower was about the only good thing in this hotel.There is a safe in the room, and very basic tea making facilities.Our room and the hotel in general needs updating and relies on its location to entice guests.*** be warned - when checking in, they don't tell you that you have to pay for the wi-fi. They give you the password but no mention of any charges. For a 4 night stay, we were charged $114. Firstly, it's daylight robbery and a way of making easy money. Secondly, being that we were rarely in our room, how can you possibly justify $25 per day?!! WHAT A RIP OFF!!!!!!We were also witness to a guest who had to call the Police, due to $1000 cash being stolen from his suitcase, whilst he was out having dinner. There is clearly a problem at this hotel with light fingered staff.Extremely disappointed with Gallivant and would definitely not recommend it.Don't say you weren't warned!!

This hotel is probably the worse of the worse i have already experienced in my life. Dirtly, filed and so bad maintained, both in terns of service (nit even the basic is acceptable) but also in terms of decorations. and over all facilities. Only 1 elevator out of 3 was working during the entire stay (and as per some other guests which casually I met in the elevator and who were staying from the week before they mentioned that the previous week was not working also.NOT RECOMMENDED EVEN FOR YOUR WORSE FRIEND !!!

Bir rude staff when we were trying to change the time of our taxi leaving for the airport., only one of three elevators working. Showers took forever heating up at night. Definitely Great location, Times Square and tourist bus stops right around the Corner

Not enough elevators. They were always busy and we had to use stairs many times. The dresser at our room was very old, breaking apart. The bed wasn't so good. The bathroom only has half of the glass door, which made a mess, water everywhere. The room doesn't have small refrigerator as all other hotels. Check in and check out were easy and good. Location is the best, but very noisy!

Great location, only a ten minute walk to rockerfeller, empire state building etc. Central park about 15/20min walk away. Bed was very comfortable but the rooms could do with a bit of tlc, a lick off paint and furniture updating as drawers etc chipped and the bathroom is very small (we stayed in deluxe king room). Only one elevator working the whole 6 nughts we stayed and at times it was quicker to just walk up to level 5, whicj was very disappointing after walking all day exoloring the city. All in all i would say good value for money.

We had the smallest room possible while it was our honeymoon and we had warned the hotel , it was impossible to sleep during the night because of the noise outside everytime , the staff not always friendly and patient

Electric fixtures inconveniently located. One over-bed light fixture had been removed from the wall and never replaced. .Bed and pillows were uncomfortable. Hot water for morning shower took nearly 10 minutes to come up. There are three elevators in the lobby. The one that seems to arrive most regularly is (I think) a service elevator on the opposite wall from where guests are waiting for them. They all did work.

On the first night, we did not get the twin room with patio we had paid for. Instead, they put us in a tiny room with a king sized bed and a disgusting view and a loud airconditioning that we could not switch off. We talked to other people who also mentioned they had been put in the wrong room. So this is common practice at the Gallivant. Then, we were switched to our twin room, but the patio was not accessible. They reimbursed us 10 euros a night for this. Also, the rooms look very different than on the website. They are extremely small. False advertising. The hotel is not clean either. The cleaning staff does not clean certain areas. For instance, the area under the bed does not get cleaned. It was really dusty and filthy. Also, the walls in the bathroom do not get cleaned. There were several little hairs attached to the bathroom door. The staff also does not fill up the toilet paper. Very annoying! You don't want to worry about having toilet paper at night when booking a 4 star hotel. The shower is not easy to use, as you cannot choose how much water you're getting. You can only choose the temperature. The most filthy part of the hotel is probably the gym. I have never seen gym equipment look this disgusting. The treadmill looks like it has never been cleaned: there are so many sweat drops and filth on it. Also, two of the three gym devices, including the treadmill, did not even work... They charge you 2 dollars a suitcase to keep your bag for a couple of hours after check-out. Ridiculous. Lastly, and probably the most annoying part of our stay, were the elevators. There are only three elevators at the Gallivant, one of which never works. At certain moments, around 10 am for example, the cleaning staff blocks two of the three elevators, so there's only 1... Once, it took us more than 15 minutes to get down from the 13th floor. After that, we always just took the stairs...Don't waste your money on this hotel.

We had a queen size room. The roon was nice and clean and spacey for the value we paid. The hotel is also with easy access to time square and broadway. Will recommend for friends travelling together..

Just stayed 3 nights and it's fair to say we won't go back.Plus point is location and that's about it. Negative points are no engagement from staff... Not quite rude but just don't seem bothered unless selling you tickets for stuff. Rooms even for NYC are small. The toilet was hilarious... Im a US size 14 and just managed to get on the toilet due to it being in a tiny corner. The bed was OK but again just OK and definitely showing signs of wear. The room was adequate but didn't have guide as told it would and remote had half buttons working and AC was LOUD and all or nothing. We were on the 14th floor and even there the street noise was loud. The fire station is behind and every night it woke me at least once but to be fair my husband didn't wake. It was just clean as in I didn't complain but really could do with scrub of tiles and the AC needs a major clean up. THE REALLY BAD PART is the elevators.... Wow.... You could easily wait 20 mins for 1 at busy time and always at least 5 mins. 1 has been broken for 3 weeks and during room cleaning 1 is held for staff leaving 1 which holds 7 people for the entire hotel... And that's not including getting luggage up and down. We travel a lot and my honest advice is pay a tiny bit more and go over the road to the CROWNE plaza

Upon our arrival we got a very small room (i guess hotel photos were taken with a wide-range camera ... ) with a horrible smell of mold and cigarette smoke. We immediately changed rooms, but they were more or less the same. Overall, rooms are outdated and needs to be renovated! The room we stayed in was a mess. All blankets and sheets were dirty, mattress and pillows had stains on them. The air conditioner was very noisy and walls paper thin. We could hardly sleep one night in our room, we checked out the following morning. Most of all the quality/price ratio is very bad! The location of the hotel is good, right at the center of times square, but for the same price we were able to stay at a 4-star hotel just one block away that was absolutely wonderful.  I advice you don't book in this hotel!

the SC machine grid was so so dirty, so much dust was in between the grid that we were worried ti inspire that air, so we needed to switch the AC off. We complained and they moved to another room with a better AC machine. the first room was also very very small and the bed so short ! So if yoy like to stay here check the room before. The they charged 2$ per suitcase to hold them for few hours after the check-out.

first room was unlivablesecond room filthy,no maintenance,chipped furniture,extractor,mirror lite,bedroom lite all not working.AC sounded like a broken blade and filthy,table falling apartcleaning trollies standing in passages,only one lift workingall walls dirty and chipped,windows sealed with tape and glazing covered in old film,cooking smell in roomdisgusting needs health review can't be 4 star
user_name:
Adventurer45139
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Myself and my partner visited The Gallivant hotel for 10nights in July 2019. The trip was for my birthday and everything was perfect from start to finish. The staff of all areas could not have been more friendly from the desk staff who very kindly upgraded our room to the housekeeping staff who made waiting for the lifts entertaining with their singing and who cleaned the room every day to a great standard. So much so we have just booked up for 29th June 2020 for 12 night at the Gallivant and cannot wait. Thank you for making our holiday amazing.

The hotel is a block away from times square and the theatre district. The subway to downtown is close by as well,as are restaurants and pubs.the rooms are small but clean and the bed was really comfy. The only gripe about the room was the air con was really noisy and couldn't turn it down,and on our last night it was freezing. I was disappointed that on checkout we was not asked how our stay was or hope to see you back or have a safe trip even, in contrast the concierge was lovely and very helpful, maybe put her on the front desk.

First room we got was horrendous. Unclean, wall paint was chipped all over, shower facilities were broken. Second room bathroom issues as sink was clogged and was always dirty. Shower soaked entire room. Staff unfriendly. Lacking basic service skills, didn’t even ask how our stay was. Would not recommend to anyone! Location was good yeah as on Time Square, but staying in Time Square street corner may have even rivalled this experience. Awful! Luckily we were hardly in the hotel as we were out experiencing the city.

We loved the location of the hotel!Everything was nearby!The rooms were great and perfect for families.Only the noise from the streets,even on the 7th floor,were annoying... looks like there were no windows!

The hotel's location was great. The rooms are clean and suitable for short city stays. The person on the reception desk when we arrived was not helpful and was a bit rude. The bathroom ceiling had black mould on and the shower screen was too small so half the floor was wet after getting a shower.The bathroom fan was really loud sounding like someone screaming and smelt of burning at times. The air con was really loud constantly and could not be turned off. There was only one elevator our of three working which was a nightmare as we were on the eighth floor. Getting the suitcases out was a nightmare and my husband had to walk down the stairs while I squeezed into the lift with two cases- fortunately some very kind guests helped me to get the cases out of the lift. We did ask about the possibly of putting the cases in the goods elevator we were fobbed off by a member of staff.

So the rooms are a little on the small side but its just a base. The hotel is very clean, in a fantastic location and the staff are just brilliant. Nothing was too much trouble and the staff go out of their way if you do have any queries to help and support you through your stay. Staying here you really have it all, its so close to all the big attractions, a minutes walk to times square right in the middle of all the theatres and a stones throw from the metro which is easy to navigate and use. A must for breakfast which is a 2-3 minute walk is Ellies Stardust Diner (not for those wanting quite cuppa and a slice of toast) If I ever get to go back would defiantly stay there again.

The Gallivant Hotel is a hidden gem in the heart of Times Square. I recently stayed here this past weekend and really was blown away by the service I received. You first enter a beautiful lobby to be then greeted by front desk clerk, Tricia. She truly makes you feel welcomed with a warm smile and a friendly greeting. Her energy alone truly gives your travelers mind peace that your stay will be one you remember. The house keeping staff was also helpful and kind whenever I had questions and needed service it was handled promptly.The room was immaculate and beautifully decorated with all things New York. The views from the balcony allow you to overlook the city and it makes you feel as if you are in the center of it all (which you are). The balcony feature is one that truly adds to the room so I highly recommend having a balcony you won’t regret it.If you are planning your next voyage and you are setting your sail to New York City you will not regret following your north star to The Gallivant Hotel in Times Square. I am already looking for a reason to return and visit the city and stay at The Gallivant Hotel.

Within a block from Times Square, 8 minute walk to Radio City Music Hall, shops, fantastic places to eat at with out having to go by taxi. Couldn’t have chosen a better hotel, the staff very friendly and nice, rooms very clean.

It’s close to everything!! Really confortable, slept really well, the bathroom is cute, but the shower is a bit small and we easily made a water mess on the floor, but that’s like the only négatif part and it’s really manageable

Our first time in New York started with this centrally located hotel. The Gallivant is very close to times square. The room was small but the bed very comfortable, and to be honest we spent little time in the room. The air conditioning was great on the clammy days. We took a breakfast deal with the chinese restaurant attatched and found it great in the mornings, not having to leave the hotel.The staff were helpful and friendly.Not luxurious but a good base.

People were friendly, service was good, hotel was clean, rooms were nice and clean, bathroom was tidy. Big screen TV. Elevator to our room was fast. If you asked for information, hotelstaff was friendly.

We were pleasantly surprised. The staff was very attentive and really made our trip special. The location cannot be beat. Midtown and Times Square has everything imaginable including shows around the corner... The subway stations... Restaurants that have a "locals feel". Hotel is frequented by many Europeans and has a good vibe. We had a great rate and really freed up funds so that we could enjoy the city. The room was surprisingly quiet. Would recommend and will return to this hotel.

The location was excellent. Two blocks from times square. Really quiet hotel. I would recommend this hotel for it's convenience. Enjoyable stay overall. Also provided water at reception which was a nice touch

It is not what Booking offers. It is not clear what the rate includes or exclude. I think it's a misleading way to show the cost of the room. I would try to avoid staying at this hotel again. For the additional ones that charge and are not explicit, you can find something better

Front of house staff awfull day or night .rooms out dyaed same a 4 years previous when we stayed unfriendly staff. .location good but go stay in new yorker same price 100 times better .avoid at all costs !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

They upgraded me to a suite, but it was not a traditional suite. It had bunk beds built into the wall that did not fully retract. Also the bunkbeds were between the TV and the main queen bed and there was no couch in the room and a very small bathroom. The restaurants made it a bad idea to open any windows for ventilation and the HVAC system was pretty slow to air out the room. When I arrived the room was very hot.The property is really only priced for location, very close to times square and a major subway stop so it is easy to get around manhattan. If you don't plan on spending any time in your hotel really then it is a decent deal. The property was clean. Also, the walls were VERY thin.

Not a good room for a family. The size of a bed is not for 2 people. Who so ever put this bed in this room punish that guy he has to sleep on this bed for whole life. I’m glad I’m at home. Shame on you

Hotel is sited pretty much on Times Square so if you are looking for something central this hotel is for you rooms where ok a little small but clean and really comfy bed which you need after a trek around Manhattan little disappointed on the front desk did not explain much £150 hold deposit was a surprise and $5 to hold our luggage seemed like everyone wanted money before you would get any help

Staff are really friendly, kind and helpful. The location is perfect and really good for solo travelers. I do recommend all to stay in this hotel. Thank you all especially Ms. Sully for all her kindness and friendly behavior.

I was quite shocked booking a room for 80€/night on booking.com (exchange rate 80€ makes 88$) and then ending up paying 140$ for one night! After I had booked, I received a mail about an additional fee, the so-called "urban Fee" including additional services (like WiFi, Fitness room etc.). I personally felt betrayed. As the room price was advertised including WiFi for example. Windows are so dirty - you could not look through them anymore. Overall the hotel was clean, the room equipped with any stuff that one could need but everything was worn down to much. The urban Fee in my eyes a camouflage tactic about real expenses.

When we entered the hotel lobby, there were a number of irate guests speaking with the concierge in regards to a multitude of issues. One family which included younger children were provided rooms on the 2nd and 3rd floors that had no AC, leaving the rooms unbearably warm (report of 84 degrees) and muggy/humid... completely unacceptable during the summer in NYC. We were told the AC would be fixed tomorrow but come to find out the staff has been telling guests that the entire week. There were no available rooms on floors that had AC the evening upon arrival. Despite that, other guests had additional complaints. One woman almost in tears showed us pictures of worms/larvae in her shower; another guest came down to complain about noticing two cockroaches. Being that it was almost midnight upon arrival and lack of other hotel availability in the area due to a long holiday weekend, my fiancé and I agreed to take a look at one of the rooms...we were accommodated only with $30 off our rate to stay in a room with no AC. While we found the displayed gallery pictures on the website charming, they are actually just a manifestation of false advertising. While we anticipated smaller rooms for being in NYC, these rooms are actually remarkably small and quite outdated. Our phone chargers kept falling out of the wall outlets. While we did not see any insects as reported by other guests, we didn’t even spend enough time to look. There was absolutely no way we would have felt comfortable staying in this hotel, even if you paid us!! We unfortunately ended up having to pay a significant amount of money to stay in a different hotel last minute. Extremely disappointed. Would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

stay on lower floor away from the street noise. Elevators are slow and didn't work all the time. It took me 20 minute wait to catch an elevation. it ended up crowded and I almost missed my car. The bed was a little low, soft and bumpy so sleep wasn't good.

We checked in Tues night, room was a bit warm but thought it was the New York mugginess seeping through. We asked to switch rooms in the morning where the front desk tells us “ the AC is out on the 2nd & 3rd floors”. We were moved to the 5th floor with working AC yay!! But with Room: had two twin beds. Furniture is dated, bathroom is ok clean. The lamps over the bed did not work so made it quite dim.Location: is smack in the middle of theater district. 2 blocks fr CE and 10 mins from NRW. But overall staff was nice but of course the photos always look the best on the websites. But I would book with a chain hotel (ie..Marriott, Hyatt etc) or Airbnb in the future And just pay a bit extra.

The hotel has a good location; price ok for NYC; staff so irregular, some could be so nice, others very nasty, you have to be lucky. The remodel aged fast, need to reform again the baths and corridors.

Stayed here for 4 days myself husband and 2 sons aged 16 and 13 we loved the Gallivant rooms were clean, tidy and comfortable we were upgraded so had a little more privacy away from kids so bathroom was located in the middle with bedrooms either side. The Gallivant is in the perfect location to everything including Times Square a must for anyone staying in New York will return again some day!!

The Gallivant is a very nice hotel with a very good price value ratio, excellent location close to the subway and very friendly personnel. We highly appreciated our stay at The Gallivant and hope to come back one day.

Hotel was shabby,maids were lazy,some reception staff were more interested in their phones than their customers,workmen looking in my 3rd floor window. No gym available (I was told the lift didnt work.

Location Location Location and good value for reasonable price.The rooms are nice and the location is great.Breakfast is expensive and you might need to wait a bit for the elevator to arrive in the morning time.But the overhaul experience is positive.

A typical smaller Manhattan hotel, located in a fantastic central midtown location. The regular rooms are unsurprisingly small, and the en-suite bathrooms even smaller. We had four rooms in our party so saw some different sizes, the smallest was unworkably small for a couple so consider their premium rooms if space in your room is important and you have more than one suitcase.Everything was clean but looking tired, with things like the grout in showers, paintwork, and flooring all showing signs of age. The one issue we encountered while there (air con in one room not working) was dealt with swiftly by the front desk team swapping rooms, and they offer a very reasonably-priced secure bag storage service for your first and last days if you need it. Only things that don't work well at all are the lifts - slow and small so you can be waiting several minutes for one - and the vending and ice machines - only on some floors and intermittently working at best.To the management of the hotel - it's time to start properly refurbishing the rooms.

My son and I had a great stay at the Gallivant. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was close to metro lines and within walking distance to many attractions. It was I the heart of time square and the theatre district.

We Love the location, cleanliness and service. Times Square and Subway stations are very close. For sure we are going to come back. The king size bed was so good. Rooms are smaller but super confortable.

We loved our experience at the Gallivant. Literally right around the corner from the main drag of Times Square without all the noise. Very close to many theaters. Our room was very clean. Customer service was great, no problems with check in or elevators. Don’t be scared away by reviews that mention small rooms...it’s Manhattan! Unless you want to pay an arm and a leg elsewhere, the rooms are on the small side but very adequate and we were very comfortable. Can’t imagine better bang for buck in the city, would absolutely stay again.

The hotel is located right around the corner from Times Square, great food, and people watching. The room was clean and comfortable. Rob and his staff were very accommodating, and even helped us get last minute Broadway tickets. Aziz checked us in/out and was helpful in suggesting a few great places to eat.We fly in to NYC a couple times a year; sure there are more expensive and even cheaper places to stay, however, we come back to the Gallivant because of the great service! Don’t hesitate to book here!Nick. YDallas, TX

Stay with familly for holidays during several days. Beautiful City. Good services. Good quality of bed and room. Recommanded for because of the peoximity of the center. Near time square and lot of activities

Excellent stay at The Gallivant Times Square!!! Beautiful and very clean deluxe king room!!!Very courteous and sincere staff !!!Excellent breakfasts!!!Excellent Exercise Room!!!Excellent trip coordination services!!!I will be staying at The Gallivant Times Square again this coming September, 2019!

Awful. Rude. Hair on bathroom walls. My butt touched the bathroom wall when I bent over to dry it was so small. Awful small window. Disgusting view. Not what I saw when I booked. Your website shows beautiful rooms. I got a Camden room Not worth 50 bucks. Never again. Disgusted I wasted money there.

We stayed as a group of 9 and family of 5 in one of the family rooms, first impressions were great. Free bottled water ( which was very welcome due to extreme heat) well positioned within walking distance of many tourist attractions. The staff were polite and welcoming and the room spacious enough for 5, 3 of those being teenagers . My only criticisms would be the small elevators and the need for TLC with the paint work and doors in the rooms. Beds were always remade and room tidied every day of our 4 night stay. Would definitely stay again but please redo some of the rooms as this could make this hotel fantastic.

good place. good location for both Times Square, and the available subways. . elevators are a bit small. Need more than 1 ice machine. Only 1 was located 3 floors below me. Air conditioners are a bit loud, but were functional.

The employer was so unfriendly that i will never recommend this hotel to anyone. The Location is near Times Square, the Rooms are dark, small and was never clean. Very expensive! The elevator is horrible!

I absolutely loved the stay at the Galiivant Times Square! Everything was clean, quiet and convenient. The spaciousness of the room was great too especially considering it is New York where most lodging is not whatsoever. Thank you Gallivant!

Hotel is centrally located in the theater district. Nice lobby. Rooms are small but adequate. Bathroom is way too small even for 1 person. Didnt like that we weren't advised of the addl fees until after we made non refundable reservations, kind of a rip off. Charged almost $35/day for nothing.

This hotel is right around the corner to time square. Had a blast, make sure you bring walking shoes and a bank account. You will have a great time if you never been to New York. The hotel was fabulous. Will stay there again on my next visit.

We needed a room for 2 parents, and 2 adult children, while on a trip to see some shows. The room we had offered a queen bed and bunk beds. The room was clean, well maintained, beds comfortable - and the size was generous for NYC hotels. Front staff very helpful, printed out tickets for me. I was sitting in the lobby for a while waiting for the rest of the family, and observed the professionalism and courtesy of the front office staff. Could do with a change of the music in the lobby - a bit too techno especially first thing in the morning - but nothing horrid. I do plan on going back there again.

Very bad hotel and they are not that helpful and the room service is very slow, i don’ Like it at all. I didn’t expect this experience with them. Imagine they are now hot water in the room for drinks.

I was there for a solo trip. It is located in one of the best position of NY, since it is in the Times Square and close to the metro station. It is also a nice hotel, well furnished. However, my room was too small and a paid for 2 because of extra duties. Strange policy.

We had a family room which was a good size and fantastic bathroom with plenty of room and a great shower. Staff were very helpful and we found the location to be excellent as it is so central, great for sightseeing and lots of restaurants in the area to choose from

It was an enjoyable experience. The property was located close to everything. The room was a bit pricey then again it’s NYC. I would stay there again for sure. I enjoyed my stay. The water pressure was great.

We stayed here at the end of July, and the aircon was a very welcome relief from the heat outside. The room was small, but by no means uncomfortably so. It is extremely clean, and our room was serviced daily. Our bed was very comfortable and we were well rested for our daily sightseeing.Our check-in was quick and easy, and we found most of the staff to be very accommodating and helpful - I did go down to reception to order a taxi for the next morning and was told to ring them myself as no concierge was on duty. I accepted this, but unfortunately the phone in the room wouldn't dial an outside line, so I had to go down to reception again. The night manager was rather bristly, but he did later apologise and also helped in getting the taxi organised as the person on the phone didn't understand my accent very well.The wifi was better in reception, and not very good in the rooms, and you would often see people on their phones downstairs. We were happy enough with the signal we got in the room though.There is no bar in the hotel itself, but there are two restaurants on either side of the entrance and also an Irish bar next door. The location of the hotel is really good too, a stone's throw from Times Square, close to NYC Sightseeing to organise your hop on/off bus tours, and within walking distance of Broadway and even the Intrepid.We enjoyed our stay, and would highly recommend The Gallivant Times Square.Kind Regards,Yvonne

My family of 5 stayed in the family room. It was very big for a New York Hotel room. The kids loved the bunk beds. The double beds were comfortable. The fridge was a nice bonus. I really didn't hear any street noise passed midnight.

Clean and neat. Location is outstanding when you compare with the prices of other hotels. It was actually really worth it. Room was so clean daily. since it's right across the Time Square it was such a great experience for us. This vacation will be remembered forever.

I could not have felt more welcome upon arrival after I met Suny who works on the front desk. She was absolutely charming - she did everything possible to ensure our check in was as smooth as possible (even though we arrived 7 hours before we were mean to check in). She really did offer a 5* service. The rooms are also very clean and in a fantastic location but the staff being as accommodating as they are really do make this hotel. I recommend this hotel to anyone and I have previously always stayed in the Waldorf Astoria which is considerably more expensive.

Stayed here last week for 5 days. We spent very little time in the room - as you would expect when visiting NYC, but our room (922) was perfectly fine. It was quite compact - but I have actually stayed in smaller at another hotel previously. The room was very clean - as was the bathroom. The bed was very comfy and the air con was very welcome. Checking in and checking out was simple and we were dealt with very professionally by the reception staff

I came on a holiday with my boyfriend and was instantly shocked by the lack of service from the receptionists. The room that we had was much smaller than what had been advertised and from then it really just went downhill. The shower is located right next to the toilet meaning when you do have a shower, you end up with a drenched toilet. The AC turned out to be a positive apart from the fact you found yourself spending the majority of the time swatting flies coming out of them. The room is dirty, and when I say dirty I mean it’s not CLEAN AT ALL. If not for the house keeper I can truly say I would’ve been out the first night. The only other positive is that the Beauty of Times Square distracted us from the ugly room. There is no room service meaning that if you do want to eat anything you find yourself wandering the streets constantly trying to make up from the poor service of the hotel. If after reading this review you still decide to stay at this hotel then be prepared for a $30 (nightly fee) which they only tell you about as You are checking out, which apparently is an ‘Urban Fee’ from the hotel. This was never specified. (It seems the staff have no communication and social skills, which is surprising for a place that’s meant to be welcoming)DO NOT STAY HERE. I only say this because I wouldn’t want anyone to have the experience we had

Ideal location for exploring Manhattan and dropping off those shopping bags without much disturbance to the itinerary. Comfy beds, nice new flat-screen, clean, air-conditioned. Staff was helpful and efficient.For two ladies not travelling light we could have used more hangers and shelving for storage.

Suny, at the front desk enlightenes the hotel with her kind and efficient service. It is wonderful to be received with honest care and wonderful attitude. Management must be very proud of her! Great beds and showers. Perfect location.

We loved this hotel, very near Times Square, near metro, near museum, near good restaurants... . The staff was very helpfully and nice. The amenities were nice. Just under bed was not so clean. The pillows were great.

Very good location, mediocre service. Reasonable price but the treatment of staff should improve .The room is comfortable for 5/6 passengers although the closet is very small.The room service is very uneven, there is always a lack of detail such as a bed not laid and the floor is not very clean

The Gallivant is a great hotel as base for exploring the city. You are next door to Times Square and everything is walking distance for you. The location can not be faulted and the rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated. Our main critiques were that our rooms were not refilled with toiletries, drinking cups and coffee during cleaning and staff were not that friendly. The hotel also whacks you a resort fee per night which is roughly $35. I’m sure common practice for NY hotels but was not made aware upon booking so watch out for this. There is also a charge of $3 per bag if you need to leave bags at hotel for a later flight - no issue for us but a little cheeky considering resort fee. Location alone makes the hotel worth a stay!

Pleasant place to stay, reasonable rates, close to plays, restaurants. Recently renovated so its attractive and clean. Room was very quiet at night even though overlooking a busy street. Concierge was helpful regarding restaurants. Bed was very comfortable.

We got smaller room than what been posted in the website. When I spoke with the manager he said we don’t have this room anymore and even though it’s all Photograpger business!!!! Reception man was really bad when we arrive as we asked him about anyone who can help us with the luggage and he said the man who responsible for this is on lunch time and no one can help you (time was 11 pm) then we asked about the parking place, immediately he said I’m not going to park your car, just go a cross the street and park your self although we didn’t ask him to park we just said if anyone can help us parking the car as we drove 12 hrs to get to New York. One of the room we got, the AC wasn’t working for two nights and all what they said we are trying to fix it but we can’t change the room !!!! Last night the manager said I’ll change your room and he barely agreed to refund us one night only despit sleeping two nights in hot summer. During the check out, the receptionist lady told us the manager said to refund only half night !!!!!! And unfortunately he is not here today !!!! Basically guys, stay away from this hotel as you can pay same amount with real 4 stars hotel in same area. This hotel should get two stars only not 4

Great location.good hotel .nice clean rooms .gym bit small.water at front door was nice idea .i would stay again 100%. People in reception are nice and with good attitude .rooms clean and nice beds .clean hotel .

The room was definitely not up to standard, especially for a 4 star hotel. There were a bunch of hairs both on the floor and in the bathroom. The room was extremely loud, as were the other people in the hotel. The room was definitely due for a renovation as there were scratches all over the wall. Would not have stayed here if it weren’t my last resort.

A tired hotel with many faults and poor service from some of the ‘front of house’ Staff. The noise alone (despite being close to Times Square) was enough to drive us to distraction. Until they invest in double glazing, we strongly recommend staying at least several blocks away.

Stayed in the city for 1 night for business at a construction site aka gallivant time square rooms have a horrible smell and they look like a leak occurred and it was I gnoses by management. Booked through hotel tonight and they refused to cancel my stay. Stay away not worth the location or the money.

Very comfortable beds, great shower, but best of all, kind lovely Suny at the front desk. Her beautiful soul enlightens the place!! Management should be very proud of her! Great location in the heart of Times Square.

Good budget hotel in an amazing location in Manhattan. Okay it’s a wait for the lift service, but I knew that when I booked. I liked the room which was very clean and peaceful. Very homely, unlike most hotels. Good bed and great shower in room 1104.

Beautiful and clean rooms, nice staff, easy check-in and check-out, computers for using! You get what you need, price ok! We would book this hotel again if we would come back to new york city (manhattan)!

Unfortunately the service is bad and the stuff is unqualified and deal with customer in impolite way will not choose or recommend this hotel again for any firends or family members also they take charge for leaving the luggage even within the check out period

A lot of things broken and rotten, very small room and bed for a “Deluxe Queen” would not stay here again and I wouldn’t recommend to anyone. The elevator was very slow, I was stood waiting on the 5th floor for 10 minuets with my case and ended up having to carry them down because of the wait! Only okay thing was the location.

Excelent location! The room is neat and clean, not so spacious though. I didn't know about a "nightly urban fee" during the reservation but it wasn't a deal breaker. Cordial staff and good installations.

The arrival desk agent made us feel like a hindrance and rather than look up and greet us, stared at her screen and waited for us to speak to her. The initial room was an absolute con. It was 501 and sold the same as the ones our friends were in in 707. The two rooms were worlds apart. One of your desk agents (not the same who checked us in) was able to move us but we had to wait a night. The room we moved to (728) was much more acceptable and in keeping with expectations of a) price paid and b) what a boutique Manhattan hotel should provide. $2 per bag to check bags is grasping for money. The hotel we stayed in prior to this did not charge for this and was in a similar location. Your lifts are tiny but 3 does make up for this slightly. Free water was a nice touch and appreciated on hot days. The air-con was good but the operating controls were hidden inside as opposed to the wall, this was not made clear anywhere. The concierge was barely available when we were there. Check out was relatively fuss free but the system was down when we checked out. We did get our invoice but had to ask when we came back to collect bags. Overall, quite a disappointment and not somewhere I'll be recommending.
Nunca nos devolvieron la diferencia a favor que nos cobraron por el deposito de $200!!!the concierge told us "dont worry" but the $200 deposit we made never returned to us!!!Never replied ours mails

Pretty clear from the title that it is the location of this hotel that is a winner. 2 minutes off Times Square makes this an ideal location for visitors to the Big Apple. The room was clear, decent size bathrooma and a comfortable bed. The only thing missing for an English couple was some tea bags as all you got was coffee.Found the resturants pricy but there are lots of delis where you can get a great sandwich or visit a cheap pizz a joint.

Bathroom was a little small. But everything else was very good. The location is extremely good. Specially if you want to explore mid Manhattan. Subway and restaurant are all over and times square is right on the corner of the street.

The hotel is great! Perfect service and clean. Always have water on summer and coffee on rooms. Also we have gym and you can leave yor luggages before the check in. When you check out you have to pay for leave them

First impressions great as front desk staff nice & welcoming. Booked in room with broken door moved to another room - housekeeping left pajamas on floor after cleaning (I never leave my own clothing on floor) and still knocked loudly when no disturb sign is on door.

This hotel was great. It was very clean. Location was great. Everything was within walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful. Good Morning America was like a 5 min walk. Central Park was out an 20 min walk. Location was awesome
Tired and dark hotel, needs some investmentTwin bed booked that was not available through out a 6 day stayLifts too busy and broken down quite oftenRooms are on the small sideAircon extremely noisy

We spend a beautiful days at the hotel. Close to Times Square is great!!!! We walked to every place from here!  . Thanks you everyone staff!! You everyone worked hard for the best cordiality.we are gonna recomend the Hotel.

We're UK tourists and we stayed at The Gallivant for our 5-night trip to New York. The hotel was great: really stylish and modern. The rooms were small, but that was fine for us as we spent most of our time out and about. The wi-fi worked brilliantly, the shower was great and the bed was comfortable. Location wise this is perfect: there is a good pub next door, a great coffee shop across the road, and you are only a couple of blocks from Times Square if you want to go that way, or you can avoid the hustle and bustle of it by walking up 8th avenue. You are also very close to restaurant row, and not far from the subway stations.We do have one complaint that stops this hotel getting 5 stars, and that is that the walls are very thin. This became a problem on our last night when the room next to us was occupied by a group of loud, drunk, obnoxious Americans who even before they started drinking FELT THE BEST WAY TO COMMUNICATE WAS VIA SHOUTING. We rang the reception desk during the night, but they seemed quite powerless to do anything. And mentioning it at check out just earned an apology. Not the hotel's fault, I suppose, but still annoying.So as long as your neighbours aren't a bunch of loud-mouth drunkards, this is well worth a look. That sentence could probably apply to most places.

The staff was helpful at all times. Rooms were clean. Nice bedding. Bathrooms had been updated along with flooring. Furniture in room could use some TLC. Coffee machine supplied which was nice. Would stay again.

Great hotel to stay with your family or only as a couple. I already went to this hotel couple times and I love the location and they service, it’s really clean, comfortable and the rooms are big which is really hard to find in NYC.

We decided to stay here since our room had a bunk bed for the kids. The location is great if you want to be close to Time Square. The restaurants next door are also very convenient. It was also very nice of the hotel to have water available in the lobby since it was extremely hot during our visit. In addition, our room was available earlier than anticipated upon arrival so that was very accommodating. Overall we had a good stay. There were a couple of cosmetic issues with our room and that's why I didn't give them a higher rating.

This hotel is in an excellent location for exploring the city. The rooms are comfortable but basic. There is no vending machine in the lobby, so make sure to purchase bottled water, if you require any for during the night. Staff were pleasant enough, but we had a problem with extra charges on our rooms, when we hadn't ordered anything. The hotel swipes your card on arrival, perfectly normal, however after 3 days , payments amounting to $1300.00 were charged. Staff were slow to respond, blaming it on a new computer system. We had to wait 4 days after our return to the UK to have the amounts refunded. Travellers beware, and watch your card balance. If we'd been relying on using that card to purchase other things whilst there, we would have been stuck.

Pleasant stay. Staff was helpful and friendly. A problem with the television in my room was taken care of right away. Received directions to different venues in NYC without problem. Room was clean and well taken care of.

Excellent location! Times Square, Subways, Rockefeller Plaza, 5th Avenue, Central Park are all within a few minutes walking. Aziz was amazing and very helpful!! Rooms are small, but for New York these are a good size.

I went here during a business trip so I needed calm an relax to be performing but the hotel is very loud and the air conditioning is super noisy. There was the receptionist that was rude and impolite, she treated us as stupid only because we have asked to issue an invoice with another name, really bad. Except this the position is amazing, close to Times Square and theaters! Rooms are quite clean but it can be improved.

Excellent location nice for one night the room was too small but the most annoying is the noise u can hear everything from u're room (if someone is walking by , open/close door etc) but as I said it was not terrible and to discover times square by night its alright

Great location and the staff was very friendly and helpful! We were very satisfied with our first visit to the Big Apple and getting to and from our hotel was very easy!!! We got a room with a balcony and it was well worth it!!! If you like plays there are two right outside the hotel door! I’ll be staying there again!!!

Arrived this afternoon was with a relatively large group. Staff were not very welcoming at all, room cleanliness is terrible, general feel of The Gallivant lacks a lot. 1st day of 5, let's see if our reviews of this hotel changes.

This was by no means a bad hotel, but we were slightly disappointed with our stay at The Gallivant. Our room seemed quite nice at a glance, but then it seemed at a closer look that quite a lot of things were either falling apart, old, or quite dirty. The aircon was noisy and we couldn't control if it was on or off. Despite this, the beds were really comfy and shower was nice and had a good pressure (although takes a while to heat up).We also agreed that we wouldn't stay on Times Square again as it was just too much. Times Square was absolutely incredible to visit, but constant stream of people, cars, people asking you to buy things, trash cans, bin bags, sirens, which is of course what you expect at Times Square, but to stay there is a lot after a while.Despite my slightly negative review, we had a great stay and for a relatively cheap hotel in a central location, it was good and did the job as we were barely in the hotel.

Stayed here for a week during our stay in New York, the hotel was great base for our adventure. Room was on the small side for 2 people sharing, but with enough space for both of us. Shower was spacious and of good quality. Beds were comfortable. One small issue with the air conditioning as it does get cold and loud, but we managed fine. Staff were fantastic and friendly and sorted any issue we had quickly. Location is right around the corner from times square.Do watch out for the urban fee they charge in hotels in the US. $240 was the final credit card fee on checkout. So do take a credit card and not debit. Overall a very good experience

We Arrived in the afternoon and were taken to a room that was not made up yet. The bell-man contacted reception and arranged another room in a few minutes - Which was smaller than what we booked... He then contacted reception again and managed to get us a duplicate room of what we booked (He was great!). But at this point we would have expected some compensation and or communication from the hotel to apologise for the inconvenience and sadly never heard another word from the hotel in the 2 days we were there. Wrt the room, it was small (but most NY hotels are on the cozy side, the most off putting part was the old wall mounted aircon that is extremely noisy. The location is really good though.

Stayed here with my mum for 3 nights. Great location, so close to Times Square but a bit far from downtown Manhattan! Small room but had everything we needed and was very clean and modern! I would return

We stayed here for our honeymoon and nobody goes to NYC to spend their time in the hotel room.We booked the cheapest room the hotel offered and I can understand why. The room was very small although nice and clean. I’ve not stayed in New York before but understand the rooms are not known for being huge! We arrived and opened the blinds expecting to see great views of the city! Instead we were greeted by it so great views of air conditioning and electronic units and pipes! The blind quickly went down and stayed down for the duration... although unfortunately this didn’t drown out the noise from them!Our room was on the 1st floor and this was great for us as it seems the lifts could be a nightmare in the hotel!The location of this hotel is superb, literally stepping out onto Times Square! We would definitely return to this hotel but would upgrade the room to hopefully be able to open the blinds!

We stayed at the Gallivant from Thursday 11th July till Monday 15th.Queen size room and on a lower floor as requested due to Asthma issues.Which were given the 3rd floor which was good.Lifts as in other reviews stated that you had a long wait.We never had that issue.Room was small but your in NY you shower and sleep.We had no noise from outside.But..Guess on our corridor thought it fine to slam doors during the night time which made the room shake and wake you up.So have some consideration for other guess and just close the door quietly.NY is an amazing place Buzzing and the hotel is a short walk to all the madness.Hotel is clean and you do have to pay a urban Tax which Love Holidays never mentioned to us but I read this on TA and knew I had to pay.This is not the hotels fault.We enjoyed our stay even with the black out of electricity for a few hours.The hotel provided us with a torch to go to our room and sit in the dark.Good stay and the staff were polite.Enjoy the big apple

Lovely hotel, everything was on the doorstep. Our room was spotlessly clean and a good size with a great balcony. Staff were friendly and very helpful. My son and i enjoyed our stay there very much and would definitely stay there again.

When we arrived at the gallivant we were welcomed by a very pleasant lady calledSunny....who not only welcomed us with open arms and a very warm smile,this set us up with a great impression that we were going to have a great time here ,ok the room was a bit small but it was adequate for us and it was very clean to high standard each day the decor I loved ,and down stairs there are restaurant either side ,just around the corner from time SQUARE but far enough from all the noise ,ideal location ,we were at back of the hotel there was no noise what so ever I would go back 100%,..even just to see suny alone ,she is the star of the show one of the nicest person I have ever met in my life a total asset to the company. from the lallys 4th _ 11 July.....

Our stay in the hotel was excellent. As a young couple, we spent a lot of time out of the hotel and exploring the local area but whilst in the hotel I could have no complaints.The room was everything you would need, not large but more than enough room for us and the air conditioning was much appreciated during the heat!One flaw which I experienced was the concierge desk. when I asked for help regarding airport transfers, the concierge rudely directed me to a phone which wasn’t in great condition and wasn’t working properly. Making a simple booking, hard work!Overall, comfortable and ideal. I would book again without any worries

The staff were good the location was goodThe rooms were small and outdated with doors that resembled hospital doorsAs early as 8:00 you get woken by military style shouting of “housekeeping” and banging on the hospital doorsThe photos look very (positively) different to reality You have to pay for the storage of your luggage which i find petty and cheepThe price for the rooms was very fair though

Loved the room we were staying in very quiet at night yet very central and just off Times Square location is perfect. Brilliant value for money and the hotel is very clean and staff are excellent and friendly

AVOID this hotel. This hotel should be shut down!! We Stayed here for 3 nights for my mums birthday. On arrival the reception area looks nice with a huge fish tank But it stops there then you meet the staff - rude, do not smile & don’t care about you. We paid a wooopping £500 for 3 x nights. We changed our room 4 times!! All the rooms are tiny, you can’t open your suit case on the floor it’s that small. 1st room smells like Damp. 2nd room food over the floor, dust & white stains on the purple chair god knows what that was, 3rd the roof of the shower was disgusting green mould everywhere, 4th room was a little better but loads of small flies in the bathroom maybe like 30 every day. I asked to speak to the hotel manager after waiting 20 minutes. He told me he’s only worked there for two weeks. There’s no other rooms available (even though there was on the website) so thanks for Lying! so as a goodwill gesture after the first night he will refund me the other two nights & don’t stay with us. In all my life I’ve NEVER had a hotel turn away my business because the hotel is rubbish. If you know the hotel is awful don’t sell the rooms!! Lower the price, don’t advertise it as 4 star when it’s actually a 1 star & don’t lie in the pictures. All the pictures online are FAKE! When I told the manager our room is nothing like the pictures we booked, he told me they are fake pictures & all edited!! You can hardly see out of the windows they covered in dirt. No WIFI only in reception, Mirror light did not work in the bathroom. All the furniture has wood chips missing, Towel holder falling off, old crappy TV on the wall, paint missing on the ceilings & walls, no good views of the street in any rooms, noisy, toilet roll holder hanging off. The only good thins is the safe. All the rooms are the same in this hotel so if you want a nice stay AVOID there are way better hotels at the same price or less. Is hotel is completely false advertised & the cleaners are clearly not doing their jobs right. Please see all the pictures I’ve posted. You completely ruined my mums birthday Gallivant!!

Loved the location of the hotel and the room was fabulous. We stayed in a room which had 2 sleeping areas - one with bunk beds and one with a queen bed. There was plenty of room for my husband and I and our 2 teenage boys.Very comfortable beds and the room was quiet despite being so close to Times Square. Also appreciated the water available in the lobby each morning.

Don’t let the lobby fool you. The rooms and hallways are nothing like it. Our entire floor smelled like weed. Hallways were dingy, rooms could be dingy too depending on which one you get. One of ours was just ok and the other was gross. We booked our rooms in April, confirmed the day before and still didn’t get what we paid for. Check in was difficult. We were lied to about availability as people checking in after us were able to get the rooms we booked?? We stayed only one night so we dealt with it but any longer I would have found another place. Basically, only stay here if you are on a very tight budget and are able to lower ur standards. The location is good and it’s cheap for the city. I would not recommend it to women traveling alone, the elevator doesn’t have cameras and some of the people staying here were a bit intimidating. I didn’t feel safe walking the hallways or taking the elevator alone. I had an elevator experience that scared the crap out of me. Good luck!!

I am a returning guest and plan to stay again in the future. Great location! The staff at Gallivant were kind and friendly. The rooms are very neat and clean. It would be nice to receive a discount for returning guests!

In april we have had a very disappointing stay in the Galivant, well it didn't even end up as a stay. Never before have I walked away from a hotel. But this time we were basically forced due to it being in a bad state and the hotel not being able to provide a room that was somewhat acceptable even.
