The rooms were supposed to be renovated but everything seemed kinda old and worn out, the furniture was far from new and the photos had been photoshopped. It didn't look like the photos at all. There was a problem with the heating where it wouldnt stop working, eventhough it was supposed to be on airconditioning to the point that it started smelling like it was about to burst in flames. Electricity sockets werent working and the rooms were really noisey. Not something you would expect for a 200 euro a night hotel. The way the "management" responded was very unprofessional, when it turned out that maintenance couldnt fix the heating isue the manager apologised but said that there was nothing more she could do and that we just had to deal with it. We are talking about a problem with the heating constantly blowing at full heat and speed. It felt like a sauna. Regarding the Wifi the modem was supposed to be reset and that should solve it, but it didn't. Then the manager tried to blame it on our phones since we all had iphones. Eventhough the wifi was working fine at the reception, but it wasnt on other floors, clearly making it a receiving issue. After having checked 5 different rooms which all had the same problems we decided we no longer wanted to stay and wanted a refund. The manager insisted that we would have to pay for one night, on which we replied that that would be fine IF they could provide us rooms that were acceptabel. With acceptabel we agreed that there would be no heating issue and the wifi would be working. The new rooms we got again had the same problems, so we wanted to go. Having spent 4 hours trying to get a decent room it was enough. Unfortunately the manager didn't keep up to her side of the agreement and still wanted to charge us for the first night. Which we don't agree with and still expect a full refund or an other solution. During the time we were complaining multiple guests came downstairs to complain either about the heating or wifi. Looking at the recent tripadvisor reviews I think it pretty much confirms our experience. After leaving the hotel we booked a room in a hotel also on timesquare for the same price which basically was 10 times better, just to show it wasn't about us having wrong expectations.

first time in New York and hotel was very clean, rooms were great size and comfy. Fresh towels where supplied everyday. Location was amazing only 2 minutes from Times Square and 10 mins to Rockefeller centre.

Just had a 4 night stay at this hotel. Check in wasn't until 3pm we arrived at 2pm and our room was ready check in was very easy. Room was clean and modern although a bit on the small side but your hardly ever in the room so it was fine. Hotel is great location it's literally on times square. We found if you walk two blocks upto 50th street you can get the subway to basically anywhere. For being on ti.es square we heard no noise at night sleeping wasn't a problem. Overall this is a great hotel and not too expensive considering location would stay here again no problem.

This hotel room had a mini queen bed, my wife is pregnant and we had very bad sleep for this small bed... the room is also small but you cant wait more from new york... the hotel is very very well located !

The Gallivant time square hotel is the worst i have stayed in my entire life!! a big contrast from what we experienced having just arrived from a 4 nights stay in Miami and a weeks long Caribbean cruise, we decided to stop by New York before heading back to London UK ( all flights and hotel booked through British Airways) within 5 minutes of checking in (09/07/2019) we had to change rooms 3 times and still not happy with the room, how anyone can rate this 5 star is beyond me. the only thing the hotel has going on his close proximity to times square but to be honest i rather stay in new jersey. The rooms are tiny and looks nothing like the pictures, the internet is painfully slow it takes about 30 mins to log into hotmail account, the rooms have no fridge! and beware of the additional non refundable $39 per night you have to pay upon arrival. we are day 1 of 4 into this nightmare of a place and are looking for alternatives already, my only grudge is with British Airways for marketing such an hotel in their holiday package, i can carrying on writing about the horrible hotel however A WORD IS ENOUGH FOR THE WISE I REPEAT AGAIN - AVOID AVOID AVOID !!!!

This hotel literally has it all...Tiny dark dingy rooms, filthy, broken furniture, plug sockets hanging out the wall, shower head coming away from the wall, windows caked in grime, view of a wall from the room, shower leaks all over bathroom floor, tiny beds (booked double, got single), paper-thin walls meaning we could hear sex noises from next door and allowed us to shout 'bless you' to the other next door whenever they sneezed (and they could hear us), bathroom filled with the aroma of mildew and damp whenever the shower was turned on, lights not working, rowdy groups in neighbouring rooms, noisy cleaning staff (our room was situated just where the cleaners like to keep their trolleys), urban tax for water that was never available when asked for, and finally rude staff that didn't give a toss when I raised these things with them. The place needs knocking down. AVOID AVOID AVOID!

I was quite concerned about staying here after reading reviews on the hotel on TripAdvisor. I found this hotel to be very good. The WiFi is a bit hit or miss but found everything else to be perfectly fine. The staff were friendly, the lifts were fine and the room size was perfect (we stayed in a family room). Sure I've stayed in bigger rooms but it is NYC and the five of us had plenty of space. The location is perfect.

Location location and location. The Gallivant is a wonderful hotel located in the heart of Times Square. The rooms are comfortable and Tricia at the service desk provides outstanding service. The place to stay in New York.

This Hotel is not fancy but it is very clean and comfortable and perfect for a good nights sleep which is all you need as you will be out in New York the rest of the time. It is in the absolute best location that cannot be beaten on price. Just around the corner are the hop and hop off bus routes, times square and all the broadway theatres and choice of subways. It is centrally located also for making a trip uptown one day and downtown the next and always in the centre of action at Times Square. Be prepared that with this location is traffic ++++ so allow plenty of time for transit to and from airports. A block away on the corner is a deli that sells everything edible. There are plenty of pizza bars and restaurants too.

My husband and I had a 3 night stay here to begin our honeymoon. The location is amazing, just steps from many major attractions and the hop on, hop off bus tour stop. We enjoyed our stay in a clean and comfortable room. The air con was good. We were able to adjust the settings to make our room as cool as we wanted. A word of warning for future guests: avoid the breakfast at all costs! It is not good and there are a huge variety of great breakfast options only minutes from the hotel. We loved cosmic diner which is less than 5 minute walk away. Also be aware of the extra charge per night. We didn't know about this until we checked in. Overall a fantastic stay in a magnificant city!

Be aware that there is a hidden fee of $30 per night +tax for business center, gym and "complimentary" water (which if you pay is anything but). This fee is applied whether or not you use any of the above, and I was not made aware when booking, and it also not called out on my confirmation email. And you must pay the fee. This should be part of the overall hotel rate or be only applied when using any of the conveniences. Borderline fraudulent in my opinion. Rooms were not ready by 3pm either. Hotel is otherwise OK though.

Do not stay here. The staff were terrible. Made us feel like a bother even for the simple request . The free WiFi is awful. We bookenhopong we can use in the evening it was impossible to log in and stay logged in WiFi. The lifts were awful and small. The rooms were dirty. Terrible experience and paid so much money to stay here.

in 4 days of lodging only one did cleaning, we always asked in reception that they never cleaned, the receptionists were not kind to the guests, we asked to speak in Spanish, they said not to understand

Average hotel close to Times Sq. Room was clean but AC didn't work properly. Beware they charge a daily fee on top of the room charge which is a lot higher than the state/city tax. They also declined my credit card several times before arrival without any reason causing additional hassle

Room was very small. It is quiet on the upper floors. There are 2-3 very small elevators that are slow. Location is good. The night staff wasn't there when we needed to place a wake up call. We booked a balcony room and didn't get it. Shower was clogged and had to call repair guy and waited 30 min for it to be fixed.

I was very happy with my stay at your hotel. Wonderful location..clean environment and very friendly staff. The room was very clean and stocked with the basics for a travel stay. Overall.. I would definately return!!

No fridge, small rooms, no carpet, no ice bucket that holds a bottle, location to time square was excellent, double bed was small, bathroom was small and the drain in shower seemed blocked, WiFi was poor.

this is a wonderful place to stay the service was great they even let us leave our bags until it was time to checkin.Our Troop enjoyed staying there the wifi was great .the rooms were clean and we had plenty room

For those families,in our case five people, the family room was great. The hotel is in the heart of New York, a block from Times square. The family room had all the features you expect from mini fridge coffee machine access to ice machine for those endless sodas. Of course top notch wi fi covering all the family downloads. Staff could be more helpful,from mals guides to best pizza joints.A1 for the family on a budget.

We checked into the hotel and it was a breeze but later on that night we were called and told we were given the wrong room and we didn’t realize. They were not going to make us move but said they would discount the rate 30 dollars a night. It sounded great but then I realized I had booked a deluxe king room with more square footage but I was in a room with a double bed and less square footage so them taking 30 dollars off the price of the king room I paid for barely was a deal for being forced into a double bed. I went to the desk and they had no more rooms available that night but offered another 30 dollars a night off. Overall it’s a nice hotel and friendly staff but I did not get what I booked or what I paid for.

Always enjoy staying at the Gallivant. I am always welcomed and ever got upgraded this time to a VERY nice room. Cant beat the location to all the Broadway Theatres and central park. I look forward in staying here again.
user_name:
Frank B
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel located to west side of the top of Times Square. Fantastic location as right in amongst the theatres and action. 10mins from Rockerfeller. 10mins from subway station at 42nd which gets you to all the other main attractions in no time. There is a Junior’s just round the corner wher you can grab breakfast. Hotel breakfast options is really a no go. Overall it’s a very small compact hotel. But for a family of 5 we got a fantastic room with 2 bunk beds and two doubles. Enormous shower room and plenty of space. Guys it’s the middle of NYC. We were here to enjoy the place not lounge in the hotel. If that’s you and you have a big family, try here. If you are looking to lounge round a classy hotel, go elsewhere, but you will pay 2.5 times the price and be in a worse location.

The hotel is strategically located and the room is comfortable.The worst if this hotel is the room cleaning. I found garbage below the bed from previous guests and the elevators very slow, alaways full.

hotel was very central for getting around New York. Friendly staff and very clean. would definitely recommend for anyone wanting to be close to times Square and Broadway. also handy for hop on hop off bus tours and restaurants.

Half a block from times square, rooms big compared to others in NY. My mattress needed to be replaced and my aircon didn't really work but I was only in the room to sleep. Location was great, staff were friendly and helpful.

Overall experience ok. However when my other family members arrived from Rome their suite room wasn’t available. For the first night they sleep in two separate rooms. This was very inconvenient because they have to girls and also the next day we had to move again.

Greeting at desk is very inviting. However, I requested a refrigerator for my husbands special needs medication. refrigerator never delivered.The rooms are dark and sleeping very uncomfortable with the AC up and down. But for business trip it is good value. And location is best asset.

Upon check in my room had been assigned to someone else with the same last name. They accommodated by assigning another room, however, upgraded the room price as well, Upon check out, the provided receipt had my name, however, an address that I was not affiliated with. I did not notice this before leaving the hotel and went to complete expense reports.. I recommend the hotel but with caution. On a positive note, the location is excellent.

The room we requested was not available and we were upgraded to the penthouse. It was an amazing week. The hotel is close to all the broadway shows, Time square and Rockfellow center and tons of great places to eat! Price is very competitive for the location.

We arrived at the hotel at 2am, Check-in was a breeze. The person at the desk was friendly and welcoming. We received a room on the second floor. This turned out to be nothing like the rooms pictured on the website. It was small - even by downtown city standards. The room was clean, but well worn. The bathroom door would not close. The bed was uncomfortable and worst of all, the Air conditioning did not work. It was too late and we were too tired to seek out a new room. The next morning, after complaining we were promised a new room. We got one later that day, as promised. It was on a higher floor, and it was a bigger, and resembled those we saw in pictures. However, The room had problems. The deadbolt on the door did not work, the bathroom extractor fan did not work. While the room looked like those pictured, it was clearly very well worn and it showed on the walls, furniture, especially the bed, which was very uncomfortable. The hotel staff and housekeeping were always friendly and helpful, but the hotel itself was completely unsatisfactory. Location was great, close to everything.

I primarily chose this hotel because of its location. I should have read more reviews first. Whilst the staff were nice enough, the overall amenities were dreadful. The lifts sounded like they were about to break at any moment.Carpets have seen better days.No soundproofing: noisy inside and outside.The hot water takes ages to come on.Bathroom is tiny and uncomfortable to move around. Very poor value for money. Sorry but definitely won't stay here again.

We had arrived to NYC late Sunday evening only to find out that our airbnb had cancelled on us. In a rush, we searched and searched for an affordable hotel for the night. We stumbled upon the Gallivant. Tucked away, this hotel is super cute and quaint. The concierge was very kind and even bumped us up into the Junior penthouse. Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

The bathroom and shower stall in our room were tiny and the hall ways are narrow. Maybe that's why it's considered a Boutique Hotel. This hotel has been remodeled/redecorated and was clean. "The Prom" was playing right next door, "Hades Town" right across the street and Broadway is at the corner. Staying in Times Square comes with emergency vehicle sirens and car horns. Bottom line: We didn't come to NYC to stay in the room and we couldn't beat this hotel's location in Times Square for the price.

The stay was quite good, room clean, regular maid service, and staff very helpful. Only slight trouble was TV didn't work, but I don't watch much tv, so that was not a big issue for me. The hotel is in an excellent centralized location.

Easy checkin, reasonable price, small (but not by NYC standards) room. Clean and comfortable and quiet (especially considering how close to Times Square). My one complaint is the ridiculously slow wi-fi? Sure it’s “free” but traveling for business really makes it necessary to have a reasonable connection speed. Want to get online? Have some bandwidth on your wireless plan or head for the lobby. Seriously - fix that wi-fi and you’ve got a really nice place!

Well located. Small rooms, insufficient maintenance, room was dirty (windows, stains in the walls and curtains), mattress was too soft and very. unfortunately I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone. :(

The hotel is in a perfect location near Times Square. It was ideal for us as we attended events on 111th Street and found it easy to take the #1 Uptown from the hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable. It was quiet location. The room (808) near the elevator was smaller than even some hotel spaces we stayed in Europe. It was more than acceptable as we were here only for one night. The room does have coffee which I enjoy as soon as I rise in the morning. All in all a great location and perfect for a short stay in NYC.

Loved the hotel! In New York.. especially around the times Square area.. most the hotels have small rooms! Although our bathroom was small.. the room was spacious! Lobby area of the hotel is nice. No issues with noise, mess etc etc! They provide you with bottles of water each day.. even in the lobby. We had no issues leaving our luggage behind on the last day whilst we went out (flight was in evening!!) But there was a small charge. There was a lady in the lobby for excursions and sightseeing info but as we had the sightseeing pass we didn't need to deal with her. It's a perfect hotel for location as you come out of the hotel, turn right and right again and there you have it... The FAMOUS times Square!! There's tube stations very close by! Literally 3 minutes walk! There's restaurants .. takeaways .. convenience stores etc etc!

Stayed here for 3 nights , asked for another room as rooms are very small. The room I was upgraded to was only marginally better . The noise from the street could have been lessoned if the windows were fitted better , I thought the window was open but it wasn’t .  The cleanliness was good . My first room the safe wasn’t working and the air con was debatable , I asked for it to be corrected and it took over an hour for the maintenance guy to come after ringing a second time . It has no restaurant as such ,except for a Chinese/Japanese/vietanameme either side . When you check out you can leave your cases with them for a charge of $2 a case if your waiting for transport . This is not a hotel I would come back to

If you looling for a good clean hotel with a great location this is perfect, staff are very helpful and loved our room and hotel,its a minute walk to times square one way and thevsame to hells kitchen otherway, will defo come back

The room was decent, just barely big enough to hold the playpen that they provided for our son. There was really not enough room to walk between the playpen and the bed. The closet was tiny, the coffee pot standard, the bed was decent, and out the window was a view of a brick wall.The bathroom was nice looking, but the shower glass was so small that the entire bathroom got soaked when you take a shower. I mean as soon as you turn the water on, it starts spraying beyond the shower area. That was VERY annoying.Our room was near the elevator, so it got pretty noisy at times, especially during housekeeping hours (something to keep in mind if you come back midday with small children to nap).The elevators were small, and took a while to get there; we took the stairs whenever we didn't have our stroller with us.The breakfast buffet was at the Asian restaurant next door. It was good every day, and the owner was super nice.There were a few times that we called the front desk for various things, and they took forever to get someone to help us, and a few times even forgot.The location was good, right off of 8th Avenue, and pretty close to the heart of Times Square.I don't intend on staying again, since there are similarly priced hotels, that feel a little bigger in the rooms, a little cleaner, and the bathrooms don't get soaked when you turn the water on.

Great location, clean rooms, best nyc experience. Front desk gentleman very kind.beds were comfortable. The cleaners were also very prompt in cleaning as we usually left at different times and returned and rooms were completed, without any disruption to our stay.

We are spending 9 nights at this hotel. Since the first day we noticed mosquitos and flies everywhere in the restroom . also the cleaning of floor is not sufficient. We asked the reception to take care of this, but flies are still there after 3 days

Perfect location, friendly and helpful staff, clean room and clean toilet.May be small for a family due to small rooms and small corridors, small toilets but it is perfect for solo travellers who just want a few days break in the heart of Times square,

Great stay at this hotel! Only downside I can say is that the reservation said there would be a small fridge in the room and there was not. Great location! Easy to get to the theater district and Time square

The room.I.rented was not available, so.they put me in a mold infested room.I asked if I could get another and was told they would not switch me and it was not to bad. I have asthma and it was pretty bad. I.would say this hotel.should not charge more that $75 tops

We enjoyed the scenery fr ok m the Penthouse. Room very comfortable. Just needed bottle of water kept in room would be nice. Last minute travel turned out to be a great moment up close and and fun in Time Square

The hotel is just off Times Square. Great location in the heart of Broadway. Friendly helpful staff. Clean, modern rooms. It is a little noisy with the sounds of NYC sirens, etc. But after 1st night you didnt really notice. Overall a great place to stay!

I came to NY and found this hotel. The room I stayed in was a double twin bed room, which really tight an small and felt as if it was an adjoining room for a family and we got that small room where the kids sleep. There was no fridge, the faucet for the shower kept kept falling off and no one bothered to fix it. Besides the tiny room, there was no earlier check in which is really an inconvenience. Besides the location of the hotel, which is great, I was not impressed with this hotel. Three hundred bucks a night for a tiny room, no fridge and a broken faucet. And on top of all that, a urban fee, which I didn't even use their gym facility or even their business facilities. Overcharged!

We had a fantastic stay. We were 3 adults and the rom was nice and clean. The reception staff were very helpful and accommodating. Will definitely visit again. The loaction is great and very close to Times Square.

Hotel was clean, comfy bed with fresh linen every 2 days and fresh towels every day. I would recommend this hotel, couldn’t be any closer to Times Square which is the NYC dream. Not on a very noisy street.

So the big plus point this hotel has is, it’s so close to time square. This does make it very noisy,and that is about all it has going for it, The room is small, broken plug, dirty window tiny bathroom bunged up loo,no fridge, no hairdryer,and room service starts knocking from 8.30,and she’s no bloody noisy moaning about the guests because she’s got rooms to clean.Be Aware you will also be charged a daily fee of 34.95 Urban fees that iv no clue what for, breakfast is served in the Chinese next door, (not great and at 21.95 each I’d go elsewhere)Desk staff, are not rude, just bored and it shows,Disability wise, you would not be able to get a wheelchair in the lifts, so I’m assuming they have ground floor rooms with accessible bathrooms, unless they state this just don’t bother. No water in the room only coffee making facilities all packed in plastic.

We were very disappointed at the hotel, I thought for the price we had paid that it would have been more than a basic hotel. The bedroom was adequate size, but could have done with triple glazed windows & curtains to block the constant noise out. The bathroom was the smallest we have ever stayed in. On a plus side the staff were really friendly. Although this hotel was central & to expect noise I think money could be spend on trying to alleviate this.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Gallivant Times Square. Location is perfect (particularly if you want to see Broadway shows), staff were friendly and helpful and room was clean with all the necessary features. Restaurant AnNam next door also very good. All in all, can't find much to fault! Alfonso at front desk was particularly helpful when I encountered difficulties with the wifi, as was the gentleman working in security who helped with my room key (sorry I didn't get his name!)

Not value for money. Rated 4 star but was not. The WiFi was the worst. I had better rooms in Washington DC Chicago for a third of the price. The bathroom was so small. No fridge in the room for drinks. Location was great but no views from windows. This should only be rated 2-3 star. Disappointed!!!!
user_name:
Explore27321775608
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

review_body: The only good point of this hotel is the location. 2 mins away from Times Square. When we first checked in we were allocated a room, went to said room and it hadn't even been cleaned yet. I went back down to reception and the woman just complained about all the issues she has with the cleaners and started moaning to another colleague at how the room was marked 'ready' when it wasn't. No apology. Got assigned to another room.Got to the room, it was soooooooo hot. The air conditioner was really loud and kicking out hot air. When trying to change it to cool, the unit wasn't even turned on ?!?! It was also really hot to touch, it would of hurt little kiddies. I told reception about the issue as was hard to sleep the first night with the heat and noise and was told someone would fix but no one ever did. I didn't follow it up as was only there 2 nights and wanted to make the most of my time there. The bed seemed old too as it was very 'saggy' (see photo). The bathroom and shower was very small but served its purpose. I didn't like how it was all wood floors as it made walking back to the bed very slippery.I didnt pick this hotel as it was part of a package but I wouldn't stay again.

Excellent position for Time square, pleasant helpful staff. No rooms with a bath, shower room small, well worth using for a short stay. Close to tube station and theatre district. Our room had a small bed, would suggest a upper floor room to get away from the traffic noise of a busy area

New York was a "bucket list" strike off. The Gallivant was ideally placed and reasonably priced. The staff were very helpful and friendly although the room was a disappointment, it didn't spoil the trip.
user_name:
Explore10728819048
Burton upon Trent, United Kingdom

review_body: When we arrived, we were asked to wait for 15min due to a technical issue to the hotel's computers. One hour later, the hotel staff had still no possibility to check us in and simply cancelled our reservation (although we were there in central NYC at 8pm without any back-up plan).This service is just pure joke and has no place in Times Square ! Hopefully, we could cross the street and find a REAL hotel with a REAL and COMPETENT staff.

Fantastic stay! Thought the room were a little small at 1st but then again you are hardly in them. Excellent location easy to get everywhere! Only downside the lifts are really slow and warm! But that can live with! Would defo recommend

We spent 5 nights at the Gallivant, which is 2 minutes walk from Times Square, and about 50 minutes from JFK on the Air Train and E line subway. We had a quick, cheerful check-in and were happy to see free chilled water in the lobby. The rooms we had were a little on the small side, but perfectly adequate and had all the facilities required - coffee/tea making facility, flat screen TV, free wifi, in room safe, plenty space to hand clothes and good air-con. On our last day, we checked out quickly and left our cases ($2/case) with the bell boy. All in all, a great base near Times Square at an excellent price (for NYC!).

We found all the staff to be friendly and helpful, rooms are on the small side but very clean and the bed and pillows very comfortable. Most important after a long day exploring New York! Didn't have a problem with noise, would have liked tea/coffee making facilities in the room.Rooms could probably do with a makeover and the bathroom is a bit cramped but these are small criticisms. The Gallivant is in a great location and when we visit New York again we will book this hotel again, would recommend.
user_name:
David John W
Beccles, United Kingdom

review_body: Front desk staff had less than zero interest in helping. They seemed annoyed and bored with the people arriving. Elevator waits are excruciatingly long. Twin beds are cot sized but comfy. Room was fairly quiet. Cleaning staff were very nice and helpful. Water does not drain in shower, and lighting in room and bathroom non-existent. Very hard to see face in mirrors. Zero counter space anywhere. Slow internet. Overall, this hotel is outrageously priced for what you get. It is a few doors down from fire department, so sirens galore.

I have never been to this hotel but I definitely will be back again. When I come to NYC I normally stay at the same hotel, however the previous time I had a terrible experience and this time was looking for somewhere new to stay and found the gallivant hotel in time Square. I was very happy with the service and my room and the location.. I would definitely come back again

The hotel is close of 50th subway station, from where you can go to every side of NYC. They serve free water and have the space to stock the luggage after check out. The crew is well prepared to receive public from any nationality. Our standard room was small and located at 8th floor. I vividly recommend this hotel for couples, in short stay and for people that want to be next of a very busy region of NYC.

Perfect location at midtown, easy to access and travel to, nice staff. Otherwise the room looks a bit aged, shower equipment making disturbing noise for quite a while after finishing. The room size is not satisfying, which is comprehensible in manhattan, but still it's clearly not a 4-star hotels.

I’m a Reception Manager for a large Advertising company in London, so my standards are very high when it comes to customer service..............Arrived on a Friday evening, to very uninterested staff, no bell boy to take luggage to our room, missing lights, air con on full blast, no manual or instructions on how to use it, bedroom door every time it opens or closes sounded like an haunted house, shower tap fell off the wall, wi-fi is terrible, then to be woken up @ 6am to some sort of domestic abuse coming from the next room, after calling security, no follow up call to us to see if we were ok after this situation. The gym only has one cross trainer and one treadmill, waited to use machines!!! Overall service was terrible.

Our room was very disappointing. It was our first trip to NYC and the US. The decor was drab - wallpaper peeling - handle missing from the only chest of drawers (although this was replaced when we mentioned it) and the room was very small. The ensuite was tiny and water soaked the floor every time you showered. The room was well cleaned and towels changed every day but the grout in the shower was black with mould. The staff at reception were helpful but if you wanted bottled water you had to remember to pick it up from reception on the way to your room. The location was great for site seeing - just 2 minutes from Times Square and just off Broadway. It was noisy at night - only to be expected with that location though. We loved being in NYC and really enjoyed our stay. We walked miles every day! Very good friendly Italian restaurant just down the street called Friends & Family.

We stayed at the gallivant for 3 night, the location of the hotel was fantastic with it being right in the middle of timesquare! As it was so central you felt perfectly safe walking back late in the evening and there were a number of subway stations within a 5 minute walk. I had seen some bad reviews about the hotel but our room was very spacious for New York, the bathroom was modern and clean and it wasn’t very noisy. Overall it was a great hotel and I would definitely stay at the gallivant for my next visit to New York!!

Bad value for money! The hotel's pictures on website don't match reality. We booked Deluxe Room with King Bed and it was like a chip motel. Extremely small, dirty, wall view, unfriendly and unhelpful stuff at the reception in the evenings (hi, Antonio) and all of this costs $322 per night with all taxes and fees. Fortunately we had a flexible tariff and we left this terrible place immediately.

When we arrived you cannot complain about the location, definitely the hotels strongest point. Located just off Times Square we walked everywhere which is ideal. The rooms however are incredibly disappointing, the double beds are not double, during our stay of 2 nights we had 3 rooms, the first room the bed was bowing in the middle and incredibly small for two people. The second room flooded over night from the AC, and the third I must say was incredible, they upgraded us to a penthouse room. The pictures should be more representative of the rooms as they are very deceiving.In terms of staff a gentlemen named Aziz with glasses is quite possible the rudest most patronising front of house staff I’ve seen in hospitality. Even after I made he hotel aware of this he still replied sarcastically and arrogantly. My advice would be if staff can’t find it in them to be nice and polite they make them the first people guests are around as this is many peoples first impression of the hotel, especially in a country where staff expect tips, I’ll be surprised if anyone tips Aziz. Luckily we came across the manager Yannek and a woman named Cassandra who were much better and helped with the upgrade and sorting of our stay.

We are just back from a three night stay at the Gallivant and found it a perfect base to explore NYC. Yes the rooms are not large and it is noisy outside - but you are in NYC a city that doesn't sleep - if you want a big room with peace and quiet maybe NYC is not for you! There are only two lifts but we never had to wait too long - I am sure at peak times it might be more of an issue. I have mobility problems are we were given a single queen room with a wet room as an en-suite which made a huge difference - it was perfect. Our room was clean and daily maid service was good.The tax and urban fee could be a shock to UK travellers if not factored into overall price - check it is included in the rack rate quoted on booking sites.The Gallivant is in the heart of the action and a perfect base to enjoy NYC, it is clean and I found the staff helpful and friendly. I would stay again.

Second time visit to NY..first stay at this hotel. When booking holiday we paid to upgrade to queen room as said it was larger.When arrived was shocked how small the room was...we was room 1120. Whilst I know it's only a base as out exploring the city..I don't know how much larger this room was to the standard. Bathroom really small and no shelf in there to put any toiletries like toothbrushes/ toothpaste/ deodorants etc.when showering remember to put towels on floor right outside shower as the screen doesn't stop any water coming out onto tiled bathroom floor. also shower head was half hanging off wall. Air con unit in need of repair..and other general fixes in room. Housekeeping great every day. 4 coffee pods provided each day for machine but we took a travel kettle and t bags so used those rest of time in morn and eve..bought milk in nearby shop.Wi-Fi not great...wifi service included in the extra 25 dollars a night They charge you on checking out...urban tax...but needs sorting as paying for the service...kept cutting in and out and very slow...and had to re log on a few times over the week as it took us out completely. Wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

We’ve just returned from a fabulous four night stay at the Gallivant. Excellent location. Lovely and clean and important to me, a comfy bed and pillow. Everyone very knowledgable and helpful. Would stay there again.

Excessive noise from road at front of hotel, excellent location, good value for money, hotel was spotlessly clean, let us check in early.Staff were very helpful, especially Azeez on the front desk.Would recommend.

Please do not believe the bad reviews, I really have no idea what people expect in this day and age, The room was lovely - we got upgraded as it was my birthday and our wedding anniversary, the staff were very helpful and courteous, the location was amazing and the Marine fish display in reception was unique.I've stayed in 2 other hotels in New York and various hotels In California, Nevada and Phoenix and I would say they here is as good as them.The lift sometimes took a while as its an old building and due to their popularity and the wifi was a bit hit and miss, but thats no big deal to be honest. If I stayed in New york again I would be happy to come back.

We spent 4 nights there, 8th floor out of 19 floors I think. I was worried before I arrived after reading some reviews on here. The staff were all very helpful and polite, nothing was too much for them. Only 2 things let the place down and that was the wait for the lifts, there was 3 in total but were so busy specially when going down for breakfast, my other half is a wheelchair user so we had no option but to use the lift, although sometimes I was able to squeeze her in with the chair and other guests and then I ran down to meet the lift at the bottom, going up in the lift was never really a problem. The bathroom was a let down, very small, tiny towels which wouldn't tie round my waist and had to share shower with loads of little flies, the water didn't drain fast enough so was always ankle deep in water. The bed was very comfortable and the air con worked a treat. Coffee pods were not great but the coffee served downstairs was nice. There was always bottles of water available free at the desk and some times iced tea. Although we were only 220 steps from Times Square we only ever heard the odd fire engine

Great hotel right in the heart of New York. All good except showers a bit small so if that doesn’t bother you it’s really good and the hotel is right near Time Square and plenty of choice for great food.

Me and my husband and our friend have just returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel which is a 5 minute walk from Time Square. As our friend was in a room on her own we asked if she could be in a room as near as possible to us. It was no trouble to them and they put her in the room 1224 and we were in 1222. All the staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. On arrival our safe was not working and I spoke to reception and they got straight onto maintenance and it was fixed within 10 minutes of reporting it. Yes the rooms are small but so are most of the hotels in this area but you are in NYC and the rooms are for sleeping in after a busy day. Room and bathroom were spotlessly clean and towels and bedding were changed every day. The bed and pillows were really comfortable. Shower was powerful and always hot. There is bottled water for the rooms always available at reception and you can ask for as many as you want. There is a handy plug socket lead on the desk which has a UK plug socket and USB charging points. The hotel and staff were fabulous and there is a great Irish bar right next door called Hurley’s. Our stay was great and all three of us would highly recommend this hotel.

Perfect location, though very noisy environment and really tiny rooms. Don't choose room attached to the elevator. Elevator makes a lot of noise. Iron doors are really noisy during open/close. Some night there were construction works outside and you could clearly hear all the machines working. Pretty annoying make it hard to sleep.

Hotel was supposed to be 3 star but more like 2 star, room was very small, bathroom you could hardly get into, door would not open fully as it went back against toilet, worst room i have ever stayed in USA.It was clean, but cold asked about heating and was told all heating in the hotel was turned off.

This property is in an amazing location, the rooms are small but a fantastic size for NYC (manage your expectations, space is at a premium here!) and the staff were lovely. I genuinely loved my stay here. The reasons for my slightly lower than 5 star review are likely things that can't really be helped but worth noting. There is no sound proofing whatsoever on the rooms. I'm used to hearing things in the corridors of hotels I stay in but usually don't hear the rooms on either side of me; not the case here! I could hear the gentleman on one side of me snoring as if he were in my room (I'm not exaggerating, it was that clear!) and the other side I could hear word for word their conversations, them going to the toilet etc. The other thing is that one of the elevators broke leaving only one and I waited 15 minutes to get downstairs with my luggage (no luggage I would have used the stairs and it would have been no issue).

A friend and I were in a small room with twin beds for 6 nights. It was clean, surprisingly quiet, and a great location for Broadway shows and subway stops. Glad it was on the 3rd floor as the small elevators were often full and sometimes one was broken,so took the stairs. Major drawback was the shower stall design of being half open so the floor flooded every time someone used it. We had to use half our towels in the floor. Housekeeping was unresponsive on requests for extras and inconsistent day to day. One day, no washclothes; next day no hand towels; next day no bath mat; next day no extra roll of toilet paper. Wifi went in and out. For the price, should have been better. Note: No frig or microwave.

Having read reviews, I wasn’t expecting much, hotel lobby was very nice, so I my view changed! Got into the room, the bed is not a double and springs broken but fine, shower not hot/bathroom flooded. Overall location was great for Times Square, and hotel was fine as you aren’t in the room much when in NYC!

If you are looking for a hotel right next to Times Square then this hotel is perfect as you are right in the middle of it all.. not far to all the big tourist attractions. Only gave a 3 as the rooms are nothing like the ones shown on booking.com. We booked a king suite which on the pics looked bright and airy - it was dark and dull with limited light. We asked to be moved but was told to come back the following morning. We decided it wasn't worth the hassle in the end. As a first time visitor I wouldn't stay in this area again as too busy, would look around Central Park area instead. Pleasant enough stay, rooms cleaned daily, coffee maker, fresh towels.Just don't be fooled by the pics - maybe room 1319 is one of the none so great king suites

There are so many hotels to choose from avoid this one.Reception staff were unwelcoming.Rooms are much smaller than deceived in the photosThere is no roof top terrace as the website indicated.Location is good, but so are other hotels.

Bellmen were absolutely great. Helped us so much and arranged for transport to airport. Rooms were clean and efficient. Excellent restaurant attached to hotel for Japenese and Vietnamese dishes. Beef teriayti was so very delicious.

The location of the hotel is excellent, but thats about the only strong positive point. IN New York, if you're only there for 3 or 4 days its OK as a base as you'll mostly be out all day seeing the sights. Staff member on reception wasn't very helpful, he didn't even tell us the wifi password. However, all other staff there we encountered in the hotel were friendly and more than happy to help. You probably won't get a great nights sleep in this hotel. The beds are fine, but the noise from outside is not drowned out at all by the windows. Must be single glazed. I don't think ours even closed properly, didn't seem to create a tight seal. Every time a siren from a poilce car went off we could hear it!The rooms are small, reasonably well decorated, but slightly tired in areas. The lights in both bedside tables did not work, but the lamps above did. Bathroom was very small but functional. Only coffee in room, no Tea. We brought our own tea bags but no way of making a cup in the room. No water in room either! You had to ask at reception every time for tiny little bottles. Expected more from this hotel. It was ok to stay in the once, but i wouldn't use it again.

Good rooms, but hotel was betere toe metro stops. We always need to walk for 10/15 minutes to get the metro. Kind workers and a Nice lobby. If you wanne store the suitcases, you need to pay 2 dollar, nor very kind.

Location was great, very convenient for Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. Reception on arrival was luke warm, not particularly friendly or professional. Our first night was uncomfortable, the room was a lot smaller than expected for a queen bed. The mattress was very poor - lumpy and seemed well past its sell by date, we both had back ache in the morning. One of the bedside lights was working but the fixture was broken and just resting on the wall attachment. The TV was not working and the room was generally tired and in need of decoration and updating. The bathroom was very small and would not have been suitable for those with mobility challenges or people who are large in stature. The windows were filthy and we could barely see out of them. It was incredibly noisy so the glazing was probably single. We asked to be moved due to the noise and matress and were told that all the mattresses were the same. We moved anyway and were given a larger and quieter room and the TV was working. However, the windows were still filthy and there was a step immediately inside the room leading to the bathroom that we tripped over numberous times as there was no marking to highight the step - floor covering was the same throughout. The last time I tripped I scraped my arm on the wall and really hurt my big toe. We highlighted this to the reception stating that this was potentially dangerous for elderly or infirm. There was coffee provided in the room but no tea so we had to buy own own tea bags. The extra charges of nearly $200 was a rip off as this was for extra amenities that we didnt get, apart from water that we had to ask for each time at reception - the tiniest bottles of water. On a positive note, the towels and bedding were changed each day, the shower was great (although it did flood the floor each time and had to be soaked up with towels - a bit dangerous), the iron and hairdryer were both working well. Having said this, I would expect this and so much more for a hotel that was not cheap. All very disappointing and we wouldn't stay here again.

The hotel is in a prime location and the staff were very helpful.The room... Was suitable for our trip. We only needed somewhere to put our head. The shower overflowed and it took 10 minutes to get hot water (by that time it was like you were having a bath)The room was small but had a coffee machine, TV and a comfortable bed. It was nothing fancy and was certainly not the cleanest hotel I've stayed in.It was my first time in New York and I was slightly disappointed in the state of the room.I'm led to believe most hotels in the area are lacking in room size but this room could have been presented at a higher standard.Amazing location though, just around the corner from Broadway.

Where to start... We had 9 nights booked at Gallivant and had been travelling for 14hours when we arrived to the hotel (exhausted, as you can imagine). Firstly, there is no heating in the building, including hot water. When I called the front desk about my cold shower and inability to warm up the room on a 11degree day, they said the building was over 100 years old and they didn’t have heating. Only old boilers which they don’t turn on? Furthermore; the bedding is inadequate as there is only light sheets provided. We shivered throughout the whole night and the bed/mattress itself was so uncomfortable I couldn’t even get in a position where a spring wasn’t hitting digging into my side. It should also be noted that the walls are PAPER THIN! You can hear every single conversation happening in the rooms around you, even the relatively quiet ones... But the worst part - the sirens, the garbage trucks and traffic noise coming from outside throughout the night! The hotel is old and outdated. The “air conditioning” in the room is a dodgy unit attached to the wall under an unsealed window. The floors are uneven and I actually tripped getting out of the lift due to this. The rooms are tiny (standard for NYC, but don’t expect a place to leave your suitcase! Everything about this hotel is tragic and outdated. We moved rooms once because of our neighbours drunkenly partying and yahoo-ing next door (which is insanely painful when the walls are SO thin already) so I can confirm this wasn’t an isolated incident and only applied to one room or floor. When I called the front desk in the morning (almost in tears after the worst night), I was told that they’d “allow” me to leave and they would refund me the unused portion. Whilst grateful that I was getting my money back (god forbid they withheld it!), I asked whether I could also be refunded for our first night given all the issues... The manager flat out refused and said he was doing ME a favour by letting me leave with a partial refund! I understand that we did occupy the hotel that night, however the issues were brought to the staff’s attention during our first room move and we had no choice but to stay by the time we checked in etc. I told the Manager that I’d be taking this further as we now had to book a new hotel (Crowne Plaza across the road which is AMAZING) and needed as much money as possible to cover that stay due to high cost - which he responded to in an arrogant manner “that’s fine” and hung up on me! We are still waiting for our “incidental fee” to be dropped/refunded also. The worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at. I will forever have a bitter taste in my mouth due to the stay, but more the management. Don’t stay here... Simply, just don’t put yourself through it! It’s not worth it!

The location was great, the room itself looks modern but it’s very average and not that clean , lots of wall marks, bathroom shower area needs a good scrub and the toilet lid was broken. No cutlery so you can’t eat in your room. Beds were super comfy but duvets were in flat sheets so it meant you could touch the duvet ( I think is unhygienic unless they wash them after every stay )

We booked this hotel through booking.com for our first trip to New York. We were lead to believe our room would be really modern. Not only was it not modern but it was really run down. On one of the walls there was a big patch that had been plastered over and not painted and a smaller one in the bathroom. The back of bathroom door was splattered with lots of marks and there was a half empty bottle of wine left in the cupboard and old used make up brushes lying under the bathroom sink. Our first night we had to phone reception as the shower sounded like it was going to take off from the wall. Someone came up immediately and fixed this. We can’t fault the cleaning staff who cleaned our room to a high standard every day and provided fresh towels. The bed was comfy and there was air-con. As we were on the 13th floor we found it quite frustrating that there were usually only two lifts available and we had to often wait a long time before we could get in them. The location of this hotel was probably the most attractive thing. It was close to Times Square, Broadway, subway stations, endless supply of restaurants etc. We loved our first time to New York but we were sad the hotel did not meet our expectations.

I have been returning to this excellent hotel, both price wise and convenience for many yearsIt has small rooms but well appointed and newly refurbished. The location is in the centre ofmidtown Manhattan. The only complaint is the elevators.....small and slow as they only hold 7 people which means a long wait during peak hours
user_name:
Departure48247068189
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel was so dirty, encountered so many health hazards. Front desk was completely rude when asked for a new room. There were bugs coming from the shower, water was running completely white! Not clear, but white!

We stayed at the Gallivant for three nights on our way to Mexico. The hotel is in a great location, central for Broadway & Times Square.Our room was basic but comfortable enough for a short stay. The bathroom was tiny but functional. We had a room facing onto 48th Street and it was quite noisy during the night and we could hear trash pickup and delivery trucks throughout the night.There are loads of bars and restaurants nearby.The staff were very friendly and helpful so no complaints there.

All are ok in This hotel but bed is worst, broker bed...a pit.Hotel is near a time Square and Metro station (blu, red, yellow),the staff is polite and the rooms clean, the first night as well as the room with the uncomfortable bed was also noisy (211) the second at least had only the nightmare bed (908)

Great location just off Times Square, we couldn’t of asked for better really for my first visit to NYC.The room itself was ok, just a few issues with cleanliness (a lot of dust) and the bathroom was ridiculously small. Be prepared there is no full door or curtain on the shower so the floor gets absolutely drenched.The wait for the lifts is also a pain if you are impatient and don’t want to take the stairs - depends what floor you are on!If you don’t sleep well I wouldn’t stay here as the noise in the corridors is annoying morning and

The hotel is nicely located but the rooms are quite noisy. It is in the city centre but the windows should be better isolated. There was some food waste and bottles, garbage 1m under our window this I would consider as the biggest problem. A lady at the reception was informed accordingly, however, the litter was still there when we were departing.

very Location to Times square is the big plus. The very small room was clean and contained good size bed and tv. However, there was not even a polystyrene cup or glass to drink from i the room. I have never encountered that before. Given the size of the rooms you are better off being outside to avoid going 'stir crazy'. Also, a lot of noisy door slamming to contend with!

Hotels this poor in quality should have honest reviews and should have to make upgrades and repairs or drop their rates. The only attribute is its location in Times Square. Otherwise, do not stay here until management makes changes. I’m going to just jump in here—bugs and flies coming up through the drain in the shower. No shower door left the bathroom floor soaked. Our room and bathroom were unbelievably small with the bathroom literally being 3 feet by 6 feet. There was barely room on the sink to put a curling iron. Mold in the shower. The only way we could get water to run in the shower was by turning on the water at the sink. The air conditioner worked well, but the unit was moldy and pulled away from the wall. The full “American breakfast” was nearly inedible. The closet was 2 feet by 3 feet in space. The nightstands were scraped and banged up. We were here with a group and our fellow travelers reported much of the same in their rooms. Gallavant—this is the worst hotel experience we’ve had in years. We will NOT be back.

Where do I start. When checking in there was no one at reception, the lady was at the bell boys desk having a chat. It took for me to walk over to her for her to realise I was checking in. The room we had was tiny! Like a shoe box, I couldn't believe the rate they were charging for that size of room. A couple days later, the water wasn't running in my shower so I went down stairs to let them know, the lady behind the desk looked at me as if i was stupid, they knew it was going to be turned off due to maintenance work. Apparently there was a letter given out to advise the guests but I was never informed nor did I receive the letter. the lady didn't event apologise when i informed her I didn't receive the letter and there was no compensation offered for the inconvenience. So I was without a shower and toilet for a whole day. Then I was stuck going down in the budget lifts as it wouldn't go down to the ground floor. It kept stopping at level 2 and then go all the way back to level 15 where there was no one waiting. eventually it stopped at level 3 and I got out and took the fire escape stairs down to the ground floor. When I went to the front desk to advise of the issue, the lady barely raised her head to make eye contact, she muttered 'Ill get someone to look into it". She did not care what so ever. Our room was right next to the service elevator and fire escape so whenever housekeeping were coming up to our floor we could hear everything. Because the lifts were so dodgy the guests were using the fire escape which we could also hear every 5 min as the door would slam so hard the walls would shake. I have stayed in better hostels! Never staying here again and will only advise against staying here to family and friends.

I love staying at the Gallivant when I visit NYC! It's perfectly located for anyone coming in town theatre as I do. Everything's in walking distance. And my favorite show - The Prom - is playing right next door! And the staff here couldn't be more helpful and accommodating!

This hotel is listed as a four stars hotel in booking.com. This is not true.The room was not clean. The sleeping is terrible due to noise in the corridor day and night. Elevators and machine rooms on every floor... so noisy !

A very good hotel in a great location. Perfect cleaning, everyday. Towels changed every day. Nice big tv. Coffee maker with coffee supplements every day. Unfortunately, the lifts do not keep up, no fridge and shelves for clothes in the wardrobe.

My stay at the Gallivant was very pleasant, the bed was comfortable and the room clean. Check in and check out were easy The location is fantastic at the heart of Times Square but as with all hotels there, bring some earplugs as the noise from the street can be quite loud.

Average hotel in great location. Our rooms were very small but they were clean, quiet and comfortable. Iron and hairdryer are provided. The towels and sheets were changed daily and shower good but there was no thought to storage, shelving or mirrors in the room. Could not get to open cupboard without moving bed slightly. Wifi was intermittent and sometimes frustrating. Staff mostly friendly and helpful apart from one man who was rather blunt and sometimes rude. You can leave your luggage for $2 per piece if you have a late checkout. Great pub Hurleys next door, restaurants and theatres on the doorstep so great location.

We have just returned from a 4 night stay. We were so disappointed with our room as when we initially entered the hotel we thought the lobby looked amazing and we were quite excited to see our room. Unfortunately our room was tiny. Barely any room to store our cases or move about the room for that matter. Room was grubby and our view was facing right into someone else's room (with what we thought was a privacy blind - don't be fooled like we were these are see through!).The ice machine in corridor was directly across from our room and the constant noise from it was unbearable along with our room shaking when someone else closed their hotel room door in our corridor.The bed was smaller than a double but it was comfy and sheets were clean.The windows were very drafty and we were unable to turn the heating on, only cold air.The bathroom again was tiny. Shower was good but water sprayed everywhere. Shower didn't drain properly.Wifi was average. Very slow at times, at others it was fine.We felt the basic cleaning in room wasn't good enough. Long black hairs everywhere (neither of us have black hair), feet were dirty after walking about floor, walls covered in dirty marks and the ice bucket was disgusting!Location was ideal for Times Square. Obviously it was noisy but you're in the centre of NY what else is to be expected :). Take an eye mask and ear plugs.I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you were able to get an extremely cheap room and didn't mind all of the things mentioned above. We weren't in our room much apart from sleeping so it didn't ruin our stay but I definitely wouldn't return to this hotel.The POSITIVES were: comfy (small) double bed, good shower, excellent location for Times Square, very pleasant staff (reception and porter) and the Chinese restaurant attached to hotel was great! These are reasons why we gave any stars on this rating.

The Hotel position is wonderful , so we can live in the heart of the town , near many theaters and many special places . Many restaurant ethnic are around the Hotel. In a little walk we can arrive at the light and the music of Time Square. I love NY

This hotel is extremely overpriced and the pictures online look nothing like the rather 'dumpy' rooms. I did not have a good experience here, from my room not being ready til well after the 3:00 check-in to finally checking-in and finding a giant cockroach. No amenities either, an actual glass is hard to find, however the hotel staff did come thru, no refrigerator in room. Nothing good to report.

Location was great, nearby Times Square and Broadway. Everyday cleaning service, WiFi was working day and night. The possibility of making coffee in the room, even a locker, tv with big screen. Toilet and shower were clean. Staff was helpful and friendly.You must be aware that the hotel is in the middle of NY, so you you hear the citynoise constantly. Price/quality was reasonable.

Amazing location, fast check-in and check out with friendly welcoming staff. Coffee machine in the room. Great shower. Clean and comfortable bed and room. The lifts can take a while to arrive, and the water bottles from reception could be bigger (though they are included in a charge, you don't pay more), I'd tend to drink more than that through the night. But 2 very small moans over 4 great days.

The hotel was great, its location, its service, the rooms, the cleaning, and the value for the money if you consider that it is placed in Times Square. The only thing that I didn't agree is that even if I had paid the hotel before my arrival in New York, I was charged extra for losing my plane and arrived one day later at the hotel. I believe that this was not necessary since I had already paid in advance the whole amount and there was no way that the hotel will lose any money. Apart from that, everything was great and we extended our stay even 2 days more in NY at the same hotel.

Nothing bad to report. Room was clean and cleaned everyday of stay. Shower was good, Location was brilliant and would definitly stay here again. Wi-Fi worked perfectly for whole trip as well. Staff were very friendly.

Location is great but don't count on a good night's sleep as the noise travels through the dirty windows and we were on the 10th floor. Staff didn't seem interested in helping. Asked front of house staff twice for extra towels on the first night and didn't get them until the next day when housekeeping came round. Bath mat was only provided once out of the 7nights we stayed so we had to use the small hand towels for the floor.furniture was dusty and a bit tatty. A.c unit was very loud. We had a note from the hotel on Sunday that the water would be off from 8 to 5.30 the next day and that water would be delivered to the room that night, we called the front desk for the water as we had still not received it by 11pm only to be told that we would receive it the next morning. We didn't receive the water to our room as promised only to find that bottles had been left out by the elevators. Pretty unacceptable service and no compensation offered for the inconvenience.

Fantastic hotel, situated right on Broadway. Friendly staff who are happy to help with any problems that you may have during your stay. Rooms were cleaned every day with fresh towels daily. Really rate this hotel will definitely stay there again.
user_name:
Wanderer40924616341
New York City, New York

review_body: The rooms are tiny, dirty, and ac doesn't work properly. The tiny bathroom had no shower curtain, so water got everywhere. We were notified that the water would be off, so asked for water for our room and the night front desk man didn't seemed like he could be bothered helping us, and we never got the water he promised. Poor customer service! I don't recommend that anyone stay here for the price they charge. This should be $100 or less a night, so you don't feel ripped off by the terrible service and crappy rooms

Great location and really friendly, helpful reception and concierge staff. Room was not quite as viewed in the photos - it was 'tired' looking and cheaply furnished. Certainly not 4* as advertised. We were charged an extra $30 a night for a twin room which they considered an 'upgrade'. Have never experienced that in any other hotel world wide! we also asked several times for some shower gel as there was none in the room - still waiting. We did get plenty of towels though. Apart from the location and staff this was a disappointment.

I dont know what people are complaining about to be honest. My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights in April. The room was clean, tidy, has a bed, dresser, safe, iron+board, hairdryer, fresh towels.First, Location is great! Right off Times Square so your dead central. Brilliant for a first time holiday in the city as its very easy to find your way home and youre close to all the tourist stuff. The bed is comfy if a little small. I'm about 5'10 but anyone taller than me would be having chilly feet. The room is cosy. It fits everything but theres not a lot of free floor space so you'd notice an open suitcase. But you're out in the city all day so you dont notice the small room. The bathroom is gorgeous. We had no issue with hot water and the water pressure was sexy, I had a shower every morning!I dont know where people are coming from when they say the room was cold!! Ours was too warm of an evening so we stuck on the aircon for 20 minutes before we went to bed and that cooled it right down.The staff were friendly and helpful and we had very little to do with them. We left our bags with the concierge before check in for free and paid the 2$ per bag to mind them after checkout. Theres also a free to use weighing scales you can use if you're flying.There are two small elevators that only fit 7 people at a time. Now we only had to wait for a lift twice during our entire stay and tbh we could have just used the stairs only we were lazy so it wasnt an issue for us. But I did notice people with suitcases getting quite fustrated.Overall we had a great stay! Its a nice, easy hotels for couples or first time holidayers. Thanks for the trip!

A great location, friendly staff . The rooms are clean. The breakfast service is entrusted to third parties. Unfortunately the rooms are very noisy. The elevator service is poor you have to wait a long time for the many people that the hotel hosts.

In center ouf the city and very clean, near the principals attractions, rockfeller center, Times Square, Central Park, m&m’s World and madison square garden. I recommand this hôtel if you come to visit ans discover the city

The Gallivant is in an ideal location for a short stay in New York. You step out of the door turn right & within a few yards you are in Times Square. The rooms are small but clean & have everything you can need. It is next to Broadway & plenty of places to eat & drink. Would definitely stay again.

Hotel location is really great, next to time square. The rooms are clean but the door closing is so noisy!We get a water problem during our stay, that could happen but no water given in the rooms the night before! So the all guest have to ask for water on the morning and delay for delivering ...

Usually I’d include photos with my review however there really wasn’t anything worth capturing. I’ve provided a 2 star rating because the location is great. Unfortunately that’s the only compliment I can provide. Issues observed:1. One of the two lifts did not work (making it particularly crowded and slow to move between floors)2. Room cleanliness was below an acceptable standard 3. NO WATER in the hotel for a full day from 8am to 5:30pm (meaning no showers or flushing toilets) - completely unacceptable is a first world country. Who is their right mind would pay for a hotel which doesn’t have running water. Note, we were provided $28 as compensation for not having running water however this was after 3 heated conversations with front desk. 4. Front desk customer service was stand off’ish and smug. This was observed in both day staff and night staff. I’ve tried to be fair with the 2 star rating but this hotel was so disappointing. I do not recommend staying here. There are plenty of other options in the area.

We were pleasantly surprised to find our hotel was well located in relation to Central Park and Times Square, however the excess $35US a day for ‘services’ was ridiculous due to the wifi barely working and the free water being tiny and not provided in the rooms, nor replenished. The fact that it was only announced in an email the day prior to checking in was also frustrating. Staff seemed disinterested and were short with us. Overall the hotel was nice and the location great. Just a pity about the staff and their service.

the location is perfect but it's not everythingroom and bathroom especially are very small, we found socks under the radiator .... continental breakfast disappointing, not at all up!It is better to be a little further but well served

We stayed at The Gallivant for 5 nights whilst we were celebrating my 30th birthday at New York. Hotel location was great. Only about 30 seconds from the crazy times square. Our room was at the back of the hotel so the traffic noise was not a problem at all. Our room was spotless when we arrived and was cleaned every day. The room wasn’t very big but good enough since we weren’t there all day. Bathroom was extremely small which is the only negative point. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again if we ever came back to New York

My husband and i spent 4 days and nights at this hotel at the beginning of April. It was our first trip to New York and it was great. The Gallivant is in a brilliant location on 48th st on 8th ave. It is within walking distance of lots of sights and activities eg. Rockafella centre, Empire State, Maddison Sq. Garden etc. It is also very convienient for Theatres , restaurant and shopping.We walked everywhere. We only got the subway when we went downtown to visit the Statue of Liberty , Ellis Island and 9/11. There is a subway station on 50th street so pretty close.The hotel itself offers everything you need for a short stay. The rooms are not very big but big enough. They have all the facilities, coffee maker, wifi, TV, hairdryer safe, etc I did find the bathroom a little bit small but adequate. Room was clean and towels changed daily. Realistically you are in New York City you should not be spending much time in your hotel room anyway.There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are plenty of places around the corner that offer a good variety of dishes. The front desk staff were helpful when i asked for advice on subways and directions, he even printed out the directions for me. FYI even though our accomodation was all paid for previously there is a tourist tax that has to be paid to the hotel, for 4 nights x 2 adults it cost $128 .I would stay here again if and when i return to NYC.

The hotel was comfortable and super location, but reception and check in was chaotic and impersonal, our room was not ready until 5pm and reception staff did not apologise or offer reason but said that premium take longer to clean, the room is small but to be expected in New York, there is no fridge in the room also. Overall I would not stay again and thought it very average

Great location but frustrated by the room issues and the slow lifts.The reception staff were nice and helpful and tried to overcome the problems but the room booking system needs fixing.Classed as 4 star and 4 star prices but felt more 3 star.

Stayed here for 4 nights in April. The hotel was a really good base for exploring New York City. We were literally a couple of minutes around the corner from Times Square, opposite lots of theatres. Our room was clean and tidy (bathroom was a squeeze). LikeD the New York themed decor. There was a hairdryer and a safe in the room which was handy. We forgot our adapters to charge our phones, but it was okay because they had this really useful electrical point on the bedside table with USB ports and a UK plug socket! My only gripe was that our air conditioning/heating was broken and the room was sweltering because we couldn't turn it off. They did fix it for us on the second night though. Also, the windows were extremely dirty they really needed to be washed on the outside!The reception area was modern and welcoming, with seating and an area where you could use the computer. The staff were really helpful in assisting us with some trouble we had with transfers leaving the hotel.We didn't have breakfast here - you must try Times Square Diner & Grill around the corner for the best breakfasts.All in all, a great stay and great location!

This Hotel was well situated in the heart of Times Square, and within easy access for all things New York had to offer. Facilities were good and room was clean and tidy, Would recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting New York

We were okay to stay so close to Times Square for this price for a family of five. No frills.Clean enough. New beds. Bunk beds! The location made this a great choice. Be aware of very slow elevators at check out in the morning, and luckily we walked down the floors even with luggage which is not an option for all. Nice front desk staff. A favorite with foreign tourists.

Good location hotel, however price paid for amenities not good enough: old furniture, old Tv, poor wifi connection. elevators are slow and rusty (one wasn't working when we arrived). Receptionists are ok, although they could be nicer. ( They act defensive all the tine)

Didn't get off to a great start at this hotel as as soon as we arrived we noticed they require a 'security deposit' of $50 per night (this is on top of the city tax they charge you at the end of the stay). The deposit is then refunded after check out, however please note we checked out over 7 days ago and the deposit still has not been refunded - a very long wait for a large amount of money to be returned. Now onto the room - when we arrived the room looked very dingy and the windows were so dirty you could not see out of them. Luckily enough we had a balcony so were able to see the view from there. We had to call housekeeping up to our room the first night as our bed was full of clumps of hair, the towels had very questionable stains on them, and someone had left various empty bottles of alcohol on our balcony, together with a cup filled with wine and a cigarette stub floating in it. The housekeeping lady who came up to clean seemed angry at us that she had to clean the room, however it was defiantly a fault of the hotel and not us that the room was so disgustingly filthy. The air conditioning unit clicked all night, but the room was so hot and stuffy that we had to keep it on, plus although we were on the 10th floor, the windows were so thin that we could hear everything on the street below. The bed was very lumpy and uncomfortable and we didn't get a good night sleep for any of the 3 nights. The bathroom was falling apart, the toilet roll holder was hanging off the wall so we could not use it and the door handle was about to break. Overall, not happy with our stay and wouldn't stay again as there are many other hotels in the area. The only good part of this hotel is the location.

The staff was very friendly, but the rooms were worn out with need of a make over. We also had some problems getting in touch with housekeeping one night when we needed toiletpapper. Had to go bye some ourselves, because they did not leave any when cleaning our room.

Please avoid at all costs unless you like sleeping in a dirty stained bed full of hair and picked off nail varnish! The bathroom door was hanging off its hinges. The lift is horrendous! We were on the 7th floor and when you pressed level 1 (to get out) it went up to the top floor! Suffering with plantar fasciitis the stairs was not an option, we must of been in the lift with 5 other people and the heat was not a good mix. When we checked in the lady on the desk just asked for a card, but didn't tell us what it was for until we asked, which i think is quite rude. There was long black hairs in the quilt and pillow before we even got into bed. Me and my mum are both blonde so we knew it definitely wasn't us. There is no point in asking to be moved because you just get told it will cost extra or the hotel was full, which fair enough if its full but at least make sure the rooms were clean.After reading mixed reviews about the hotel i thought I'd see it for myself as everyone is different, i wouldn't recommend this hotel nor would i stay here again. Before we left we thought we would strip the bed ready for housekeeping, to find a yellow stain in the middle of the sheet! We couldn't believe what we had slept in for 4 nights.Kelly who works as a housekeeper on 7th floor is a lovely lady, the nicest out of all the staff! The only good thing about this hotel is the location as its just around the corner from times square.

We arrived at our Hotel tired and checked in at reception. We were given our room key on the 10th floor. Room 1002. However, as soon as we opened the door it was obvious a mistake had happened. It was the size of a single room with a small cupboard as the en-suite. We also found dirty clothing in the wardrobe. PLEASE NOTE WE HAD PAID FOR A QUEEN SIZE BED.The only member of staff was the night porter who had no intention on sorting anything out. He was rude and didn’t take time to hear my complaint. He kept repeating the hotel was full and we needed to speak to management in the morning. Upset as I had booked this for my partners 50th birthday we went back to our single sized room as we had no other option. The next day we were moved but not straight away.
