Our luggage sat in the foyer for 8 hours!!The room we finished up with was queen sized but was adj to a roof top air con unit and power plant that made the noise of an aeroplane engine all night long.Please note the damage on the door in the picture we didn’t feel safe! Everything looked damaged or dirty Looking around you can do much better for the same money.

Hotel was clean and comfortable rooms were clean and towels changed every day , location was perfect only a few min walk to Times Square and also to subway , Would recommend to a friend , would defo stay again .

I stayed at The Gallivant for 1 night with my husband and 2 children. The staff was very helpfull en friendly! The hotel is next to Times Square, excellent location if you want to explore New York. I would certainly come back to this hotel if I ever visit NY again.

I can honestly say out of all the hotels I’ve ever stayed in this has got to be the worst. And I use the term ‘stayed in’ loosely as we checked in, went to our room and then left after 20 minutes. I could not have stayed in that room if someone had paid me. Firstly it was very dirty - the window, the bathroom, the bed even had stains on the headboard. There was no character and it had much more of a hostel feel to it. The rooms look absolutely nothing like they do on the website!They even charged me an extra £75 which was an ‘urban fee’. I emailed over 4 times to be told that this would not be refunded. Please save your money and stay elsewhere, this was an awful start to our holiday.

Upon arrival to the hotel at 5.30 on Good Friday we were informed that our room had been given away. We had been travelling all day with 4 children, 6 of us in all. Manager informed us card had been declined however the money had been already taken from my account . Manager advised that Booking.com had cancelled the room however when I spoke to a different member of staff at a later stage they said that it was the hotel had cancelled the room. My biggest issue was the treatment we received we had no room, despite it was paid for and there was no apology. The manager was quite abrupt and did not even look up when speaking to us. I have to say the room was lovely and it was clean and we slept well but the arrival to the hotel was shocking. My daughter was crying as she was so tired and thought we would have to go looking for another hotel. Why would a hotel give away a room that has been booked well in advance and paid for. My only guess is that the hotel was trying to make money twice on the room which is so dishonest. I would not recommend this hotel and I will be posting my update on TripAdvisor to day. Despite the manager saying there was no rooms left she did find us a room eventually and then we were informed we should be thankful that we got one when we complained. The greeting you receive when you arrive at a hotel is the most important aspect of a stay and it is the one that stays in your memory.

We had paid our reservation (5 days) and the first night when we arrived the receptionist says: There are no fee rooms. The only solution was to move a low category hotel in New Jersey (40 minutes by taxi from Times Square)

We stayed here beginning of February, the rooms are very basic the toilet was so small your knees nearly touched the wall when using the toilet. We requested a 2 bedroom and when we arrived we were put in a double room so we had to share a bed, WiFi and bottles of water! What a joke that is they ran out of bottled water twice when they did have water It was in very small bottles that were warm and the WiFi was non existent, it just kept logging you out. Heating was horrendous it was -8 outside yet the air con did nothing and couldn’t get warm. On checkout we handed in our key cards and asked twice if we were all paid up and we were told we owed nothing however over 2 months later they took out £132 out of my account, when I sent them an email with regards to this I was told it was an urban fee which covered the water and internet. What a total rip off!! Would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy!

We stayed 3 nights at the Gallivant. First to note is the inefficiency of the lifts. Only two and very small serving many floors. The room was small and the shower facilities inadequate. However the bed was clean, well made and comfortable. The air conditioning was good but noisy. The staff however are very helpful and friendly. So the hotel was not all it could be but serves its purpose. BUT the redeeming feature is the location which is superb. Broadway, Time Square and 5th Avenue on the doorstep. Plenty of good places to eat close by and access to the subway nearby as well thus good access to ALL the city’s attractions. I would recommend the hotel thus for the location alone.

Bad hotêl, room "premium" tily with bathroom very very tiny for 4 people. Bunk beds impossible to use because the top bed was to wobbly for a child to sleep. There were cockroaches in my bathroom (tiny), the dresser drawer did not close and the queen bed was not a king size at all !!!It's a shame !!

Air conditioner can only freeze. cannot set a normal tempareture.Bed is just awful.I changed room after the first night because safe and the air conditioner didnt work at all.It was noisy - first floor, street front...In the second room there was noise because of two huge gas boilers outside the buliding right net to the room.Beds were all pathetic in both rooms.

The location is ideal, just steps away from Times Square. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. The only drawback was the full-size bed. I don't recall full-size beds being so short in length but our ankles were hanging off the bed, and I'm only 5'9. Otherwise, I am completely satisfied with this hotel.

Great location, rooms are a bit small but are neat and tidy and cleaned regulary, would come back again no problem, hotel is situated literally 1 minute from times square and about 5 minutes from the bus routes, perfect!

Hotel just off Time Square so location is good but if you were willing to walk for 5 minutes you can significantly reduce the cost of your trip. There are hidden taxes so be prepared. This hotel has limited elevators so it can take ages to get anywhere. Staff especially the domestic staff are rude and rush you out of your rooms if you want new towels and your bed made!

Metro and Time Square in walking distance; helpful and friendly staff; premium room was very sufficient for 4 person; recommended for families; air condition was running smoothly, huge bathroom, but noisy shower

I didn’t like that someone messed up with the room I booked online and paid for. At almost 12 am me and my wife checked in and were told that they had rooms only for one person and I paid for two. I even could not believe in what the receptionist was saying. Imagine you are coming late and have get up at 5:30 am. The only thing you want to do is to get sleep asap. But no, The Gallivant Times Square didn’t think like that - awesome! Of course, the managers of this hotel didn’t have such problems, in their beds. The receptionist, Antonio, by the way a good man, was really helpful and tried to resolve this issue. He spoke to another hotel, explained them the problem, assured them that The Gallivant would pay and called a taxi for us. So, we checked in at the new hotel and after formalities we got in the room. Time was 01 am. Next day I discovered that I was charged twice by The Gallivant and the other hotel. All we wanted was to have a rest, instead we had frustration, disappointment and problems with the Gallivant Times Square. Thank you very much! I will never forget you!

Gallivant is a lousy hotel. The heating did not work. The noise from the street is very loud. the windows are so dirty that you could not see through them. The rooms are tiny and with furniture already spoiled. In the end, they charge you an urban free rate that they had not notified in advance. Pretty dirty It has no restaurant or cafeteria service. I will never repeat.

God help you if you are on a higher floor as it takes forever getting anywhere givin the number and size of the lifts. Overall we had a pleasant stay. Family room for 5. Room was a good size however the paint work was a little tatty in places. Wouldn’t have taken much to remedy this.The showers? Cold. I don’t think I got adequate heat once during my 5 days stay. Did think about complaining but having waited so long for a lift to reception, I just wanted to get out and about. Free bottled water advertised for your resort fee however twice they had none at reception. Bunk beds? Top one I did not believe was safe the sleep in as the guard was less than adequate. I wouldn’t let me 16 year old in it so certainly not a smaller child.Please do something about the windows, the noise from outside is as if the glass has been removed. This desperately needs looking at for a decent nights sleep. Our room overlooked 8th Avenue and the noise was constant.Pluses? Coffee machine cups and pods fresh each day which was brilliant. WIFi? Sketchy a lot of the time but could get onto it most days.Location is really the main attraction of this hotel, I would probably recommend it to families as the family accommodation is a good size. As a couple we’ve stayed in better hotels in NYC for a similiar price, hence the 3 star rating.Some small tweaks would really improve the quality of this hotel.

Rob Napalitano and his staff made our stay wonderful. Rob was very helpful in guiding us and suggesting places for us to visit. I would come back and stay in a heartbeat as long as Rob is at the hotel. THANK YOU ROB

Even though the location of the hotel is great, several issues regarding their facilities and its personal could really spoil your stay.Our room had no space to leave our belongings, the windows were completely unsealed, letting lot of noise coming into your room, mattress totally expired, making your rest very hard, and the A/C failed the very first day, which was reported but not fixed during the five days of our stay.Personal was definitely not enough for the size or level of occupancy but, even more, they had little or no consideration for making our stay as pleasant as possible. Since very early in the morning we heard continuous screams and slamming from the house keeping staff, with no single consideration of the guests’ rest.

Okay So I did read the reviews before leaving and I was slightly concerned and after arriving & getting to our 1st room I had every reason to be!Firstly after we checked into reception we were told about the extra service charge that was needed to be paid on our card!So we did all that and then was given a room key which we worked out to be on the 11th floor (no one told us) so went into the room which had the air conditioner on full bearing in mind it was February and New York had snow on the ground! We looked around but there was no way of turning it off? No buttons on the unit either! We called down to reception where we were told that there’s a switch on the side to turn it off (I had looked there was no switch) So I explained there was no switch and eventually they said that someone would come up to have a look! so while we was waiting my daughter said she would have a shower only to find the shower only come out with cold water I then rang down again and they said please let it run for 10 minutes so after 15 minutes it was still cold so we left it and after 30 minutes it was still cold so I rang reception again and said this is unacceptable we have freezing cold water from the shower no hot water & the air-conditioning is on full and freezing cold so please can someone come up and sort this out! After an hour and twenty minutes later someone came up and accepted that there was no way of turning the air con off so he had to take the unit case off to disconnect a switch which was inside the unit!Then the shower was still cold so he said we would need to go to reception to ask to change room?We went down and was explaining everything to a gentleman on the desk when a lady came over who was listening & said very rudely “Oh Just give them another room it’s too much aggravation!” I just looked and said seriously she needs some lessons in manners! The new room was fine and the beds were really lovely that was a huge bonus! We had tv and WiFi & a coffee machine the shower was hot apart from 3 days when it ran cold due to issues that the hotel had but they then deducted the service charge for those days off our bill! To be fair the Hotel was in a fabulous location literally by turning right outside the hotel it brings you to Times Square So if you can put up with the downsides the plus side is you are in the middle of New York so you can get to everything so easy Having a comfortable bed really helped me get over the hiccups and as you only really need a clean room and a decent bed I was able to enjoy my holiday with my daughter for her 21st

We asked to be put in rooms near each other as travelling as a family was put on different floors,when we got into our room no safe plugs to use see pic below absolutely disgusting especially if a child went near it.We went to reception to complain they did change us even that room had a plug with a crack in it. Shower took over 5 mins to warm up .Wifi very hit and miss more miss saw loads of people complaining about this at reception. Lifts so slow waiting over 20 mins each day for them. Dust under beds so thick and top it off got home to find $ 300 charge on credit card which apparently is resort fees amenities fees didn’t use the gym etc as didn’t stay in the hotel each day for that long would I recommend this hotel NO ,one plus great location

We have just returned from 5 nights staying here at the Gallivant Hotel in Times Square.We had a family room which had 2 double beds and bunk beds, the room was really spacious the bathroom too, plenty of space for the 5 of us.Excellent location in Times Square, friendly staff and generally a really nice hotel

While I have never stayed anywhere else in the city I highly recommend staying at the Gallivant hotel it is close to everything you will need and want and the staff are super friendly! We loved it!!!!

Our experience was not successful in this hotel. The hotel has a good central placement however, the value of money is very low, mainly due to the low level of the cleanliness of the room and hotel (dark dust in floor, room, windows etc), room and bed is too small for 2, window is broken in the room with awful street noise day/night, hotel has 2 old small lifts so we waited up to 15 min in the day of departure to get down from 15 floor. Lights were broken in one side of the bed, and despite 4 calls and reminders, the hotel fixed one light only after 3 days.

We have just got home from the trip of a lifetime, the trip made all the more perfect with this family friendly hotel. Brilliant and accommodating staff. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Also, if you get chance visit the Japanese restaurant attached to the hotel...our meal was out of this world!

Not worth the price! Spend your hard earned money somewhere else. Really bad mattress, water was to hot, stained towels, and rooms are hot. I didn’t enjoy my trip. The hotel needs to stop cutting costs.

This hotel is so confortable for visiting NY because of its location, so close to Times Square. Our bedroom was fine, clean and confortable. Having in mind the prizes of NY hotels that was a good quality-to-price one.

Great hotel to stay in which is really close to Times Square and also a short walk to places like the Rockefeller centre etc. Also close to numerous places to eat and subway stations to make travelling around New York easy. Hotel staff were accommodating, and fixed our AC straight away when we arrived to find it not working. Small, but clean room and bathroom with everything you would require and more (including hair dryer, iron and ironing board, and also a plug extension with USB ports and a UK plug). Great place to stay - would stay here again!

4 friends for 8 nights in a queen suite (1 double bed & bunk beds).Reception staff very helpful on arrival. No extra payments taken (taxes prepaid through booking.com) they just took a credit card for damages deposit. Room was big enough for the 4 of us, beds were comfy, even the bunk beds! The shower was great. Rooms cleaned daily, fresh towels and beds made up. WiFi occasionally a little slow but this wasn't a problem for us. Check out was at 12pm, flight back to the UK wasn't until 10pm so we left our bags in the lobby with the door staff. $10 for 8 bags and they lock them up safely. The reception staff also booked us a taxi to the airport which was very helpful.Overall a very pleasant stay and an incredible week in new york!

AC not working, internet speed was terrible, only two elevators working and you wait forever to get to your floor. Some od staff not friendly and not helpful. They do not replace towels and cosmetics until you tell them to.

Here for a few days.It is what it is... a mid priced hotel in Midtown.It’s clean.The lady on the reception (Cassandra) was most helpful and friendly at check in (thank you)The shower is great! (Believe me, that’s important to me )Everything we have come to NYC is on the doorstep so, Central for us.Honestly, I cannot fault it for value.

The hotel is in a really good location and only a few minutes from Broadway and Times Square. There's plenty of shops, restaurants and diners nearby. The room was quite small but it didn't bother us because we were hardly in it. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. We were able to easily get a car to the airport arranged at the bell desk and could leave our suitcases for 2 dollars each.

I booked two rooms at the Gallivant, the most positive point is the location, so close to Times Square, lots of delis & restaurants on 8th Ave.Negatives: $35 per night per room “city tax” 30$ of this is for business and fitness centre use, bottles of water which we didn’t know about til second last day, they are mini too. There was also a list of discounts for local businesses including a florist??? Surely this should be a local charge for guests who actually use the facilities. This made the trip expensive as we had two rooms for 5 nights... The elevators were extremely slow and busy, we were on 15th floor and had to walk up several times.Room 1512 is next door to a family room this was occupied for the last 3 nights of our stay. We heard everything from 530am onwards, every conversation, climbing in and off bunks, music, bathroom doors, we were awake hours before our time, the occupants were not overly noisy just extremely thin walls.

Couldn’t want a better location when visiting Times Square New York. Lovely welcome on arrival, quick check in. Chose the hotel based on location, only really needed a base as didn’t expect to spend much time in the hotel.Rooms small but that’s to be expected in New York, but had everything you need. Coffee machine, lots of clean fluffy towels etc. Housekeeping never bothered us when do not disturb sign on door, and always arrived back to a clean room (even folded pyjamas for us!) shower nice and powerful, flat screen tv,Comfortable bed, iron and board, hairdryer. Was able to buy tickets for broadway with concierge who had some great tips regarding the ticket prices and any offers on. If we were to go back to New York would definitely stay there again , thank you Gallivant !!

average stay , not very pleasant staff , except for the 1 guy that was at reception for 1 day( ca t remember his name, was from Turkey). heater didnt work properly in my room , as well as the toilet on the last morming of my stay found a roach in the bathroom, upon checkout was not even asked how was my stay and if there was anything else that i needed overall poor to average service

Negatives:- wifi very slow- bathroom door jammed/didn't close properly- shower screen too small, bathroom floods when using shower- sometimes didnt get a bath mat- fan in bathroom didnt work- wasnt always hot water in the shower- light on mirror flashed when switched on so could not be used- light in main room had humming sound when switched on- one bed had slope in the middle of mattress- window didnt close all the way- lamp over bed didnt work as plug was broken- charging dock on desk didnt work- no power outlets close to bedside to plug anything in - clock radio didnt have a power cord so could not be used- no 'do not distrub' sign so housekeeping woke us up everyday- hallways constantly smelled of weed from other rooms- very noisy even from room on level 9 (garbage trucks, street noise, music from Times Square etc)- reception staff not helpfulPositives:- good location- shower pressure good- no bed bugs

Arrived about 4pm checked in with ease. Room was small but who cares not there to be stuck in a room we only slept in it was out from 7.30 till after midnight. Rooms were clean and tidy and had everything you need for a 3 night stay so all in all would definitely recommend this place as it is 2 mins walk from the heartbeat of NYC Times Square ideal hopefully be back soon

Great hotel, brilliant location. Very clean and good value for money, would recommend and stay again. Staff very helpful and friendly. We didn’t sample the food available in the hotel but it all looked and smelt good.

bad experience with my credit card where money was taken daily up to a total of 4 thousand dollars while the whole to pay was 1600 $ .. no one who knew how to explain what happened .. the only positive thing is the position.

Rooms were TINY so small for the price. The bathroom is even smaller. Room on 9th floor had no controller for the heating unit so had to open window which ment no sleep due to noise. The hot water didnt work on multiple occasions either hotel didnt seem to be bothered

Room was as advertised and quiet for a good nights rest. Only complaint would be the small 2" step between bedroom & bathroom. Just had to make sure I didn't stub my toe into it. Shower was awesome. Very good location for my conference at Marriott Marquis down the street.

The hotel is perfectly located in Hell's Kitchen/Times Square. It looks like it has been recently refurbished and was clean and modern. Room was spacious and extremely clean. Staff were friendly. Unfortunately water fountains not on every floor and water was warm.

We were apprehensive after reading reviews but we needn't have been. Hotel staff were friendly, room was spacious and extremely comfortable! Location is perfect! Literally a minute walk and you're in Times Square. We fell in love with New York and will be back to the Gallivant for our next trip! Thank you!

We stayed here for 5 days got a warm welcome when we checked in. Had a lovely room. Clean plenty room and super shower. We were on time square as said. A little noisy at times but we were in centre off New York. All staff had a smile on there face and all were really friendly. If back in New York we will use it again.

Beautiful, clean hotel in the very heart of the theater district. Got an unbelievably FANTASTIC price for a 5-night stay, on their queen room WITH BALCONY. DO get that room type if available. The staff was professional, but might have been a little friendlier. If their prices remain this competitive, the Gallivant will be my go-to Broadway hotel FOREVER.

we stayed at the gallivant hotel for 8 days, the staff are very friendly, the rooms are large and clean.The location of the hotel is perfect as it is in the middle of everything, It is 1 minute from Times Square and 10/15 minutes from Empire State Building, Top of the Rock and Central Park. we enjoyed well.

The location of the hotel was great, also easy to find from the train station. The price-performance ratio is not sufficient. The cleanliness of the room left a lot to be desired. If you like it quiet at night, is there in the wrong place. The music was loud and the engines rumbled to the backyard. We did not consider both of these as bad, because after all, you're on Time Squere.

Small but clean comfortable room. Clean but small room. Bed is ok but a bit hard and low to the floor for me. Helpful friendly staff. Close to restaurants, 3 block walk to Subway at 50th and Broadway then 2 stops to Penn Station.
user_name:
Lauraleen O
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed at the Gallivant for a long weekend (birthday trip back in January) and can’t fault it. From the moment we checked in (by a lovely staff member who very kindly gave us a room upgrade without asking, I suppose it helps to be nice to your hosts when checking in!) to the help with storing baggage on leaving, every single member of staff (from the concierge to the cleaners) were all exemplary in carrying out their roles. The Gallivant is on a prime location in Manhattan (seconds away from Times Square and theatres) for visiting tourists and a short stroll up to Central Park or the nearby Metro station for getting down to Brooklyn Bridge or the Staten Island Ferry. It’s a big hotel with lots of guests so do be patient when waiting to get the lifts and plenty of great options nearby for eating (The Food Emporium one street up is recommended for folk on a budget with great sit in/take away options for food and the best take out selection of craft beers in the area). Highly recommended!

Worst hotel we have ever stayed at in our life, lumpy beds, no shower curtains or hot water, brown sewage water coming out of sink tap, and dishonest reception staff, poor housekeeping and I could go on

I think I don’t need to explain about location. Location was very good!I strongly recommend that if you might stay this hotel, you must choose penthouse room. PH was awesome facility, space and nice view.夜間のチェックインから始まり、荷物預け、Wifiサービスなどもとても良い印象でした。屋上階ペントハウス1602に泊まりましたが、屋上バルコニーには椅子やテーブルも用意され、眺めも最高でした。ダブルベッドと２段ベッドがあり、家族で泊まると良いでしょう！

Ok hotel, excellent location, tried to check in early but the unfriendly representative was very dismissive and told us to stow our bags over there and come back after 3pm. The size of the premium room was ok but could do with better cleaning, walls, window sills and floor was grimy

Good and cosy rooms. The hotel lacks of amenities and restaurants. It´s only for sleeping. Administrative and cleaning personal very friendly and attentive of any necessity. Very good location near to subway and Starbucks.

Location is the main selling point of this hotel! Around the corner from Times Square and a busy subway station. The room was clean and tidy but small. To be honest for the location I didn’t expect a large room. It was adequate for what we wanted. A couple of issues with the heating but they were soon fixed as soon as we spoke to the reception team. Staff were polite. Quick tip - deli on the corner with the green sign is ideal to grab quick food on the go, reasonable prices and only a 30 second walk from the hotel

I was not comfortable nor was my wife and I happy with the customer service we received. It was until the actual hotel manager showed up that we got any results. Robert the hotel manager is a true asset to the company.

Hotel is ran very efficiently. Bedroom was spacious and very clean. First class housekeeping. Literally around the corner from Times Square. All Broadway shows nearby. Facilities include wifi and printing service. Highly recommend

Facilities were nice. The ladder on the bunk bed was weird and hard to safely operate, and the WiFi was downright terrible, but other than that it was a nice stay with effective and respectful cleaning staff. Right on times Square, great location!

The employee at the check in was totally unmotivated and showed only the minimum of friendliness. And check your credit card statement. Too much deducted! Really small rooms and the windows aren't soundproof at all.

My heater was not working, the did not fix it, instead they gave me a blanket after complaining twice. The desk area won't answer the phone meaning you have to go downstairs to request anything. Twice the elevators were broken, leaving the entire hotel with one elevator.House cleaning was SUPER loud at 8 am, making it impossible to sleep after 8am hearing them yelling and laughing on the hallways like if noone else was there.My room safe was broken and I had to ask 3 times to get it fixed.Location was excellent and the room was clean.

Very poor quality for the price paied. Small room with even smaller bathroom. Airconditioning is very loud. Cleanliness is so so. Very averrage breakfast. But nevertheless good location. I do not recommend. Sorry!

Excellent location, the reception is nicely decorated . Arrived early from a flight from Vegas at around 8 a.m couldn’t get into our room as was 3pm check inn so we slept in the reception on the couch as we were exhausted after a night flight. Finally checked in at 2pm. The room was very small we had 2 large suitcases and were unable to open them due to the space. The bed was like a small double. The bathroom was also tiny with nowhere to put your toiletry bags. The shower cubicle was also tiny to get into. The rooms get extremely hot and the windows only open a few. Inches we tried to put the aircon on to cold but was far too noisy and then we opened the windows to the sound of sirens and noise all night. Also the lifts are small and always crowded and struggled getting suitcases in. No luggage room so the suitcases of the guests leaving are spread all over the reception area when we left. Overall clean and tidy just needs larger rooms

this is my second review i have ever written.....in my life. arrived on sat at 8ish AM. immediately i couldn't help notice the demeanor of the one of the front line staff wasn't so friendly. lined up and waited to be served and as god would have it, i got the unhappy one. told her i am here to chk in and have booked for 2 rooms. told in a less than friendly tone that check out is 3pm. i was traveling with my wife, 3 kids (12, 14 and 16) and my mother in law (in her 70s). we paid almost $800 for 2 rooms so to me that was more than a pretty penny. maybe i'm just not aware that NYC standards are different from the rest of the world as they are one of the most expensive cities in the world. i'm from vancouver, bc, canada so we ain't some 3rd world nation either as we ranked 36th most expensive city to live in also. however given the amount i spent, the room was no different than a 3 star best western....maybe even worst with certain things which i'll get to. she told me i could leave our luggage with worker there for storage and come back to chk in which we did. we came back at 4pm and i got a different gentleman on the chk in. i told him i'm here to chk in and he told me i was late....i didn't take the comment very well but kept to myself. he didn't keep telling me not once but twice how we up given the "premium" room. by now, i wasn't even moved so i was expressionless when advised twice. btw, storage for suitcases is $2 per. i have NEVER paid for luggage storage in my entire life at the hotel where i'm staying at.....but hey, then again, we are in NYC, home of true capitalism of the US of A. i get into our room and immediately i noticed the top drawer of my dresser was wide open. so i tried closing it immediately only to discover it doesn't close, keeps slipping back out. by now, i was worried that i be blamed for it so i took some tissue and jammed in on the side rails to keep it from opening. while setting up our room, i notice an incredibly loud bang follow by a series of bangs. it's the damn pipes!!!!! every time somebody in the building somewhere uses the washroom, the noise repeats. this goes on intermittently throughout our entire stay. despite taking the red eye flight and an entire day at time square, i'm a light sleeper so got awaken once every hour/2 hours. as morning came, my wife said she had no hot water in her room...and being near next door to a club, all she got was loud music to almost 2am. i have lots more but n

First of all I’ve visited New York 3 times before and all of my stays have been in the Times Square area and have been wonderful apart from this one. So to start off with we arrived to a rude receptionist then when arriving in our room we was completely appalled at the size of the room and the state of it, we could hardly fit 2 suitcases in and still then the door was hitting off them, the wardrobe could not even fit my cabin bag in, we had no natural sun light, the air conditioning had to be turned of during the night because it was too loud even for one of my family members who is profoundly deaf so you can imagine the sound and the bathroom was so small I could just about sit on the toilet and my legs didn’t hit the wall by centimetres and I’m 5 ft 5 so you could imagine the problem my boyfriend had when he needed the toilet. We went straight to the manager and also found the price of our room went down from $2300 to $800 online so we went to explain how we wanted to be upgraded because our room was unexceptable and we was obviously ridiculously over charged. So we asked if we was able to either be given a refund because the confirmation says the hotel price matches if you find the room cheaper and if that wasn’t possible that we could be given free breakfast if they wouldn’t price match ,we was refused price match and breakfast. To add to this we was even told by the cleaners that “everyone moves rooms when they arrive because no body is happy with their room” and every passing guest that walk by in this moment agreed and told us the problems that they was having too. I brought this as a gift for my mother who is visiting for the first time and my boyfriend I spent $4600 for two “standard rooms” and I was upgraded to “king size” which the hotel told me I was lucky to get even though the king size cost $1200 by the time we was there so we still lost out over $2300 we have had an awful start to our holiday and I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. IT ONLY HAS 4 STARS BECAUSE OF ITS LOCATION THE HOTEL IS NOT 4 STARS STANDARD.

Myself and boyfriend visited the hotel the end of March. Our problems started when we checked in as the receptionist gave us our room number and sent us to the wrong room. When we finally got to our room we were quite disappointed at how small it was. In addition to this the door was broken, it kept catching and you had to force the door shut.We told the hotel employees about this on three occasions, all three occasions we were told it would be fixed or we would be offered a new room. This never happened. We utilised the safe in our room to keep our valuables safe, upon arriving back from a day of sightseeing we were unable to access our safe due to an error code. A member of staff did come up to fix this and I asked why the safe was broken she informed us that the passcode had been incorrectly entered too many times. However we had not attempted to access the safe all day. I became concerned incase the house keeping staff had not ensured the door was properly closed and someone may have entered our room and attempted to open the safe. I expressed this concern to the member of staff who quickly said it was an error with the safe however we still had doubts about this and asked about cameras in the corridor which the hotel DOES NOT have. We felt this was very unsafe as anyone could enter the hotel.It’s a great location but we didn’t feel safe here. The rooms are so tiny and the hotel have still not responded to my complaint about our stay.

Pros; The help was friendly. The location is fantastic. Things were pretty clean.Cons; The heat. We could not shut the heat off in our room. It seemed to run constantly. Even with the AC on! Needless to say, we didnt spend much time in the room. The Shower, although clean did not drain well, and did not have a door. Just a half, glass wall. Needless to say the bathroom floor can get pretty wet. It wasnt a terrible stay... but it wasnt a great one either.

Just come back from a 4 night stay at The Gallivant. After reading a few, not so complimentary reviews, I was pleasantly surprised. Great location for all activities. Had no problems with WiFi connection and staff were pleasant. Room was small but I’ve stayed in smaller in New York. The £150 security charge was a shock but I’m at a Hotel in Memphis at the moment and they’ve just charged £100 on my card so it’s common. I would certainly stay again.

Excellent location near Times Square. The room was large with street view. The room was clean and tidy except for a pill wrap that belonged to the previous guest.Although I paid more than 150$ per night for the room including resort fee, I had to pay an additional 2$ for storing my suitcase until my flight on the check out day. 2$ does not make a difference neither to me nor to the Gallivant hotel, but it did leave a bad taste in my mouth.

Great central location, close to main attractions, bars, restaurants, Times Square, theatres and subway. However, room was tiny and very hot (no functioning AC), receptionist at check-in was rude (albeit other hotel staff were ok), and most importantly the hotel is only a few doors up from a very busy fire station - sirens throughout the night. Convenient if the hotel was on fire / not so great for sleeping.

The only good thing about the Gallivant was its central location; whilst I was not enamoured with the area itself, it was extremely well located as a base to go back to recharge after a long walk around the city, and then go back out again. Unfortunately the positive aspects stop there for me. From day one I had to repeatedly complain about the WiFi being inexistent in my room; I was banking on this as the place where I could check NYC's map, where I was going for the day, opening times/prices for places I wanted to visit, weather app, WhatApp and other social media usage. I was told rather dismissively on the first day that, whilst yes, the signal was poor, it was probably because I had 'x' many browser windows open and had I tried to turn it off and on again. I found this very patronising, and frankly insulting to my intelligence, as it was clearly the WiF, not my phone. Nothing was ever done about it, and nor was I given any kind of apology about not being able to use the WiFi in full in my room even though it is included in the list of services paid for by the Urban Tax ($35 per day) charged at the end of my visit.I also remarked several times that the TV in my room was not working (it was essential the equivalent of watching TV in the '80s with a bad aerial signal); whilst I clearly did not visit NY to watch TV in my hotel room, I consider this to be a basic, so that I can watch the news in the morning, maybe catch a late night show before falling asleep, etc. For two days nobody came upstairs to check, and only on the third day (when I had finally given up and unpacked all of my stuff) was I offered to switch rooms, which I was reluctant to do anyway as I had no idea what other issues the new room would present, thus I thanked them and declined.The cleanliness of the room was down to absolute basic, I doubt anyone ever decided to sweep or vacuum under the bed, which had clearly collected dust from years of guests. (I only had the misfortune of noticing this because I dropped an earring and had to put my hand down there); also the bathroom was so small that I had to essentially play tetris to use it.If by mistake you'd like to sleep an extra hour one morning because you walked around so much the previous day and you are exhausted, forget it; the cleaners will make sure to shout at each other or down their phone from very early on, never mind a few 'do not disturb' signs.In short, a very bad experience for me, not worth the money.

The location is perfect for everything I want to do when in NYC. The rooms may be small, but I'm not there to stay in the room, just to sleep. Comfortable pillows. Easy check in and check out and very nice staff.

Just arrived back home in the UK from a wonderful 3 night stay at The Gallivant. We arrived wednesday evening and were greeted by friendly staff who checked us in and explained about the security fee and urban tax which we already knew about. Our room on the 2nd floor was very clean,tidy and plenty of room for a couple and included a coffee machine which was very nice to have! The Gallivant is located just around the corner from Times Square - a 2 minute walk if that. Perfect! If we come back to New York in the future we will definately stay with Gallivant. Lovely,friendly and helpful staff and a very enjoyable stay in The Gallivant with an amazing experience in New York! Thank You

The location is incredible, although the service is normal, pretty standard for a business plan.Don't imagine your going to receive a good morning sir by the door (nor help to open it) but the people doing the cleaning were nice and respectful. Gladly will return to it.

From start to finish staff were very friendly and polite, they were great with our two year old always saying hello and giving him a little bottle of water. Room was great, was small but a great place to get your head down, very clean and even had a little view of the city. We were very worried by some of the reviews, but it was a great break away during half term and would happily stay again.

We stayed in a family room for 6 nights in March over St Patrick's day. We arrived around 8pm. As soon as our taxi pulled up the Bell man came out to help us with our bags. Check in was quick and efficient and the Bell man helped us up to our room with our bags. The room was a decent size. We booked a family room which sleeps 6 people but there was only 3 of us. The room size was perfect for the 3 of us but I think it would have been a squeeze with 6. Working in a hotel myself I feel the cleanliness could have been a little better. There was hair in the shower drain when we arrived and I'm sure the floor wasn't hoovered at any stage throughout our stay. Although there had been a few spillage on our bed which was changed. Really central location, no more than a 2 minute walk to Times Square and close to subway stations. We love New York!

I stayed here on a solo trip. It was fine for one person but was small had I been with the hubby.This is a European style hotel. Small bed (double not queen), small bathroom (nowhere to put your stuff except on the back of toilet :( small room. There was a lot of street noise all night. New York is the city that never sleeps. It’s because it’s so damn noisy at night! Every hour a siren, trash trucks coming around and tourists at all hours.The front desk staff was good. The room was clean with a gorgeous shower. You can’t beat the location. There are two great restaurants on either side. And best of all, an Irish pub two doors down.Very slow,small elevator. Like I said, European style.

Positives - great location and shower.Negatives - room is on the small side and a lot shabbier than the photos show.The biggest issue (which haven spoken to other guests at 3am having the same issue) is the temperature control in the rooms. We stayed 2 nights and barely got any sleep as the room was swelteringly hot! The A/C has no direct control in the room and is sooo loud when it repeatedly fires up throughout the night blasting ice cold air. If you finally manage to fall asleep once the AC has cooled the room, expect to wake up sweating or disturbed by the unit kicking in again. Would never stay again, pay a couple of quid extra and go to one of the other hotels in the area!

Great place for a night or two, near all of best Times Square and Broadway have to offer. The bed was a bit short for a tall guy like myself but I made do. Check your itemized bill before you leave to ensure it’s all correct.

Apart from the rooms being very small, we had a good time at this hotel, the staff were friendly and very helpfu, except for one person on the reception desk who we found to be quite rude. We had bed and breakfast and we could not fault the food it was very nice.l

good location, nice lobby, but terrible customer service, girls on reception are the worst, poor cleanness, hair all over bathroom, people orientation poor, information terrible... not friendly at all

This hotel is strategically located near Times Square. Rooms are little small but as per New York standards, they are good. The bathroom was a little congested but well maintained. Your stay doesn't cover for breakfast. For water, you can ask at the counter and they will give you 2 mini bottles. Reception staff are helpful. Quick and easy check-in check out.

Five nights, three rooms, in each room some amenities didn't work : bed, air conditionning, phone, tv, doorlock, beside lamp, shower leak and shower clogged!!! How is it possible?! Does anyone check the rooms and amenities? Is it anyone's work in there?!

Fantastic location for times square and the theatre land.On first impression hotel looks fab in lobby,staff were polite and check in speedy,bedrooms are small but served the purpose as only there to sleep,coffee machine provided in rooms,I would stay here again

Visited New York for St Patrick’s weekend with my fiancée, her brother and his wife. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, it’s well situated but that can also mean noise. The tourists tax is a bit excessive and you have to ask for the water. Room service was good and rooms are basic but clean. My only issue was our room 311 was a bit on the small side, and had the entire hvac plant for the hotel outside the window . It was like sleeping next to a bus on idle all night Overall a decent well located place with friendly staff, it’s really just somewhere to crash at the end of the day

We were given a room that had a broken TV and dried toothpaste on the dresser. Was given a new room but then upon checkout we were charged an "urban fee". We tried to get it waived since we used none of the benefits but then the manager Ben told us it's a tax, which doesnt make sense since he couldnt tell us whether it was a federal, state, city, or even food tax. The other front desk employees and the cleaning staff was very nice and respectful, but I am never coming back here.

Located in the heart of Times Square, this little is close to everything - Central Park, Midtown and etc. Hotel lobby and staff are very welcoming and great to deal with. Not stuffy at all. It’s a very relaxing atmosphere. Checkout the selfie station in the lobby.

The room was TINY. Okay for one person wanting to be out and about. The TV didn't work but I wasn't there for TV. Staff is great, friendly and helpful. The restaurant An'Am next door is delicious. The location is what I was after and it was perfect. I saw 3 Broadway shows in 2 days because they were so close to the TKTS kiosk.
-The experience was ok.-The location is excellent-Room too small.-RSVS only available after 9:00 to resolve issues-Check out at 12:00 pm so that was very good-luggage safe care on lobby for low cost

Disappointed and will never book here again, DEFINITELY NOT WORTH THE PRICE I PAID! Rooms were underwhelming, no refrigerators, no microwaves, rooms were incredibly small. Just not worth the money i paid at all.
user_name:
Curiosity32592088749
New York City, New York

review_body: Front desk clerks were friendly and gave me 2 bottled waters upon arrival. The hotel is small and does not have its own bar or restaurant, but there are two Asian restaurants with side entrances into the hotel that offer discounts to guests. The Japanese restaurant allowed me to order a wine to go that I could bring to my room. I was a decent pinot and was the most inexpensive drink I had the entire trip. Immediately upon arriving to my room, I got a call from the front desk to welcome me. The room was compact, but lovely with a contemporary motif. I had a junior suite, which included a loveseat, a work desk, and a private balcony. Unfortunately, it rained my entire stay, and as the balcony had no cover, I was unable to sit out there without a raincoat and umbrella. Shortly after arrival, I got an email asking me to rate my stay thus far. I noted that some of the lights in my room were flickering, some wouldn't come on at all, the door handle on the balcony was broken, the room was very hot due to what seemed to be an HVAC issue, and I was having trouble finding an outlet to plug in my devices. I went out to explore the city. When I returned, it was slightly cooler in my room (still very hot), the flickering lights had been replaced, and there was a new clock radio on the night stand with USB ports for my devices, but the door handle was still broken and the heater still would not cycle off. Because of that, I slept with the balcony door cracked to let in some cooler air and unfortunately heard street sounds all night. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. If the heater had not been broken, I would have enjoyed the stay. Overall, for the location and price, I'd stay there again. Hopefully, it won't rain next time so I can enjoy the balcony.

Great location for a central Manhattan businesses trip. The room was bigger than I thought and for NY standards it was surprisingly large and I only had a twin room. Very clean and amenities are basic but all you need if you're not spending large amount of time in the room etc.

So i'm currently here and today I am checking out. The hotel has been ok. I had paid for an upgrade with BA to a Queen sized room, but was met with a tiny bedroom and a bed that was as small as my standard double at home, which was dissapointing. The mattress is a standard double but, it appears to be a queen base. The internet is rubbish, it works perfectly fine in the lobby but doesn't work in the bedroom (i'm in room 919). The shower in the room has been lukewarm on 2/3 of our days here and today, it is like ice cubes coming out the tap. I have questioned reception & requested that I be allowed to shower elsewhere but was told that isn't possible and that cold showers are a common problem here, very dissapointing as I have a long journey home tonight back to the UK and need to shower. The aircon in the room, whilst good, is extremely loud and therefore you can't really have it on whilst sleeping, as it either keeps you awake, or wakes you up, meaning you swelter. Despite the above, the staff are really friendly, especially Billy the housekeeping supervisor and the locality is fantastic, literally a 1 mimute walk to Times Square, Juniors, Hershey & M&M store & subway is on the next block. I would stay here again due to location and staff but not in this room again and I would save money on an upgrade & book a standard double, as I believe that is what they have put me in anyway.

Arrived on a Wednesday evening. Checked in with literally no warm welcome at all. Was asked for ID & credit card where they immediately debited 190 dollars. No warning & no explanation. No conversation on where if we wanted breakfast, where the lift was, local bars. Zero! No usual NY welcome. Arrived in our room which to be fair was fine. Clean & big enough for 2. The whole time whilst we were there (4 nights) did anyone acknowledge our existence until we had to report a expensive night cream going missing from our bathroom. They said the cleaner claimed not to have seen it! £60 just gone. When we checked out we were charged 2 dollars per case. Never ever been charged to look after a case for 4 hours. Be careful when ordering a taxi from the hotel. The guy who manages luggage ordered a car for us but was passed some money when the driver arrived. Driver only told us 10 minutes from jfk that he could only take cash as he had forgot his card machine. Location is excellent but wouldn’t return to the gallivant. They really need to work on their customer service but looking at other reviews clearly they can’t be bothered!

Very nice hotel. The room was beautiful and comfortable. The shower was incredible. The heating was old and it didn’t work well. The location is perfect! The personel is really nice and they try to help you with your needs

Excellent location. Hotel fine but rooms very small and hot even in March. Kept air con on all night. Can’t really complain as I didn’t go to sit in room. Staff very helpful and waived urban fees. Also assisted with shuttle to airport. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the gallivant and would definitely return but get a bigger room

Cute little hotel, very very close to Times Square. Concierge was very sweet and helpful. Room was nice, seems a little pricey for the size of room and general quality, but it I suppose any hotel this close to Times Square would be. I would stay again, nothing bad to say other than a bit pricey for what it is.

Great hotel in Time Sq Staff are very helpful Bed was super comfy  Stayed 4 days coffee and toiletries were always topped up Bathroom was clean and great shower Some great restaurants on 8th ave by the hotelI didn’t eat at the hotel

Overall, good staff very helpful and their rooms are very small specially if you have large suit case their no where to put them in the room due to the very small size. The rooms are keep clean. Overall the location to time square and subway was great within walking distance to all shows and pubs and restaurants.

3 night stay at the Gallivant complete and overall I was very satisfied with my stay! Upon arrival to the hotel they had us checking out on Monday the 18th but our stay was actually just until Saturday the 16th. As a result of this confusion the hotel said they only have rooms with double beds which was not acceptable for me my dad to share! I showed my booking confirmation from BA and eventually they sorted us out with a new room.The room - Had three beds! A double and a bunkbed (maybe a family room) it was clean and spacious. The heating in the room was either hot or cold or off! Nothing Inbetween but this wasn't much of an issue.Location - Great location but expect it to be noisy 24 hours a day! Traffic on 8th nearby and it's relentless! Regardless of this I actually slept well and the bed was comfortable!Staff - Helpful! Deposit - Having never been to the states before I wasn't up together with credit card swipes for "damages". This wasn't an issue but the hotel earmarked 250 US DOLLARS without informing me they would! When I went to question this I saw a sign explaining this...it hasn't come back to me yet but hopefully it will soon! Over all a good stay!

I was a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews for this hotel. However, we found it clean and compact. Staff could have been a bit more helpful but they were very busy at most times. The location is fantastic being near many restaurants and cafes and near Times square.

Small room but very comfortable and clean. Perfect base for exploring New York. Right in the heart of Times Square.Chinese restaurant next door and a fantastic Irish bar next door but one where we had a fantastic steak.
user_name:
Hayley M
Bury St. Edmunds, United Kingdom

review_body: On arrival we walked into a swanky lobby area and was very pleased anticipating a very nice stay. Our check in experience was poor the receptionist was rude barked at us in broken English seemed to have very little patience. On entering the room I was met with a musty smell and an irritating buzzing sound. The room was cold and there was a draft and no amount of messing with the heating system made any difference. The room looked nice initially but it soon became apparent it was run down and in the need of a facelift. I’m so glad we had booked elsewhere for the other night due to the absurd amount they were asking for a second night. Had I do bit the bullet and paid that amount I would’ve been bitterly disappointed! Wouldn’t stay here again and wouldn’t recommend! Only good point is the location as Times Square is a stone throw away. Also be aware of the urban tax adding $30 per night they also take a deposit in case of incidentals and it takes up to 10 days to be returned

Front desk was friendly. Location was right by Times Square. There was trash and leftover molded food on our balcony. Rooms are small but expected for NYC. Parking was directly across the street and reasonable ($45/night).

We had a great experience here. Hotel staff was great and location and value is well worth it for this hotel. We stayed in a family room for 6 adults and managed well. Would definitely stay here again.

We've just spent 4 nights at this hotel. The location is amazing if you want to be close to Times Square. The rooms aren't huge but they have a bed, lamps, TV, bathroom, safe, iron and board, Shower and toilet facilities, so all of the essentials you need to make your stay comfortable. It might be a bit tired but if you are coming to NYC to see the city it has everything you need. If you're looking for a fancy hotel with a spectacular view don't come here. If you are looking for a hotel that's clean and in a good location then this is perfect. The maid came in and gave us fresh towels and made our bed every single day. There was noise from the street outside as it is 'the city that never sleeps' but we had an amazing time here, we were comfortable and the room did everything we needed it to do while we were here to see the city.

We love staying at the Gallivant location is great. You are steps away from Times Square,Broadway plays. The subway is in easy reach also. Everyone at the hotel are always friendly and ready to assist in way they. What wonderful place to stay.

Firstly the location is fantastic. Steps away from times square. The guy who checked us in was very rude and the same on check but staff on concierge were lovely ,the room was clean, we had a issue with the a.c. in our room after 5 nights so had to move for final 2 nights and the second room was much bigger but we're happy with the first one too . Just a little small.. main issue was the elevators . The wait was horrendous. Sometimes not all 3 worked. And only fit 7 people. We walked 14 flights of stairs many days as the wait for terrible. I would recommend to a friend tho for a cheap stay on times square

The title says it all. Coffee maker did not work. I woke up with a backache. The room was so small I kept whacking my knee on the desk. Two people would NOT have fit in the room without crashing into each other.

Stayed here March, check in was quick lady swiped my card took $200 no explanation didn’t tell me, gave me key no explanation no helpful info! I’m a hotel manager so I know how this should be done and if she was my staff she be sacked! Room was ok, pics deceiving, extractor fan very noisy, shower leaked and sprayed water all over the floor! Loud extractor or air con unit outside room running all night! It was very average but served its purpose! Would I return probably not!

great location room was clean but had no cold water in bathroom sink. staff members were not too helpful w/one being a grouch. Staff should be more accommodating w/great attitudes. Although I love the location, I would be hesitant to recommend since I found that certain employees of this hotel are rude.

Room is way to small, no fridge or microwave in room, hotel only had two elevators and on my stay one was out of service, taking the stairs up and down is not an option with luggage to the 14th floor, waited over. Half hr, only good thing abt the hotel is the location

Old hotel. The room I had used steam heat generated thru radiator pipes that rattle thru the night. I was given a new room but the noise in the hallway kept me up all night. The location is great but using a sleeping bag laid in the middle of time square could have been more comfortable.

Stayed here for our wedding anniversary and upgraded to a queen deluxe when booking, when we arrived we were given a room that was dirty and a world apart from what was advertised as a queen deluxe it looked more like a dark broom cupboard! Was given a second room which was also a dirty broom cupboard our 3rd room was clean in appearance so we settled down the next morning woke for a shower put the shower to run 30 minutes later it was still freezing cold rang front desk to be told leave it run longer during our stay we figured the shower had 2 settings no matter how much you turn the dial freezing or boiling! We also had a small “pet” in our room a cockroach when we reported it to the front desk we were told it’s because it’s wet outside??? There are far better hotels to stay in New York

Can't go wrong with it's location, bang in the middle of midtown. Very friendly staff who work quickly and efficiently to your needs, check in and out was simple. Room was clean and cosy, beds super comfortable.

Great place to stay to day trip all around New York. On time squares door step, 15 min walk to Central Park, 20 mins to Brooklyn Bridge and to catch ferry to see Statue of Liberty. Great delis, restaurants and takeouts around.

Stayed here in February, got given the smallest room, which would have been fine for a night, but we were staying for a week so wanted to be more comfortable. The man on reception switched our room as soon as we said. The room we had was on the second floor, so we didn’t have any issues with any elevators we just used the stairs. The rooms were cleaned every single day, very tidy, yes the furniture could be newer and the internet could be faster but none of that really matters. The only problem we had was the air conditioning was broken, it sounded like a jet engine was in our room constantly, even the heating made a noise. However due to this we heard no city noise whatsoever. The ‘urban fee’ was for water, gym and internet, none of which we used but it’s just one of those things. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff are so friendly especially the blonde lady on reception who showed us the way to the Staten Island ferry. We also thought Quentin on luggage was an absolute diamond. So polite.
user_name:
db90x
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel turned out to be better than the reviews I read before booking! I wasn't happy with the charge for holding luggage after checkout, since I did tip for holding luggage before checkin. Overall, the stay was nice and I plan to return.

We stayed here for 5 nights in March, check in was seamless and a lovely welcome, we had a double room which was compact but perfect size as we didn’t plan on spending our trip in the room, bed was so comfortable and the room was spotless, cleaned daily by really lovely staff. Didn’t hear any noise at night, so slept really well. The location is superb literally 1 minute walk to Times Square and subway. Found all the staff to be very friendly. I was a little apprehensive when reading some reviews but this hotel lived up to our expectations. We would 100% stay here again. Only grievance was with the lifts as you had to wait a while at times but other than that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We will be back!

Advertisement pictures of rooms are deceiving. Multiple rooms with television and telephone etc faults. Got upgraded to a ‘better’ suite to which was next to the service elevator so had rattling noises through the wall constantly which kept us up most of the night and also had flies coming from the shower drain.

I booked The Gallivant cause the price was reduced for my dates. I'm glad I tried it. The room I had was a mini suite. The living room area had a coffee table and a few chairs with a mini fridge. What I discovered was there was a bunk bed folded into the wall (like on a cruise ship) great if you want extra guest in your room. The bedroom was comfortable with a desk window flat screen, storage closet with mirror and a comfortable bed. The washroom was tight but functional with a good size walking shower. The wifi was good throughout the hotel. The lobby is colourful and different with plenty of seating area's and a roomy checkin counter.

As the title of my review suggests, this is an average Manhattan hotel. Location is great for restaurants, bars, theatres etc, but that is it.nothng Can only get access to room after 15:00. Reception area was corwded due "00

Visited this hotel in February 2019 for my birthday trip to NYC booked with British Airways as a complete package holiday. On arrival, clean room (pretty small ‘deluxe queen’) but adequate for a 7 night stay in a busy city. Room was located on the front of the property. The room was quite noisy and again I expected that with it being such a busy city. The hotel is located around the corner from a fire station so expect sirens to be sounding all night. The location is great for the city and is walking distance from Times Square and Central Park. In fairness my partner and i only used the subway once during our whole stay. The rooms are clean and relatively modern with coffee and toiletries provided. I did have to request extra creamers for the coffee as occasionally the maid left us short and I also Had to ask for the hairdryer which was not provided in the room. The hotel has 3 lifts which were all working properly and we rarely had to wait to use them. The water was always hot and I know previous reviews have stated otherwise but we didn’t have an issue during our stay. On our arrival we were asked to provide a credit card (which we did) and were told that this was to cover any ‘damage caused’ to the room. We were happy with this as this is standard practice. We enjoyed our stay and checked out early for a 10am flight back to the UK on our last day. On check out we handed keys back in and we knew that there were no charges to be added to the room. On our arrival back in the UK my partner was charged £176 to his credit card ($230) When he queried the transaction it said that the card pin and signature had been used. At NO TIME did he authorise The Gallivant to charge this money to his account. We were not informed of this charge by the hotel or by BA. On reading reviews I have gathered that this fee is possibly a resort fee. The resort fee is used to charge for WiFi, gym and water. We didn’t used the gym, we didn’t have any water, and the WiFi was slow and extremely intermittent. The hotel website advertised “free WiFi high speed internet’ Which it clearly isn’t. We are now in dispute about the transaction with the credit card company. Be aware of this before you book or make sure you fully understand that these charges could be applied to your account without your knowledge.

Stayed for 2 nights Feb 19. On checking in we were dealt with really quickly but was slightly alarmed at a huge school group hanging around the lifts. The staff quickly made sure everyone got in a lift and sent us on our way. The room was small but more than adequate for us as we literally wanted somewhere to sleep. Very clean and surprisingly quiet although the room was inward facing. My only moan really is the breakfast. We were booked as continental breakfast and it seemed to be in an adjoining Chinese restraunt. Very basic to the point of polystyrene cups and bowls. This just screams to me that they’re catering for the masses and don’t actually care too much about thier guests. I actually feel bad writing this as the staff were very friendly. I’m just not convinced I should pay $5 to upgrade to an american breakfast to drink my coffee put of a cup or mug which we were offered when entering.

Minutes from Times Square this is a good base for New York City. The room was small but comfortable with a queen bed. The ensuite shower had plenty of hot water. A Coffee maker and complimentary coffee kept us refreshed. we had no problem with air con system. The hotel itself was quite but the street noises were intrusive and the fire station is almost next door. breakfast can be taken in the Chines restaurant adjoining and they do a deal for multi breakfasts at a much better price than advertised. there are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. the concierge is very helpful with ideas of places to go, where to eat, etc..

Great VFM but still more than acceptable hotelRoom only but who needs food providing this close to Times Square ?Majority of staff friendly and helpfulWifi providedOnly gripe Rooms too hot but who comes to NYC to sleep ?

Our hotel room the heat would not shut off,nor would the air work.Had to sleep with the windows open and now my wife and I are sick.The bed was not that good.The room was very small,I understand for NYC.The staff was nice.There is tons of hotels in NYC and this would not be our choice again.
user_name:
Quest24158969236
New York City, New York

review_body: Stay at Family room even if you are only 2 people, as the standard room is too small! Property Location is superb! (Broadway, Times square) Great value for money! Highly recommended! Would stay there again. Staff is friendly. Not sure whether the hotel has food room service as we didn't need it.

Myself and my partner arrived and the check in was seamless with a very helpful and polite receptionist. We went to our room #620. Perfect size, really comfortable bed, lovely toilet and warm showers. Exceptionally clean and TV was perfect for night time when relaxing. Free water upon request. The rooms were cleaned every day and towels replaced. Hotel is in the heart of Broadway. 5 minute walk from timesquare. Unbelievable location, fantastic staff. Fun times had. Upon checking out the mind luggage for 2 dollars a bag and arrange cheap transfers from the hotel to the airport.Thanks to all the statt at the Gallivant we will be back .Kind regards Chris and Anna Ireland

I was in town for work & last minute needed to arrive an extra day. Although the room was small, it was very clean & the front desk rep, Suny, was an absolute dream. She was accommodating & fantastic!

A perfect location for visiting the Theater District. A lovely, personable front desk, and cleanly to boot. We arrived before check-in and were able to check our back at no charge. Check-in was easy and the staff was very personable. The lobby area has plenty of seating and water is provided at the front desk, so even waiting would not be uncomfortable. I would give yourself extra-time when leaving the premise, the elevator can take a while to get to your floor.

Great stay!The hotel is in a great location and the hotel was fantastic. The staff were super friendly and super helpful. Our room was spacious, warm and very very clean!The only negative about our stay was the bathroom. Although it was clean and modern the shower overflowed every time and could so with a full shower door as water gets EVERYWHERE. Other than that it was perfect and would happily stay again.

Team Member 10, location 10, Clean 10.The guest members are so nice, so gentle full that you forget for a minute that you are in NYC - friendly and kind.The only negative point is that this hotel doesn't have a refrigerator, and when you have kids this really counts.

Staying here at the moment. First impressions very nice and friendly staff. Get to our room and it’s small, compact and modern but we think it’s ok as it is NY and not much time spent in room. Location is very good. Air con unit is very dusty but not a huge problem.Went to have a shower and find that I’m aimlessly turning the handle and no water comes out. The handle is on top of the toilet tank!! Call reception to which they send a technician. He arrives and puts the handle back on.. he leaves and I try to turn the shower on. Handles falls off we eventually get it working and my partner goes for a shower.. same happens again!! We are not ones to complain but just laugh it off. Shower is powerful enough but the glass screen does not shelter enough so you basically walk into a flood/bath on the floor when coming out.Our friends staying here mention that there is a usb charging adaptor as I forgot my adaptor so I call reception and ask if it is possible to borrow one as our room did not have one. He abruptly and rudely said that not all rooms have them and this is not possible. I replied that surely as our shower handle is broken that maybe a usb plug was a small ask... he said that your shower is not broken the handle just falls off .. ok fine.... With high hopes I thought there might be a usb hole on the back of our dated tv.. no just layers and layers of dust!Just find it very bizarre that we paid the same price as our friends and our room is at least half the size!!Just wish they were more focused on making our stay more comfortable especially things that do not cost or put the hotel at a disadvantage.Would we stay here again? Probably not as not a good experience so far but will change review if our stay improves and the shower handle decides to stay on Best of luck if you stay here

We stayed at the Gallivant for 4 nights. Before arriving here I was some what apprehensive as I’d seen reviews that weren’t great. We actually had a premier room which I was completely unaware of! Haha. So that was a lovely surprise. The room was big and spacious with two bunk beds and a queen sized bed which was unbelievably comfy! Along with the normal facilities you would get in a hotel room. The bathroom was lovely too although I would suggest laying a towel down on the floor outside of the shower as it. can get quite wet as there is only one glass pane that doesn’t move. The location is amazing! I’ve been to NYC twice before but this hotel came out on top as it is so close to Times Square, you couldn’t ask for better. Subway is close too and so is a local shop along with a pub next door. So everything was literally at your doorstep. I’ve seen that people have complained about the fees that are required and I had also heard someone moaning to the receptionist about the fees too but I paid a holding fee at the start of the holiday and when we left and got back to London I was charged £91 in total for fees so I was happy with that considering from what I’d seen I thought it would be worse. Also, staff were nice too and so were the cleaners. Anyways, I liked this hotel and would happily come back here next time I come to the city. So thank you! Xo

Compact, but ok television channels restricted, Can't connect media box to TV, hey ho V.Clean, Staff efficient, Excellent Location.. Metro 2 blocks away, Hurley's Bar... next door but one, Lovely Atmosphere! Turn left out of Gallivant and left onto 8th Avenue and on ur left about 3 blocks Pizza!!It's all here just make the jump to New York.

Stayed here for 4 nights, on arrival had high hopes for a nice room seeing the nice reception area, but once in our room that quickly disappeared. Our room had marks all over the walls, dirty windows, missing draw handles, no shower curtain, wires hanging out the air conditioning, hairs and plastic in the plug from the last guests.We went to reception and asked to be changed room, no question was asked why or no apology. 2nd room wasn’t much better but after a long flight and transfer we couldn’t be bothered going back to change the 3rd time.2nd room had a safe loose on the floor that didn’t work, rang reception later in the day to fix it put new batteries in it but still never worked, had cracked sockets, dirty windows and noisy air con that randomly banged every minute, no ironing board and a bathroom you couldn’t swing a cat in. On check out no questions asked about the stay. Also seemed very sneaky about the hotel taxes, was asked if they could take my ID and credit card never said why assumed for a room deposit and then gave me a piece of paper nothing said later in the room read it and said there was a $35 a day fee on top of what we have already paid. Overall wouldn’t recommend.
user_name:
LiamP332
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: This is a great hotel. Location is excellent. Antonio on reception was really helpful. Room was clean. Towels and bed changed daily. Bed was huge. Would definitely stay here again. Check out is 12 but you can store your cases for 2 dollars each until you’re ready to go.

This hotel is in an excellent position, very close to Time Square and was real value for money considering its location. The rooms were excellent and the staff were very accommodating. I will defiantly return

Hotel location is just perfect. We could change our room to a bigger one upon availability. Standard rooms are too tiny but clean. So thank you Mr. Aziz for his help and suggestions to spend time in NY.

Stay here in feb this year , location is fantastic The hotel is basic rooms are ok , en-suite is tiny . It is a bit dated The majority of staff are courteous however some are out right rude . If you want somewhere to rest your head you’ll be ok . Some rooms are noisier than others Check whether you will have to pay urban tax on your departure. This caught out a few people I would not stay here again

This hotel was absolutely perfect. You're a 30 second walk from time square, plenty of bars and restaurants around.The hotel is right in the centre so it can be noisy but we knew that booking a city centre hotel, unlike some stupid people leaving reviews about noise.The hotel is was exactly what we wanted, clean and comfy. Staff were quick to check us in and help us with our bags, and getting us a taxi to leave. Couldn't have stayed in a better hotel for the amazing price!!!

Basic clean cheap. Small rooms coffee maker in rooms. Ideal for base and shower whilst in new york. Two resturants linked to the Hotel by doors . Nice loby and wi fi. Close to every thing. Worth a stay if u get a good price.

This is our second time staying at the Gallivant during a family vacation to NYC. The location is excellent for quick access to all things Times Square related. Last time we had a super premium room with two double beds and bunk beds. This time we have a premium room with one double bed and bunk beds. The beds have been comfortable. Coming from a small rural town, we all struggle a bit with the city noises. Some of the decor is a little dated and the room this time is much more cozy, but we are hardly in it. We do wish breakfast prices at the hotel weren’t so high, but the coffee shop across the street has quick and tasty take away.

No hot water! Free WiFi that never worked, TV & bathroom fan not working for over half our stay. Repair man totally ignored “Do Not Distrub” sign. $23 breakfast buffet with powdered eggs (yuk). Room filthy, never vacuumed in 4 days.

We stayed here at this lovely hotel for three nights. It has everything you need, you are in the heart of Times Square and close to everything. The rooms were always clean, although the room was slightly small, it was just a base for us, fresh towels every day, coffee is always refreshed (no tea unfortunately so take your own). If you want quirky places to eat just ask the reception staff who were always happy to help and recommend some hidden gems, it does have restaurants either side of the hotel and we ate in the Korean BBQ restaurant at least twice as it was lovely! There is free WiFi in the hotel which was great, please note that they do take $150 deposit on a credit card before you check in, this is kept until you check out in case of damage to the room. Also note that they charge a hotel tax of $25.00 per night per room so factor this into your spending money, this is paid at the end of the stay. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel for a short stay to NYC.
