My husband was going crazy after seeing many exposed wires hanging out throughout the room and no wall outlet plates. Whenever one of us would shower, the water would flood the bathroom. (They did fix this). Also, when one of us showered, there would suddenly be dozens of bugs flying around us and climbing on the walls. The housekeeping staff said it is normal. The bugs come up from the drain. Throughout our room, there was peeling paint, wall holes, wall knicks, broken blinds, and some of our windows did not open correctly. Also, there was missing floor in some areas and in others, the flooring was overlapping one another. We had broken and/or missing baseboards as well. Ok. Ignoring all of the esthetics, it just got worse. We could not even relax to watch TV. The TV does not swivel--it faces the broken desk. To watch the TV, you must sit in the "one" old, uncomfortable, breaking desk chair. If more than one person wanted to watch TV, we had to take turns sitting in the "one" old, uncomfortable, breaking desk chair. Mind you, we had a Family Room for 5 people. To have to share a chair with 5 people is plain ignorance on the hotel's part. We paid for a large room with 3 beds; yet we could not watch TV at the end of the night and we are paying about $600 a night. This is one of the stupidest decisions I have ever made in my life with regard to wasting money. Because our stay was during the holidays, we were held hostage. There was no where for us to go. It was extremely maddening. We had children. There was no way for us to avoid our room and stay out all night. Also, after 6 hours of walking around every day, we wanted to relax and watch TV as well. How the hell to do this when the TV faces the east wall and our beds are on the north and south walls? Remember, the TV does not swivel. The thought that went into this "boutique" hotel were extremely trivial and uneducated. I recommend staying at a chain hotel so that there are standards that must be met or the staff is held accountable.

Stayed at the Gallivant in between Christmas and New Year’s so location was very busy! Lovely welcoming hotel and staff nice modern decor, room very clean and comfortable and attractive, bed and linen very comfortable, shower great although sometimes did take good 5 mins to warm up once we realised this was ok. Lovely soft clean towels, didn’t use coffee machine would have been nice to have had provision of tea bags as we don’t drink coffee. Great provision of travel adapter we actually went out and bought one before we realised! We were on the fourth floor in a deluxe room we didn’t feel it was small, just right was on main road was a bit noisy but it’s New York people and round the corner from a fire station it didn’t particularly bother us we were too busy out having fun and shattered when we got in, husband complained about the noise of the AC but he always does and I need it on so that’s not a criticism whatsoever.Helpful staff especially Antonio on the desk I asked him if he could recommend a steakhouse which he did and took into account budget and he actually booked a reservation for us and advised on taxis and cost and we had a fabulous evening at Jacks Steakhouse as a result thank you :-)Handiness of the Irish bar next door was great for us as a nice base to come back to and we ate here on the last night and the food was nice and plentiful although disagree with putting 20% service charge on EVERYTHING.Location of hotel is perfect for exploring New York we had a great experience would definitely recommend to others. Our friends had the penthouse suite with a balcony overlooking the road which was wow factor but we preferred being lower down so could go up and down stairs and didn’t have to rely on lifts although there were 3 of them and pretty quick but our friends felt they had to wait a while to get up and down.One tiny gripe we had to pay residents tax outgoing whilst our Expedia reservation said included all taxes and surcharges and this was taken from our credit card, I would have preferred to have been told that, the cost and the option of paying cash when we checked out instead.Liked the lemon water provided on the desk and the provision of ice machine on our floor and the noon checkout was also great thank you for a lovely stay

We stayed at the gallivant 9-14th December. On arrival the male receptionist was welcoming and told us we could have an upgrade to a twin room if we would like to wait 10 minutes in reception ..true to his word he called us and gave us a lovely room on the 6th floor..everything was exactly what we wanted and the room was spacious and clean, housekeeping every day, clean towels, beds made nice to come back to after a long day out exploring NYC...this was our 2nd visit this year to the gallivant and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend to others..thanks to everyone there for another amazing stay

Staying at The Gallivant Times Square was perfect in every way! My husband is an hotelier and he thought it was the perfect place for us to stay. Perfect location, right in the heart of NYC Theater district with much to see in walking distance and easy access to public transport to all parts of the city; perfect rooms and suites (several that can accommodate families); two great restaurants (one Chinese/Korean; other Japanese/Thai) on site; and other accouterments like free WiFi, business center, etc. As a New Yorker, I also appreciate that it’s extremely reasonably priced for the Big Apple. Give yourself a special treat and choose one of their penthouse suites complete with balcony overlooking the city, especially as the cost for that grand luxury will be comparable to much less spacious or gracious hotel rooms in NYC.

Family rooms were spacious. Bathrooms upgraded. Beds super comfortable. HotelClose to everything in Times Square. Handy to have the 12pm check out & the option to leave the suitcases for the day of check out.

Honestly, I was having a great time until the way I was treated at my check out. After spending 10 minutes in line for assistance, the receptionist was totally disrespectful and dishonest with me. I asked for help because I had a reservation with airlink NYC, and since the streets around was closed because new years eve, I needed to know my new pick up point. so I asked the receptionist to call them for me and he just said “I can’t do it, can’t you see the line of people waiting to be assisted?”, I was outrageous since I waited in line FOR TEN MINUTES BEFORE MY TURN. So I tried to explain to him that I had only 5 more minutes before the shuttles departure time, and he just said that after check out, the guest is not the hotels problem anymore and yelled “next guest”, totally left me out talking by myself, I felt embarrassed, mistreated, it was horrible! So I asked him to call the manager, he did. The manager came, and apparently tried to help, but did nothing with the receptionist who humiliated me in front of everybody at the lobby. At the end, who helped my boyfriend and I, was the guy (asian) who kept our luggage. He helped us to figure out and call to the shuttle company. Shame on you, Gallivant! You should traine better your staff. I will never stay with you again, nor the people I know in Brazil and trust me I know millions of people back in my country. I’m gonna use my social media to let everyone know the way you treat your guests after check out, like the guy said “after check out, it is not the hotel problem anymore”!

Changed just once the sheets after several times that we asked to change them (they told us that they must change them once per day but never happened). Fantastic positions (close to Times Square) but no noises.

Hotel has amazing entrance hall with reception. Room modern and cozy. All hotel clean. Really close to Times square, to subway. The staff very friendly. I recommend to stay there, if you can be in center NY.Thank you.

Our room was more spacious than we expected for such a central location. It was modern, very clean and we felt really comfortable staying there. Our room was on the 11th floor and at the back of the building, so noise from the street wasn’t an issue. The location was brilliant, close to Times Square and right on the edge of Hell’s Kitchen with access to lots of bars and restaurants. The staff were all really friendly, and check in and check out we’re done quickly.

Myself and my partner stayed for 4 nights in a deluxe queen room, room was adequate size for rooms as New York go. Bathroom was very small but walk in shower was nice. Luckily we were on the 3rd floor as the lifts were extremely slow and one was broken. What let’s this hotel down is the staff, not very welcoming and hardly ever smile especially the luggage attendant. The friendliest face was the housekeeper who always greeted you with a smile in the mornings. Taxes in total £91 for 4 nights so take this into consideration when booking. Overall the hotel location is perfect for Times Square and a comfortable stay, but could probably get a nicer hotel for your money.

Yes it was affordable but keep in mind they tack on a daily service charge. Rooms are very small, as is the bathroom. When I walked in the room it must have been 85 degrees. I couldnt tuen the heat down but rather I had to put on the air conditioning. The toilet clogged right away and I had to wait for maintenance. The elevator is ridiculously slow and it stopped at every floor although it was full. Housekeeping woke up my daughter at 8 am. The only positive..its close to everything. I emailed the hotel to share my grievances, but no one even responded. Poor customer service...

Great location being right on time square, but a very disappointing hotel. 1. Dirty and run down! Reception is nice but hallways are dark and the rooms are tatty and lack cleanliness. 2. Very dated and the air-con unit was extremely noisy.3. Heating didn't work.4. Took a holding amount for damages (understandable) but a week after leaving am still waiting for transaction to be cancelled5. Charge £29 per day for wifi and use of the gym (who wants a gym when you are visiting New York on holiday!). They do not tell you of this charge, but instead just take monies from your card (provided for potential damages) unauthorised. Would not stay here again.

Really really really bad wifi.Ventilator makes lot of noise.Everything is aged and broken.Radiator makes noise while being off.After using shampoo you dont get a refill.And the bed was broken and to small.We had a deluxe room. But is was really small to.

The rooms were nicely appointed and large enough for families. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. Located in the heart of the theatre district which was very convenient. Would recommend to friends and relatives.

It’s in a great location. The room was small but it was cleaned every day . No bar in the hotel but plenty near by . Friendly and helpful staff we would stay there again . The bed was really comfy slept well . Coffee maker in the room. We did enjoy the food in the Chinese restaurant next door

I thought that the room in this hotel was nice however the service wasn’t the best. Upon check in we didn’t receive our bottles of water so we called down to front to see if we can have them delivered and the guy at the front desk got mad at me and said he was the only one working and if I wanted waters to come down and get them... so I did and when I came down there were three people working in lobby alone. We tried to get a shuttle to airport with hotel and they said it was booked up and we ended up paying a taxi to take us. They were nice and held our bags for us after checkout so we could walk around the city and go to theater before our flight left which was great. It’s in good walking distance to theater and many restaurants and shopping.

The room needs some maintainance on the walls and ceilings. It is very noisy, you can hear everything from outside your room. They might consider on hiring friendly staff. The room was very clean. The view was terrible.

Our hotel room was very small and nothing like the pictures advertised, our view was a brick wall and we could hear every single noise comming from outside so we had a maximum of 4 hours sleep a night. One elevator did not work for the whole trip so me and my partner often had to walk up all 13 floors quite often, not so bad for us but I felt deeply for sorry for those who were not so able to climb hat many stairs.The staff were however very friendly and polite but the hotel itself does not live up to what it promises.

We stayed at the Gallivant between the 14th & 18th December and I can honestly say we were extremely happy with everything. On arrival, we were greeted by a beautifully festively decorated & presented lobby. This was then followed by welcoming and friendly hotel staff. We were told on arrival that we had been upgraded which was lovely. We then went up to our room which was on the 9th floor. It was very clean and tidy and much better than most of the reviews I have read. It was also a good size given that you are in New York! I have seen a number of reviews complaining about the lifts, however, we didn’t experience any issues. There was the one morning they were busy but the stairs were easily accessible and it didn’t take longer than a couple of minutes to get down to the lobby. We were very busy on our trip so we didn’t get much time to eat at the hotel, but the restaurant on the side was great to pop in to and have a quick beer and nibble before venturing out for the evening. When it came to the departure, we had to leave the hotel at 4:30am and I was a bit concerned we would struggle to sort getting to the airport and finding a cab. The gentleman on reception that morning was extremely helpful, and called us a cab which arrived straight to our front door. It was really smart and reasonably priced too. The receptionist really did help to make things a lot less stressful that morning, so thank you. The location of this hotel is perfect! Broadway and Times Square are easy to get to within minutes, it was so easy to find somewhere to get dinner in the evening. Apart from the airport runs, we only used one taxi whilst we stayed here and that was to get to the piers - we walked the rest.So take the negative reviews with a pinch of salt, we had a truly magical time in New York and the Gallivant definitely contributed to this.Thank you :-)

The hotel is rundown. The pictures of the room did not reflect the room allocated. The furniture in room is battered and chipped. The air conditioning is noisy and cannot be used at bed time, while the ambient temperature in the room is extremely high with the radiators off. The only fix is to sleep with the window / door wide open and enduring the noise from the street. There is no kettle for tea or fridge in the room. There are too few lifts for the staff and guests having to share meaning you can be waiting for up to 10 minutes to get a lift to exit the building. Water is only available on the 4th or 7th floor from the ice dispenser, compounding the hot room and lift issues. The wifi wasnt especially fast, and in addition, the business centre that attracts a resort fee doesn't even have a colour printer, and was co-located in a busy noisy reception. It's 2018. There are much better places to stay in NYC.

I booked a 2 night stay in the Gallivant Times Square because it is located directly across the street from the Walter Kerr Theater and I was attending the Springsteen on Broadway show. The room was small but comfortable and charming. The bathroom was updated. My only complaint was the vanity was tiny with no where to set anything. But this was not a big deal. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were soft. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and I enjoyed the charm of this hotel. Location was perfect! I will definitely stay here again.

Prior to travelling I was very apprehensive by some of the reviews in regards to The Gallivant, I found the hotel in a great location just off Broadway, a 2 minute walk to Times Square.I had booked a queen room however the room I was allocated only had a normal double bed located on the third floor however I was so happy with the room, décor and cleanliness I never bother complaining, the room was big enough and not cramped at all.The lifts can be buys however with some patience you will get to your floor.I found the staff charming and the maid certainly left our roomin a good condition every day.For anyone being out off by previous comments I would say give the hotel a go, you will not be disappointed.

Five family members and stayed in the "family" room. It was very spacious and we had plenty of room. the bathroom was gigantic. Not like many NYC hotels I've stayed in before. The Lobby was well equipped and the staff were all very kind and accommodating.

We visited this hotel in February 2018 on a last minute trip. The price was almost too good to be true and so we didn't expect much. We travelled to this hotel via subway from JFK (well, you have to take an air train out of the airport first) I think we paid $5 for the journey. It took approximately an hour to get to the hotel this way as you have to change once or twice, but it wasn't too difficult as we didn't have much luggage and the walk from the subway was little over 5 minutes. The hotel itself is very close to Times Square, again, little over a 3-5 minute walk. The view wasn't fantastic, I think we just about caught the side of M&M world, but then, you get what you pay for. The room was a little on the small side, but adequately supplied. We did find that the door caught on the floor when you tried to shut it, and the shower rattled, so we got the overall idea that it was a bit cheap, but then...so was the price. We didn't particularly like that the duvets on the beds didn't have a cover, but they were merely sandwiched between two sheets. This might just be an American thing, but we didn't like it. The rooms, however, were modern and there was very little street noise. Most places were within walking distance of this hotel, with the Empire State taking less than 15 minutes (although we are quick walkers) It was also surrounded by subway stations that led to anywhere that may have taken slightly longer. We didn't have much interaction with staff. We weren't greeted at the hotel, but the man at the check-in desk was pleasant enough. The Wi-Fi is also very good. Overall, we would definitely stay here again. Pros: distance to everything, street noise, modern.Cons: bad bedding, small rooms

Hotel location is very good. And I was checked in early. Hotel room / bathroom are clean and comfortable except the left side of the bed. The left side of the bed springs were as if they were not there! (the bed sinks all the way without resistance). Reported that to the gentleman at the reception and he did not give it much attention! Again I repeated the same observation the next day when I checked out (I stayed for one night) with a remark "the mattress is in a bad shape and should not be used anymore" and the lady at the reception did apologize and said that she will see that it is taken care of.The elevator gets very busy during peak time. I had to use the stairs to bring down my luggage (four floors) the time I checked out!

This is a decent enough hotel in a good part of the city with access to several theatres. The staff was fine. But at checkout we got hit with a $25 PER DAY urban fee. For WHAT?!!? The room was plain. Bathroom was really small. No frills. It really would’ve been fine, but the urban fee is ridiculous. We booked a room there for our adult daughters and we were at another nearby hotel. Our hotel was nicer, only one block away from the Gallivant, and did NOT charge an urban fee. A pretty BS charge to throw on at the end of the stay.
user_name:
Pixycon
Wisconsin Rapids, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: Excellent location , rooms are small , ideal for a single person , my room clean , quiet and warm , others had noisy and cold rooms . Had issues getting a hot shower as the water was cold , eventually it warmed up but took 20mins.Luckily we stayed on the 2nd floor which helped as one of the lifts broke and had people queuing to go up.I had a good stay but others didn't .

We spent our trip plunging a toilet that clogged up every time we used it. Upon arrival while checking in the front desk clerk was Not courteous or personable at all it made me want to check out but I figured hey it’s not that expensive and I don’t have have to deal with the front but boy was I wrong smh. I would not recommend nor return.

This hotel was a wonderful experience and I will absolutely return here. Perfectly located in Times Square near the M&m store which was perfect for us. I came with a family of 6 and we stayed in the family suite which contained a set of bunk beds and 2 double beds. Super comfortable and beds!! Room was very clean and modern looking too. I have no complaints whatsoever. Parking conveniently located across the street too!!!

Family Christmas trip was very successful in regards to proximity of hotel and all area sights. I would stay here again as everyone made the stay very enjoyable. Clean room, towels bedding and warm room on a very cold night.

The hotel has good service. the rooms are a little on the small side the WiFi is not Free it's faults advertised... on the 7th floor is terrible only get about 4 MB up and 4 MB down and as for the city tax that's a big con @ $100 - £78 GBP for the use of computer's printers and rubbish broadband this is the reason for the 3 star's The rooms are pretty clean sheets are changed on a daily basis. The room given to my sister was a double not a queen size bed No fridges in the rooms jsut a water and ice ❄ machine

Exactly what you need, a bed shower, toilet and tea coffee facilities. Check in was quick the lady on reception was very polite and cheerful. Room was cleaned daily with fresh towels. Couldn’t ask for a better location Chinese restaurant on one side Japanese on the other, Irish bar close by and Times Square at the end of the road, amazing place. Great holiday

First impressions of the Foyer were very impressive. Staff friendly and helpful, albeit a taxi was arranged to Newark airport instead of JFK which we didn't discover until we were on the way to the airport! The first room we we're given had not been cleaned so we were moved to another. This was much smaller than the original one. The heating was hit and miss, either freezing or red hot. In the seven days that we stayed I had one hot shower. Wouldn't stay there again.

My wife and I came to this hotel for her birthday getaway,when we arrived the staff were friendly and being near Christmas it looked and felt Christmassy ,the room was nice and clean .as it’s located write in the theatre district it was only a short walk ,to all the famous spots the Rockefeller centre,Times Square,and a short walk to the theatre where we watched a show,I would recommend this hotel if you want to be near everything.the only thing I have to say was the scaffolding in front of our window but apart from that everything was very good.

Fantastic Location, Wonderful Hotel, Friendly approachable staff. When you choose to stay in the Gallivant you are truly staying in the heart of the City that Never Sleeps. We Loved The Gallivant, if you truly want to experience NewYork this is the hotel for you Springsteen was playing opposite and he had a lock in right next door to the Gallivant. Enjoy and book ASAP x

We were very impressed with this hotel. The lobby is inviting we often hung out listening to the music and enjoying the ambiance. The rooms are small but comfortable. The hotel is in a perfect area... you can walk to any site in NY we walked everywhere... it’s about a block from Time Square we are hoping to stay here again during our next trip... although it is a little pricey but everything is pricey in NY

Just got back from our trip to New York and staying in the gallivant. We weren’t sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews in here, but we couldn’t fault this hotel at all. We arrived a day late due to our flight getting cancelled. Our airline told us they would inform the hotel about our late arrival as we booked it as a package, but they failed to do this. Therefore the hotel had us down as a no show. The manager was very helpful and understanding with us and got us a room straight away. The rooms weren’t the biggest, but that wasn’t a concern for all the time we would actually be spending in the room. The place was very clean and the staff were very friendly. The hotel is in a great location, short walk to everywhere. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would happily stay here again.

We stayed there for 4 nights the staff were very friendly it’s in a great location for all attractions good size room nice balcony with great view good value for money Tea making facilities would be good in the room.

Elevators did not work most of the stay and the staff would hold one elevator for their own use and not release for guests. You were left waiting > 30 minutes or walking up and down many flights of stairs. The hotel is also located close to a fire station and they come and go all night so be aware of this as well. People in the lobby were frustrated because they couldn't check in because rooms were not clean on times and therefore people were waiting all over the lobby.
user_name:
Traci K L
Fort Worth, Texas

review_body: Our stay at the Gallavent in New York was excellent to say the least . The staff at the desk when we arrived was very helpful . The room could have been a bit more modern . But not a issue . The hotel was situated right next to Times Square , walking distance to most places . If you want a trip to New York the Gallavent hotel is the place to stop .

We booked a double bed, they gave us a one bed and bunk bed.Hotel desk clerk who took us for check in not really friendly.Water of the shower cold, for taking an elevator you have to wait a lot of time.Someone stole a new iphone charger wireless bought 2 days before.The only good things is the position.I will never stay in this hotel again!

A warm but very basic 10th floor room. The sink was slow to empty & the shower was slow to heat up. The main problem here are the lifts! One out of 3 working ! Sometimes the second lift worked but it is so tiny it was usually full!

This is by far the worst hotel experience in all the times i have been in New York. Our circumstances changed and we had to find a hotel for 1 night. The man who checked us in was extremely rude and proceeded to imitate my accent. he then threw our room keys at us. Our room was in a corner on the 3rd floor at the end of a dingy corridor. The room was beyond small even by New York standards. The aircon unit at one side of the bed was so large that it wasn't possible to walk around the bed so my husband had to climb in and out the bottom of the bed. There was a wardrobe at the other side which faced the bed and I had to walk sideways to get in and out. the bathroom was so small that we had to walk into it sideways. Also there was nowhere to out our luggage. the room was badly in need of decoration and repair. the bed itself was smaller than a double but the only positive I can find is that the sheets were clean. Will never stay here again

Very disappointed and unsatisfied · We didn't have a good time at the Gallivant Hotel. Out of 3 lifts, only one were working. Our room was on the 6th floor, we needed to take the stairs every time. I have never experienced so many noises in my life. Because everyone was using the stairs, every 10 min, someone slams the door for the stairway. U was very upset, We stayed 2 days and we couldn't even sleep. On arrival the door man didn't even helped with our bags. We had to pay an extra dollars just to use the airport shuttle? And we had to Pay 2 dollars per bag at check out. . . This was the worst experience ever! We are very disappointed in this place!

This hotel is in a great location very close to Times Square and the theatres of Broadway.The rooms were clean and warm. There were issues with the lifts and one morning there was no hot water but this was soon rectified.The WiFi was a bit hit and miss but at least it was free. We had no issues with charges but absolutely excellent customer service from the bellboy. When we left our cases he asked about a taxi to the airport which we booked through him. We returned to the hotel 30 minutes early for the taxi to be told it was waiting for us and for the same cost and without requesting it we got an enormous limousine- total luxury!

This is by far the worst hotel I ever stayed in. The only plus point is the location on 48th street.The rooms are small and dirty.The lifts constantly broke down and if you didn’t fancy a walk up to the 13th floor the wait for the one operating lift could be 30 - 45mins depending on the time of day.As for the staff. Just two words unhelpfully rude.The public toilets were atrocious and dirtyNeed I go onIf you are going to stay in New York stay anywhere but here.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. To which on arrival has a $50 per night charge hold on my card, at departure the man at the desk said that this will be put straight back into my account. Checking my bank a couple days later £70.40 has been taken from my account from the hotel with no reason why or no receipt to the break down of charges. The reception to the hotel looks lovely but when going into the rooms they are dull, very small and you can hear all outside noises. The showers do not warm up until 8.30am, the toilet door didn’t shut properly, the wardrobe door would close and then get stuck so had trouble getting things out of their. The lifts are so small that they get crowded and you have to wait a long time to even get in them. It wasn’t a problem walking down from the 10th floor but when you have been out in NYC for the day it isn’t ideal to have to walk up the stairs too the 10th floor. The location of the hotel was very close to everything and this I couldn’t fault however everything else about the hotel made it a disappointment. The images on the website makes the hotel look very grand and nice when in fact it isn’t the case. I am waiting for a reply back to my email to get a justification to why the money has been taken out of my bank as there was no explanation given to why any extra charges could be made. I believe this should have been communicated when checking in or at least been put on the info paper that was given. Very disappointed... and wouldn’t recommend staying here.

I have stayed at The Gallivant before, and there is a reason I continue to come back. The staff is always very helpful and accommodating. They want to ensure you have a wonderful trip and stay in their lovely city, even recommending fantastic restaurants in the surrounding area. The rooms are clean, modern, and very comfortable. I will continue staying here when I am in the city due to the wonderful treatment I always receive here. Antonio always goes above and beyond. Thank you for always providing a safe and pleasant stay in the city!
user_name:
Tiffany K
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Not at all pleased with my stay and even more now I’ve come home. When checking in I asked the lady multiple times about extra charges (I come to New York at least twice a year so I’m well aware of urban fees) I was told no and made to feel inadequate for even asking about the 200 hold charge for smoking. Hotel stay was ok could’ve been abit better. When checking out of the hotel I was handed a bill of fees which came to 114$ And when I’ve now checked my bank statement it’s come up to 157pounds which just isn’t what I was quoted on the bill. This was not the only problem I encountered, due to suffering anxiety I booked a private shuttle to the airport to save waking up early and having to hail a taxi. We paid 75 dollars and booked for 6am. Came to the day of leaving at 6:10 and I asked if it was sent and the bell man said this is New York leave it 15 more minutes after I waited it still didn’t turn up I went to the front desk and the man contacted to company said they hadn’t sent it yet so then I’m panicked as are flight is getting closer so In the end the man at the desk hailed us a New York taxi which cost 58 dollars so we ended up loosing out of money and unwanted stress. Not very happy wouldn’t recommend.

Booked through BA so expected the same customer care however was really disappointed. Rude and unhelpful staff, key cards that don’t work, broken lift and a bathroom you couldn’t shut the door to when using. And additional charges for nothing Don’t use this place

Great location. Rooms are basic but clean. Ours had an interconnected door which was annoying as the neighbours were loud and the room was relatively small compared to others we've stayed in in NYC for similar price. Staff were friendly enough tho.

The hotel is in a great location, but the front of house staff are rude and have bad attitudes not helpful at all . The hotel is in need of a renovation which is long over due, the elavators are out of service a lot on our stay and very long waits for them.i was also charged a urban tax for our stay there, which we was not informed about this upon check in, I felt robbed about this it’s not worth the money to stay there.

The room was so small.The bsthroom was so small.I couldn’t manage the temperature of the room.The receptionist was so cold with me.In my Booking reservation I kindly asked for the highest floor possible... and they gave me a 6th floor....So the only thing I have appreciated ... was the position of your hotel...Sorry but I paid around 250 dollars per night ... for an hostel accomodation...Last thing: the picture of the room (showed during the Booking process) ...was different.So I’m Completely NOT SATISFIED

The hotel.was ideal. In a brilliant location with access and views to all top attractions. Only downside was the lifts. Only one lift working which only took 7 people. Any more and it broke down....which it did twice out of 5days. Seriously needs upgraded. But a great value hotel. Clean and friendly.

To put this into perspective, we're an older couple who come to Times Square 1-2 times per year for extended stays of 1-3 weeks. We have stayed in many of the moderate-priced hotels in the immediate 4-5 blocks of the Gallivant. The Gallivant's location is superb! The beds are very comfortable and things are reasonably clean without being spotless. That said, you must understand that the Gallivant is a converted old welfare hotel with rather dingy hallways, and doors that slam when being shut. This hotel currently seems to cater to large tourist groups, so be prepared to pick your way through a lobby filled with milling people from tour groups and littered in every corner with huge suitcases tied together. The 3 elevators are often slow or in use at the top part of the building. We stayed in 309, and it often was more convenient to walk down. Specific to 309: the view was of the "tenement" side of the next door building, but it was delightful to be on the quiet side of the building rather than the noisy street side. If we stay here in the future, I would probably request a room further away from elevators and the morning housekeeping racket. All in all, our stay was pleasant enough, and definitely beautifully located. While I think the price was outrageous for this level of hotel, I also have to admit that I learned the hard way to never come to NYC the first week in December. The crowds of tourists willing to pay top dollar for everything are horrific!

I have just left this hotel after four nights.Absolutely brilliant location. It’s a one minute walk from all the lights at Times Square, and central to everything you would like to see in New York. Staff were really helpful, especially Cassandra who went out of her way to give us written directions for one of our tours downtown. The room was really comfortable, small but you’re not their to stay in the room all the time. Now for the bad. I paid extra for breakfast, but unfortunately I ended up eating out every day, the first day was because we had an early tour and breakfast was served until 0700. The other days were because it’s a continental, that’s probably partly my fault as I never read that properly, but I wish I had never paid for the breakfast at all. There was one particular day our room wasn’t cleaned and we had to locate our own towels and take our litter out. There is three lifts in the hotel, and at least two of the days there was only one working lift with queues of people waiting for them, leaving us to walk a couple of times, the day we checked out the lifts were down and we waited for about 20 mins to finally get one down. Lastly, there is an additional charge on top of what you have already paid, I believe it’s about $25 a day. I did know about this, but only because I had done some digging. That being said, I think most hotels in the city charge the same charge. I did have a fantastic holiday and apart from the lift and breakfast, the hotel is good.

Arrived today - currently waiting (2 hours now) for someone to change our bedsheets as they are covered in someone else’s hairs, makeup, and dribble on the pillows, absolute disgrace. And still no maid. You can see from the pictures - we just lifted the sheets off to get in bed after travelling all day and it is pure filth, completely unhygienic and the rooms are unbelievably small. Extremely disappointed- there is also a massive dip on the bed you can see clearly on the last photo - the mattress is worn and old and springs sticking in our backs. You can also see the stains on the mattress.Take a good look before booking this hotel! We are gutted

No interest. At the same price we can find better hotels and better rooms.Small rooms, impossible to open doors completly. Lift often failed. Necessary to wait 30 minutes to go down. House keeping shout in the hallway even early in the morning.When i arrved, the lady at the lobby did not say hello

Just back from our stay in the Gallivant Hotel, great location on the foot of Times Square, room was cleaned every day and staff were friendly, rooms are small but that’s NYC. I emailed the hotel a special request before we arrived and they were very accommodating. We had our breakfast in the Chinese next to the hotel which was buffet breakfast which filled us for the day ahead & they do combi offers if you pre-book several breakfasts with them & is only done directly with the restaurant. We also ate in Hurleys restaurant next to the hotel aging was good value & food was nice too. Overall great stay & would go back.

Stayed here for 5 nights as part of a multi centre trip for our honeymoon at end of November - the main good point about this hotel is it’s location, it’s really close to Times Square and only one block away from a subway stop so you can get anywhere you want with ease. The hotel staff at the desk were really polite, helpful and friendly too even making us coffee while we waited for a taxi when we checked out. Lots of reviews saying hotel was noisy - I personally didn’t find this an issue woken a few times by sirens but you will get this anywhere if you want to stay in the city centre.Not so good points- As mentioned WiFi is really poor-things like this wouldn’t normally bother me but as from England we didn’t have data so it was a bit problematic not being able to plan routes ect in the room before leaving the hotel.we were ‘upgraded’ as we mentioned it was our honeymoon our room was extremely small with barley any room to walk around so not sure what our original room would have been like! practically had to walk side ways around the bottom of the bed to get to the far side! No where to store bags and cases. The temperature of the room was also extremely hot, the shower room also really badly designed and the whole room was constantly soaked when the shower was used. That being said all you really need is a base when your in New York and the bed was comfy enough so I would stay here again if I got a good deal, if you plan on spending long periods of time in the hotel I probably wouldn’t recommend this hotel
user_name:
sasac-1412
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We didn't have a good time at the Gallivant Hotel. Out of 3 lifts, only one were working. Our room was on the 6th floor, we needed to take the stairs every time. I have never experienced so many noises in my life. Because everyone in using the stairs, every 10min, someone slams the door for the stairway. U was very upset, We stayed 2days and we couldn't even sleep. On arrival the door man didn't even helped with our bags. We had to pay an extra 55Dollars just to use the airport shuttle? And we had to Pay 2dollars per bag at check out. . . This was the worst experience ever! We are very disappointed in this place!

Stayed at the Gallivant 1st week in december. Where it is situated is ideal fro everything. Short walking distance to nearly all attractions. We had a great room on the 13th floor, very quiet. We were given a family room with loads of room. Shower was always hot. Staff were pleasant but didnt need to botherthem from checking in to checking out. Computer area with printer to print boarding passes for homeward trip.Definitely go back.

We are used to not the most 5 star amenities in Hotels, we live in an urban city as well (Miami) and used to small spaces, so the rooms themselves were not inside but be careful. We book the Standard room and it brings a full size bed which is just a bit small for couples. The room has ants and it has water flies in the shower. Less then sanitary, to say the least. Again, back home, humidity is the cause for shower flies. I would not stay here with a child and definitely would not stay with a family.The only real positive on this hotel is the location. You are a block away from Time Square. I have learned and continue to learn that we have to stay in Chain hotels which seem to have better rooms and amenities.The sad part is I went to front desk every day to move to at least two twin beds so my husband and I can sleep better and they kept telling me they were fully booked but booking.com says otherwise....On a different note, nothing to do with hotels, use taxi service instead of uber and lyft. They always have an issue to get to you and slow, honestly more expensive then taxi too.

If you love small spaces and paying a ridiculous amount to stay in them then this place is for you. I booked one night for nearly $400 in a room the size of a closet. Now I understand that it’s NYC and they were all booked up, but charging that much for what little I got is next to robbery. And just when I thought the room was to small to possibly share, I noticed that ants were also hanging out with me on the floor. Luckily it was only ants because no other sized animals could fit in this closet of a “room.”

overall good structure located in a strategic point of the city a few steps from times square. Friendly and helpful staff. thanks to its position you can get in a short time, even on foot, to visit the attractions of the city. however, the structure is worth the price of the stay. having not eaten breakfast, I can not judge.

My friend and I stayed in The Gallivant for 5 nights. We requested a twin room and received an email confirming this from the hotel itself however were given a small double. The hotel dismissed me (politely) asking to change rooms despite me showing the email. We were told we’d have to wait two days for another room to become available. The whole time we were dealt with rudely by the reception staff with one woman exclaiming ‘do what I tell you’ when I asked what we had to do with our cases to switch rooms. The foyer is lovely upon arrival however you soon discover the rooms are not reflective of that. They are small, which is understandable given the location, however I have stayed in other 3* hotels in Times Sq. and The Gallivant has some of the smallest rooms I have seen. Perhaps most disconcerting, though, is the dustiness and general dirtiness of the bedrooms. Both rooms we inhabited were disgusting in terms of dust under the bed, grime and the state of the air conditioning unit. Both my friend and I suffer from asthma and we were both ill the entire duration; something that other guests have also commented on which does not surprise me as the air unit looked ancient and the room constantly had a weird dustiness to the air. There are also too few lifts for the number of guests - we waited over 15 minutes for one one day as they only allow 7 people in each lift and there are just two for the whole hotel. In all, I would not recommend staying here unless location is absolutely paramount.

After reading the reviews on here i was very worried about staying here. I have just returned from a 4 night stay and i have to say i was pleasantly surprised. The lobby is small and can get a bit over crowed at times but this is not an issue as i wasn't there to sit in the lobby. Our room was an average size, clean, warm and the bed was comfy!!! If you are going to New York to stay in your hotel room then this hotel may not be for you as its not 5 star but if you want a comfy room to lay your head after a busy day then this is the place as the location is unbelievable with a 2 minute walk to time square. I highly recommend The Gallivant and will be returning in the future.

We had 2 rooms at the Gallivant Times SquareRooms- 1 king room and 1 with 2 double bedsThe rooms were small, no fridge no hair dryer. Beds were comfortable though. Decor was tasteful. AC did not work in room 1428- which made the room 80 degrees all night- very uncomfortable. Lobby/front desk-nice staffThe lobby was overheated and overcrowded. 2 skinny elevators are inadequate for 15 floors. I think there must’ve been a front desk issue on Dec 7- unhappy people and luggage filled the entire lobby for the entire day. We did not have front desk issues, but it seemed that was not the case for most people, most People could not get into their rooms well after check in time and some got there early. The lounge/computer area looked like it was roped off with chairs still up? There was water available in a dispenser with ice but no cups. The ice machines were broken on most floors, only 4th floor worked. Location-1 block to Times Square- very convenient to everything. Bars/restaurants right next door. Parking- Ritz Icon parking garage directly across the street- $45 per day if you got your ticket stamped. We had no problems parking, but others were lined up the street blowing horns on our checkout day, so not sure what was going on with that, other than it was Saturday? So maybe we were lucky checking in on a Friday and getting out early on Sat? Anyway, for the high price, I would not recommend staying at the Gallivant.

My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel, and absolutely loved it. Our deluxe Queen room on the 5th floor was perfect for us and our stay. Excellent location, literally just around the corner from Times Square, spacious enough room, and a huge comfortable bed. Air con/heater in our room was great and well used as was the fridge. The room contained so much more than we were expecting, and we heard no noise from outside at all. Maid service was great too with fresh bedding and towels every day. Every member of staff that we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. If we are lucky enough to return to NYC, we would definitely stay here again. The beautiful Christmas decorations in the lobby, made it even more perfect!Show less

OK so here’s the deal . Motel eight is a better hotel than this place! It’s dirty rooms are very very small the elevators weren’t working, The Internet was not working, this place is a complete dive . And for 400 bucks per night?? This place does put you close to time square if you like the madness but the cost just is not good! Now they’re really good quality hotels in the area or twice as much is this place! Your choice BUT don’t expect a fancy hotel at all it’s simply a place to sleep.....

So my girlfriend and I did a deal with British Airways to NYC for our 3rd anniversary. We found this hotel and thought it looked smart and booked it. When we arrived, we were given our key and went to our room where we were not impressed with the size and appearance of the room. First thing was the size as it was very tiny for a couple to stay in and manoeuvre around the bed. Next was the large balcony door that was opposite the bed with a large frosted window that let in too much light. Not to mention that there used to be a blind but looked to be torn off or removed so we were woken up at the early hours by the light. Another thins to note is that this hotel sits on the same road as a fire station, so in the early hours of the night you will get woken up by fire engines. We should have been told about this upon arrival so that this was something to bare in mind. The breakfast in the hotel was mediocre, just a bit over priced for what it was in the hotel when you can go down the street to another place for cheaper and a bigger selection. The location, you can’t fault it. Around the corner from Times Square, the gray line bus tours and walking distance to other attractions. Lastly, I was asked to put a $125 deposit down for the room in case of anything had happened to the room. We left the room tidy and everything to a standard for the cleaners to come and change the sheets etc. I was promised that I would be getting a deposit back in 3-5 days. It has been well over a week, and I haven’t had a single word from the hotel, and no sign of that money. Even contacting them via the website is bad as you will not get a response. Not even a reply from Facebook.Wouldn’t recommend this hotel to be honest.

We have just returned from a four night stay. This was my first time in New York, I stayed with my friend to celebrate us turning 30! The location was brilliant, really close to Times Square and Rockefeller Centre etc and the lobby was lovely and Christmassy! The check in was really quick and the staff friendly but it took a while to get up to the room as the lifts seem to stop on every floor and are really small. The room was compact but we were out most of the day so it wasn’t a problem. The bathroom was lovely, great shower. And there is coffee in the room, TV and hairdryer etc. Our room seemed really clean and we came back to it having been cleaned each day and fresh towels. The only real issue we had was on organising transport to the airport at the end of our stay. We had asked reception the day before leaving, what the best way to get to JFK was (as we had flown into Newark on the way there). We were assured they could book us a cab no problem, and we didn’t need to book anything in advance as a taxi could be there within 2 minutes. So we spent our last day enjoying the city, but arrived back to the lobby packed with people complaining that their taxis hadn’t arrived! When we asked reception to book us one, they said there are no taxis available, so I explained what we had been told the day before and he told us to go out on the street and hail a cab. Being two girls on our own, on a Friday night with our luggage, we didn’t fancy this! Eventually we spoke to the manager on duty who was really helpful and she managed to get us a car, but it cost us more than we were initially quoted and was an anxious end to our trip. We would have been happy to get the train, but as reception had told us it was so easy for them to get us a cab we didn’t look into other transport options! Apart from this, and the slow lifts, it was a great, clean and comfortable place to stay right in the centre of town.

the hotel is located in a grate place. 2 minutes from time square.the room is a little bit small but nice. grate shower, hot water. if you want the hotel to keep your luggage , you have to pay 2$ per piece.

We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel, and absolutely loved it. Our room on the 5th floor was perfect for us and our stay. Excellent location, literally just around the corner from Times Square, spacious room, and a huge comfortable bed. Air con/heater in our room was great and well used. The room contained so much more than we were expecting, and we heard no noise from outside at all. Every member of staff that we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. If we are lucky enough to return to NYC, we would definitely stay here again. The beautiful Christmas decorations in the lobby, made it even more perfect!

SmallNoisy.Dirty.Great location though.I literally want my money back to go stay somewhere else. Couple more days of this. It’s disgusting. Dirt in the bed.Shower was dirty.Dented headboard.Shelf in shower was broken.Tv screen very fuzzy.Bedding and towels smell funny. Lifts take an age to arrive but to be honest that’s the same in most hotels.I stay away on business 3-4 times a week but I’d put this place on par with the 2* Easy Hotels in the UK that are £30 a night. You can’t even put your washbag anywhere in the bathroom.Space in cupboard for one suitcase and you have to fall over the other one in the tiny room.I’ve attached some photos so far of my stay. If staff read this and can move me in to a better room I’ll give you a better review.

We stayed at this hotel after booking a package with British Airways. When arriving we were so happy with the location, unfortunately that's where the positivity ended!The staff treated us in a way that was just not acceptable. Unfriendly, rude and pretty much uninterested in anything we had to say to the point where they would just look at you and shake there head when asking them any question.The lifts took an absolute age to get to our floor.Our room was very small, but that was ok as we didn't spend much time in it. However sharing the room with an ants nest wasn't to pleasant and when I tried to have a conversation with front of house they were not interested in helping at all.We paid just over £97 for tax, which we expected after looking into the hotel, but today I have got home to see they have also charged me just over £14 for something else without even telling me what it was for!We had a great time in new York, it's a big shame that this hotel spoilt it at times.If you are looking to stay somewhere in times square then I would suggest it's not here.No one in this hotel cares about how it's customers feel and made us feel so unwelcome.

Wow. How pleased we chose this hotel. Right by time square but a couple of streets away so less noise.Literally couldn’t fault it Very good value for location and friendly helpful staff Made the trip to NYC perfect !

I was a bit dubious after reading some of the reviews, but I can honestly say I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was not huge and the bathroom was small but the amount of time we spent in the room it didn’t matter. Check in was easy and the staff on reception were polite. The housekeepers were fabulous, so friendly and helpful. The lifts are small and a bit slow but if you need help with your luggage you only have to ask. You literally walk to the end of the road and you are in Times Square. The temperature in the room was fine, the tv worked ok although not a great picture and the beds were comfortable and clean. I would definitely stay here again.

We have just left this hotel from a 4 night break. We enjoyed our stay here and without a doubt stay here again. Okay, our room was small but it was only to sleep in. The bed was comfortable and very clean. Our room was clean every day and towels were changed. The staff were very friendly. Thank you all for a wonderful stay.

If you have not already booked this hotel, then DON'T!!! The hotel is relatively clean and basic, but it is in need of major investment, an uplift in facilities and a overhaul of the front of house staff.The positives first - The basic rooms are clean and kept tidy by hard working house keeping staff. The lobby is spacious and makes for a nice entrance, however that's where the positives end.The negatives - The heater in our room was broken and blowing cold air until we managed to get staff to fix it after a long argument over it supposedly taking time for the 'old building to heat up'. The water supply is cold in an evening and takes 10 mins to actually warm up prior to being able to take a shower. The lifts are tiny, overused and so it takes 10 mins for one to arrive on the relevant level. Whatsmore, when we tried the stairway it was apparently blocked for painting work even though it is meant to be a functioning fire exit. On check out the concierge, who we asked to book a ride to the airport was the least helpful man in the U.S, rude and unhelpful. To finish, check out peak times are horrendous, the lobby turns into a fight for space and people and luggage all over the place.4/10 - Not worth the price.

I Booked a reservation for a family room for 6 people one year in advance and checked multiple times through the year to verify the confirmation. I even called 4 days in advance to confirm the Family room. We checked in and were told that it was not available and they tried to say Oh but we can give you two rooms next each other and you now have 2 bathrooms ? We do not care about the bathrooms we want to be all together in the Family Room since we do not get together but once a year in NYC. And what is the purpose of making a reservation ? Extremely disappointed and then for our troubles they took off a whole 50.00 . Wow not what I expected. very disappointing.

great location, staff lovely very clean. noise from traffic was bad. there was a long wait for the lift in the mornings even took the stairs one morning and was on the 14th floor, but overall had a great stay

Good location, clean hotel ,pleasant staff, only problem is the lifts always seems to be one out of order sometimes waiting over ten minutes for a lift to arrive , apart from that quality place to stay

Great location and staff was exceptionally friendly. Room was quite small and the elevators were inadequate for the hotel. Had to wait up to 10 minutes during checkout time. Beds were very comfortable. Definitely a 3 star hotel.

The hotel is in a great location, just off the corner of time square. That was a huge appeal for us as it saves a lot of fuss about finding your way round or back after a day of exploring. The hotel staff I felt weren't always very friendly or welcoming, which was disappointing as they were our first view into New York. The room was fine for what we needed, it had a bed - it was very small - and a shower. It wasn't really very big but it served as somewhere to get our heads down which was what we needed. The room (even in December) was extremely warm, and the air conditioning unit in order to have it up high enough to make any difference was extremely loud. It was a choice between sleeping or being cool at times! I was disappointed on our final night that some sort of maintenance work was being done at 7am right outside our room - I'd expect a hotel to appreciate people might have been up late, or perhaps be sleeping after travelling and to perhaps start at a more reasonable hour. Or perhaps a drinks voucher for the inconvenience? Overall, the hotel is fine. It's not glamorous, but our room was clean and tidy, and it had what we needed to get by and for the location of it we were happy with that.

We arrived Friday 30th November to a smooth check in and straight to room 1021. Room was overlooking street and well equipped with set of drawers, wardrobe, ironing board & iron, safe, TV and hairdryer. The en-suite was bijou and adequate. On the second day we reported our air con, hairdryer and TV weren’t working and was offered another room if they were unable to fix the issues. When we got back to hotel everything was fixed/replaced. Fantastic!!! So quick and always with a smile. Loved the lobby area. Made my birthday and the start of our year of 25th wedding anniversary celebrations memorable. Thank you!

Loved this hotel it was awesome I won this trip on the Price is Right and the location was was amazing!! Best part of my trip was Trish who worked the front desk she took care of all my needs and was so lovely thank you Trish for all you did!! All I can say is every morning when I came down and saw Trishs smiling face I knew I was going to have an awesome day!! Thanks To Trish and the Gallivant Times Square

Well located in Broadway - Times Square. Family rooms appropiate for families as well as friend group. Clean, good matresses. The only problem is the elevators' availability specially during the mornings

Does what it "says on the tin". Excellent location, clean, efficient, met all expectations. Like all NYC hotels, expensive but not more so than others in the area. Staff efficient. Air con worked very well, if a little noisy.

Firstly, the positives: Excellent location near everything in Times Square. We booked this hotel through bookit.com and arrived at midnight to find out that the manager had given away our suite and replaced it with two rooms. When I explained that I was traveling with teens and did not want them to be alone they told me they could give me a refund and "you could sleep outside". WHAT???? I accepted the two rooms and was shocked to see that the queen bed room was dirty (thank goodness I travel with wipes) as the garbages were not even emptied. The King bed room had a broken bed. I was disgusted. The next morning I spoke with Ben (the manager) and he was apologetic and said that he would "take care of it" I was given the room that I contracted for but to date have not heard from him or my refund for the horrible night spent. I hated to have to make a scene and complain on what was supposed to be a wonderful weekend.

We were only in town for 2 nights, so this place was ok for that. No remote for our TV, which took a while after asking for it twice & then calling down again to ask for it & the fan in our bathroom didn't work, which for a very small bath & small room, that's not good. The front of the hotel had construction being done so being woke up @ 7am to banging wasn't great. I had also booked (by phone) a double twin bed room since my 18yr old son was w/me, they gave me a king room instead saying "sorry, someone extended their stay & they're in the room that you reserved". The hotel is quaint and central to everything, they just need to fix a few things (you can tell maintenance is an issue as all guests were complaining) & give you the room that you reserved.

It's a clean functional 3* hotel that is within a stones throw of times Square.Rooms are small and mine had a double bed which was comfortable if on the small side thankfully I was traveling alone. Room was hot even in December, I just left the window open during the day when I was out. Room has an iron, safe and tea and coffee making facilities, but the coffee shop opposite the hotel is great and gives a discount for hotel guests. Yes it's noisy but it's in Manhattan what do you expect!

The room was atrociously small. We weren’t expecting much for being downtown New York, but my husband could touch three walls by standing in one spot. It was a super small double bed. You literally had to move the TV out of the way to walk into the bathroom. Resort fees are a bit of a joke but I get it, Times Square. The front desk couldn’t dare crack a smile or be even remotely slightly helpful when asked questions. Our room was clean and the cleaning staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is also very good. The parking associated with the hotel is right across the road and was very convenient.

Firstly I would like to point out that this review would have got 4 stars from me if I were just to base it on the hotel and location. When I booked this hotel via Jet2 I opted to pay for room and breakfast. To add breakfast for 2 people for 4 nights cost an extra £189 so I thought rather than go out searching for a restaurant in the morning It would be more convenient to eat in the hotel and head out from there. I was given coupons from reception which I had to hand in to the restaurant before breakfast. the first morning I handed in our coupons only to be told that I was only entitled to a continental breakfast. I explained that I had pre paid for breakfast and was expecting a full breakfast. Waitress explained that in order to get a full Breakfast I would need to pay another $10 per day. Without wanting to cause too much of a scene I gave her $10 and found a table. To my surprise the full breakfast was a few tiny sausages. scraps of Bacon and cold scrambled Egg. The following day we just had continental. on the final morning I was eating my Breakfast, and I was interrupted by the waitress who asked me why I had got cheese. Bearing in mind the cheese was 2 slices placed on a saucer and wrapped in cling film. I said I was just having the continental Breakfast. She then told me that the cheese was not included in the continental Breakfast and then took it away from me and put it back on the Breakfast bar. I found this very embarrassing and confusing. To me a continental breakfast always included Cheese/Ham/ Bread etc. The breakfast is very limited at the hotel but to be honest I never went hungry. However you can opt to pay for breakfast at the hotel which would have been a lot cheaper than what I paid. Moaning aside. I thought the hotel was fine. the rooms were small but clean and adequate to be honest. could not fault the location as its right In the heart of times square. Would I go back? Probably, but I would not use the restaurant for breakfast as it just wasn't value for money and the staff have really put me off with their unprofessionalism.

We refused to stay in this hotel. We were allocated a room on the 15th floor which had 2 double beds, 1 had disgusting stains around the base cover and the other was sagging in the middle. The radiator cover was cracked and looked filthy and the sofa cover was stained with goodness know what. I couldn’t have slept in that room as it looked filthy on first inspection so I wasn’t taking the chance on what may have been lurking on the mattress! When we asked if we could change rooms the guy on reception actually sniggered and said there was none available. The duty manager eventually sorted things out by issuing a full refund so we could be on our way and find another hotel. To top it all the lift doors stuck on the 15th floor when we went back up to the room to get our cases so we had to press the floor below to get out! The reception staff need customer service training and you don’t pay good money to be patronised or made to feel you’ve done something wrong by refusing to stay in a filthy room.We were asked to email the duty manager with our complaint which we have done. The hotel has not responded to our email, but yet we have since had 3 emails from the hotel ‘thanking us for our stay’ and asking us to leave a review!Don’t waste your money the hotel is not cheap and there are other great quality hotels with well trained staff nearby - as we found out!

When I booked the reviews were great, not so good the week before traveling so I almost changed my mind. Glad I didn’t. Stayed 5 nights. The reception was clean and modern and decorated for Christmas, the staff were welcoming. Check in was easy and the room was ready early- 2 hours before their stated check in time. The lifts were slower than some but on 11 out of the 12 times used it wasn’t a problem. Didn’t eat here so can’t comment on food. Coffee pods in the room was good but the powdered creamer was disgusting so get some fresh milk! Our room was on the 12th floor and must have been refurbished as it had a modern contemporary feel to it. Spacious room with en-suite shower room. Large walk in shower. Miniature bottles of shampoo, conditioner and body lotion- no shower gel but I’d seen the reviews so taken my own. Towels were replaced every day and were only bath towel size rather than bath sheet size , but there were hand towels too. Personally would prefer a larger towel! The room was very warm and the air con was noisy and unit didn’t look the cleanest so didn’t want to keep it on in case it was harbouring germs. The windows were probably over due for replacement, we left ours open a fraction and you could hear street noise but we were in Times Square and you soon blocked the traffic noise out. The bed was comfortable, sheets replaced every day, it was an average double, but not complaining like others have. TV had poor reception but I wasn’t there to stay in and watch TV. Standard things in the room were there, safe , hairdryer, iron and ironing board. Overall a very good hotel experience. Clean and comfortable. Check out swift and the bag storage was $2 per bag for the day. Location was fabulous. New York brilliant.

Overall the room was decent. Check my in was fast and easy. The room was clean and comfortable as well. The street noise at night was sometimes very loud but this is expected considering it is so close to Times Square. Location is the best as most of the tourist attractions are in walking distance. We were mostly only in our room when we finished a long day in the city and were ready for bed so it was perfect for us.

We booked a room with 2 double deds and we did say it was for a celebratory event (travelling with our 18 year old son for his first visit to NYC). On arrival we were disappointed from the welcome for the reception staff, there was no bellhop and we were handed 3 bottles of water to carry (along with all of our luggage) to the room.On inspection of the room the sofa cover was filthy - deep stains and looked very unhygienic, the radiator cover was broken & looked dirty, the bed cover/dressing was marked and stained. I didn’t even venture into the bathroom. We asked reception if we could move but quite frankly they were uninterested just kind of sniggered when I asked if that was the best room available and then said they would call the manager to sort it out. After persuasion the duty manager did process a full refund as the hotel was fully booked however it spoiled our initial arrival and especially the parting words from reception saying ‘have a great birthday & don’t let this spoil things for you - start afresh tomorrow in a new hotel’ beyond belief! We were asked to email pictures to the duty manager which we did but have not even received a courtesy email back! We have since received an email from the manager asking us to ‘rate our stay’ hence this review!

Old shabby needs good refit. Rooms tiny and dark very loud traffic windows old. Bathroom terrible cracks in bathroom furniture bathroom door rooting. The only positive thing was location. Would not recommend it to anyoneSome staff were ok most rude didn’t make you feel welcome

.small rooms, pitiful wifi, small beds, noisy doors, old and slow elevator, do not be fooled by the price. Drain that did not drain water from the bath. We found rubbish under the bed. Bad team, they just did something for money. The worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

Stayed for 5 nights rooms small but clean with somewhat dated furnishings. Staff friendly and helpful. Lighting in rooms not good and decor needs lightening up. Local NYFD very close and audible. That said location is great with lots of eateries and bars etc close by. Overall not a bad place to stay.

We’re just back from a fantastic 4 night stay at the hotel. Prior to arriving I had emailed the hotel saying it was my mums birthday. On arrival, they had sorted out a bottle of wine, balloon and card for her. It was a lovely touch! The desk staff were very knowledgeable and recommended places to eat. We had a family room on the 12th floor and it was amazing. Very spacious and comfortably slept 4 adults. As other reviewers have mentioned, the lift is slow however it’s not that much of an inconvenience and you can always go down the stairs if you’re in a rush. We didn’t have breakfast in the attached restaurant but we did have an evening meal and it was lovely. The hotel is very well located within a few minutes walk to Times Square. I would definitely recommend and would happily stay here again. Thanks for a lovely stay!
user_name:
Sarah R
Nottingham, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Great location just off Times Square. Rooms are super small with horrible lighting even in the bathroom and the hallways were extremely hot. Really long waits for an elevator because only one worked most of our stay. The ice machine was out of order on our floor and the 10th floor room was being used as storage, so I had to go to the 7th floor for ice which wasn't convenient since the elevators didn't work. Staff was friendly and especially the housekeeping lady on the 15th floor. I understand that room size can't be changed, but lighting, climate control, ice machines and elevators can and should be.
